verses.text: The sacrifice of praise shall glorify Me; and there is the way in which I shall show him My salvation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 22:34
verses.text: ' Accordingly He neither takes sacrifices from you nor commanded them at first to be offered because they are needful to Him, but because of your sins.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 22:35
verses.text: For indeed the temple, which is called the temple in Jerusalem, He admitted to be His house or court, not as though He needed it, but in order that you, in this view of it, giving yourselves to Him, might not worship idols.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 22:36
verses.text: And that this is so, Isaiah says: 'What house have ye built Me? saith the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 22:37
verses.text: Heaven is My throne, and earth is My footstool.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:1
verses.text: Chapter 23 — The opinion of the Jews regarding the law does an injury to God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:2
verses.text: "But if we do not admit this, we shall be liable to fall into foolish opinions, as if it were not the same God who existed in the times of Enoch and all the rest, who neither were circumcised after the flesh, nor observed Sabbaths, nor any other rites, seeing that Moses enjoined such observances; or that God has not wished each race of mankind continually to perform the same righteous actions: to admit which, seems to be ridiculous and absurd.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:3
verses.text: Therefore we must confess that He, who is ever the same, has commanded these and such like institutions on account of sinful men, and we must declare Him to be benevolent, foreknowing, needing nothing, righteous and good.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:4
verses.text: But if this be not so, tell me, sir, what you think of those matters which we are investigating".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:5
verses.text: And when no one responded: "Wherefore, Trypho, I will proclaim to you, and to those who wish to become proselytes, the divine message which I heard from that man.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:6
verses.text: Do you see that the elements are not idle, and keep no Sabbaths? Remain as you were born.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:7
verses.text: For if there was no need of circumcision before Abraham, or of the observance of Sabbaths, of feasts and sacrifices, before Moses; no more need is there of them now, after that, according to the will of God, Jesus Christ the Son of God has been born without sin, of a virgin sprung from the stock of Abraham.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:8
verses.text: For when Abraham himself was in uncircumcision, he was justified and blessed by reason of the faith which he reposed in God, as the Scripture tells.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:9
verses.text: Moreover, the Scriptures and the facts themselves compel us to admit that He received circumcision for a sign, and not for righteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:10
verses.text: So that it was justly recorded concerning the people, that the soul which shall not be circumcised on the eighth day shall be cut off from his family.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:11
verses.text: And, furthermore, the inability of the female sex to receive fleshly circumcision, proves that this circumcision has been given for a sign, and not for a work of righteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 23:12
verses.text: For God has given likewise to women the ability to observe all things which are righteous and virtuous; but we see that the bodily form of the male has been made different from the bodily form of the female; yet we know that neither of them is righteous or unrighteous merely for this cause, but is considered righteous by reason of piety and righteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 24:1
verses.text: Chapter 24 — The Christians' circumcision far more excellent.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 24:2
verses.text: "Now, sirs," I said, "it is possible for us to show how the eighth day possessed a certain mysterious import, which the seventh day did not possess, and which was promulgated by God through these rites.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 24:3
verses.text: But lest I appear now to diverge to other subjects, understand what I say: the blood of that circumcision is obsolete, and we trust in the blood of salvation; there is now another covenant, and another law has gone forth from Zion.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 24:4
verses.text: Jesus Christ circumcises all who will—as was declared above — with knives of stone; that they may be a righteous nation, a people keeping faith, holding to the truth, and maintaining peace.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 24:5
verses.text: Come then with me, all who fear God, who wish to see the good of Jerusalem.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 24:6
verses.text: Come, let us go to the light of the Lord; for He has liberated His people, the house of Jacob.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 24:7
verses.text: Come, all nations; let us gather ourselves together at Jerusalem, no longer plagued by war for the sins of her people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 24:8
verses.text: 'For I was manifest to them that sought Me not; I was found of them that asked not for Me;' He exclaims by Isaiah: 'I said, Behold Me, unto nations which were not called by My name.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 24:9
verses.text: I have spread out My hands all the day unto a disobedient and gainsaying people, which walked in a way that was not good, but after their own sins.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 24:10
verses.text: It is a people that provoketh Me to my face.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:1
verses.text: Chapter 25 — The Jews boast in vain that they are sons of Abraham.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:2
verses.text: "Those who justify themselves, and say they are sons of Abraham, shall be desirous even in a small degree to receive the inheritance along with you; as the Holy Spirit, by the mouth of Isaiah, cries, speaking thus while he personates them: 'Return from heaven, and behold from the habitation of Thy holiness and glory.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:3
verses.text: Where is Thy zeal and strength? Where is the multitude of Thy mercy? for Thou hast sustained us, O Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:4
verses.text: For Thou art our Father, because Abraham is ignorant of us, and Israel has not recognised us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:5
verses.text: But Thou, O Lord, our Father, deliver us: from the beginning Thy name is upon us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:6
verses.text: O Lord, why hast Thou made us to err from Thy way? and hardened our hearts, so that we do not fear Thee? Return for Thy servants' sake, the tribes of Thine inheritance, that we may inherit for a little Thy holy mountain.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:7
verses.text: We were as from the beginning, when Thou didst not bear rule over us, and when Thy name was not called upon us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:8
verses.text: If Thou wilt open the heavens, trembling shall seize the mountains before Thee: and they shall be melted, as wax melts before the fire; and fire shall consume the adversaries, and Thy name shall be manifest among the adversaries; the nations shall be put into disorder before Thy face.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:9
verses.text: When Thou shall do glorious things, trembling shall seize the mountains before Thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:10
verses.text: From the beginning we have not heard, nor have our eyes seen a God besides Thee: and Thy works, the mercy which Thou shall show to those who repent.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:11
verses.text: He shall meet those who do righteousness, and they shall remember Thy ways.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:12
verses.text: Behold, Thou art wroth, and we were sinning.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:13
verses.text: Therefore we have erred and become all unclean, and all our righteousness is as the rags of a woman set apart: and we have faded away like leaves by reason of our iniquities; thus the wind will take us away.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:14
verses.text: And there is none that calleth upon Thy name, or remembers to take hold of Thee; for Thou hast turned away Thy face from us, and hast given us up on account of our sins.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:15
verses.text: And now return, O Lord, for we are all Thy people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:16
verses.text: The city of Thy holiness has become desolate.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:17
verses.text: Zion has become as a wilderness, Jerusalem a curse; the house, our holiness, and the glory which our fathers blessed, has been burned with fire; and all the glorious nations have fallen along with it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:18
verses.text: And in addition to these misfortunes, O Lord, Thou hast refrained Thyself, and art silent, and hast humbled us very much.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 25:19
verses.text: ' "  And Trypho remarked, "What is this you say? that none of us shall inherit anything on the holy mountain of God?".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:1
verses.text: Chapter 26 — No salvation to the Jews except through Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:2
verses.text: And I replied, "I do not say so; but those who have persecuted and do persecute Christ, if they do not repent, shall not inherit anything on the holy mountain.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:3
verses.text: But the Gentiles, who have believed on Him, and have repented of the sins which they have committed, they shall receive the inheritance along with the patriarchs and the prophets, and the just men who are descended from Jacob, even although they neither keep the Sabbath, nor are circumcised, nor observe the feasts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:4
verses.text: Assuredly they shall receive the holy inheritance of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:5
verses.text: For God speaks by Isaiah thus: 'I, the Lord God, have called Thee in righteousness, and will hold Thine hand, and will strengthen Thee; and I have given Thee for a covenant of the people, for a light of the Gentiles, to open the eyes of the blind, to bring out them that are bound from the chains, and those who sit in darkness from the prison-house.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:6
verses.text: ' And again: 'Lift up a standard for the people; for, lo, the Lord has made it heard unto the end of the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:7
verses.text: Say ye to the daughters of Zion, Behold, thy Saviour has come; having His reward, and His work before His face: and He shall call it a holy nation, redeemed by the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:8
verses.text: And thou shalt be called a city sought out, and not forsaken.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:9
verses.text: Who is this that cometh from Edom? in red garments from Bosor? This that is beautiful in apparel, going up with great strength? I speak righteousness, and the judgment of salvation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:10
verses.text: Why are Thy garments red, and Thine apparel as from the trodden wine-press? Thou art full of the trodden grape.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:11
verses.text: I have trodden the wine-press all alone, and of the people there is no man with Me; and I have trampled them in fury, and crushed them to the ground, and spilled their blood on the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:12
verses.text: For the day of retribution has come upon them, and the year of redemption is present.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 26:13
verses.text: And I looked, and there was none to help; and I considered, and none assisted: and My arm delivered; and My fury came on them, and I trampled them in My fury, and spilled their blood on the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 27:1
verses.text: Chapter 27 — Why God taught the same things by the prophets as by Moses.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 27:2
verses.text: And Trypho said, "Why do you select and quote whatever you wish from the prophetic writings, but do not refer to those which expressly command the Sabbath to be observed? For Isaiah thus speaks: 'If thou shalt turn away thy foot from the Sabbaths, so as not to do thy pleasure on the holy day, and shalt call the Sabbaths the holy delights of thy God; if thou shalt not lift thy foot to work, and shalt not speak a word from thine own mouth; then thou shalt trust in the Lord, and He shall cause thee to go up to the good things of the land; and He shall feed thee with the inheritance of Jacob thy father: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 27:3
verses.text: ' "  And I replied, "I have passed them by, my friends, not because such prophecies were contrary to me, but because you have understood, and  do understand, that although God commands you by all the prophets to do the same things which He also commanded by Moses, it was on account of the hardness of your hearts, and your ingratitude towards Him, that He continually proclaims them, in order that, even in this way, if you repented, you might please Him, and neither sacrifice your children to demons, nor be partakers with thieves, nor lovers of gifts, nor hunters after revenge, nor fail in doing judgment for orphans, nor be inattentive to the justice due to the widow nor have your hands full of blood.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 27:4
verses.text: 'For the daughters of Zion have walked with a high neck, both sporting by winking with their eyes, and sweeping along their dresses.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 27:5
verses.text: For they are all gone aside,' He exclaims, 'they are all become useless.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 27:6
verses.text: There is none that understands, there is not so much as one.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 27:7
verses.text: With their tongues they have practised deceit, their throat is an open sepulchre, the poison of asps is under their lips, destruction and misery are in their paths, and the way of peace they have not known.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 27:8
verses.text: ' So that, as in the beginning, these things were enjoined you because of your wickedness, in like manner because of your stedfastness in it, or rather your increased proneness to it, by means of the same precepts He calls you to a remembrance or knowledge of it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 27:9
verses.text: But you are a people hard-hearted and without understanding, both blind and lame, children in whom is no faith, as He Himself says, honouring Him only with your lips, far from Him in your hearts, teaching doctrines that are your own and not His.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 27:10
verses.text: For, tell me, did God wish the priests to sin when they offer the sacrifices on the Sabbaths? or those to sin, who are circumcised and do circumcise on the Sabbaths; since He commands that on the eighth day—even though it happen to be a Sabbath— those who are born shall be always circumcised? or could not the infants be operated upon one day previous or one day subsequent to the Sabbath, if He knew that it is a sinful act upon the Sabbaths? Or why did He not teach those—who are called righteous and pleasing to Him, who lived before Moses and Abraham, who were not circumcised in their foreskin, and observed no Sabbaths—to keep these institutions?".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:1
verses.text: Chapter 28 — True righteousness is obtained by Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:2
verses.text: And Trypho replied, "We heard you adducing this consideration a little ago, and we have given it attention: for, to tell the truth, it is worthy of attention; and that answer which pleases most — namely, that so it seemed good to Him—does not satisfy me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:3
verses.text: For this is ever the shift to which those have recourse who are unable to answer the question".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:4
verses.text: Then I said, "Since I bring from the Scriptures and the facts themselves both the proofs and the inculcation of them, do not delay or hesitate to put faith in me, although I am an uncircumcised man; so short a time is left you in which to become proselytes.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:5
verses.text: If Christ's coming shall have anticipated you, in vain you will repent, in vain you will weep; for He will not hear you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:6
verses.text: 'Break up your fallow ground,' Jeremiah has cried to the people, 'and sow not among thorns.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:7
verses.text: Circumcise yourselves to the Lord, and circumcise the foreskin of your heart.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:8
verses.text: ' Do not sow, therefore, among thorns, and in untilled ground, whence you can have no fruit.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:9
verses.text: Know Christ; and behold the fallow ground, good, good and fat, is in your hearts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:10
verses.text: 'For, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will visit all them that are circumcised in their foreskins; Egypt, and Judah, and Edom, and the sons of Moab.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:11
verses.text: For all the nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in their hearts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:12
verses.text: ' Do you see how that God does not mean this circumcision which is given for a sign? For it is of no use to the Egyptians, or the sons of Moab, or the sons of Edom.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:13
verses.text: But though a man be a Scythian or a Persian, if he has the knowledge of God and of His Christ, and keeps the everlasting righteous decrees, he is circumcised with the good and useful circumcision, and is a friend of God, and God rejoices in his gifts and offerings.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:14
verses.text: But I will lay before you, my friends, the very words of God, when He said to the people by Malachi, one of the twelve prophets, 'I have no pleasure in you, saith the Lord; and I shall not accept your sacrifices at your hands: for from the rising of the sun unto its setting My name shall be glorified among the Gentiles; and in every place a sacrifice is offered unto My name, even a pure sacrifice: for My name is honoured among the Gentiles, saith the Lord; but ye profane it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 28:15
verses.text: ' And by David He said, 'A people whom I have not known, served Me; at the hearing of the ear they obeyed Me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 29:1
verses.text: Chapter 29 — Christ is useless to those who observe the law.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 29:2
verses.text: "Let us glorify God, all nations gathered together; for He has also visited us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 29:3
verses.text: Let us glorify Him by the King of glory, by the Lord of hosts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 29:4
verses.text: For He has been gracious towards the Gentiles also; and our sacrifices He esteems more grateful than yours.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 29:5
verses.text: What need, then, have I of circumcision, who have been witnessed to by God? What need have I of that other baptism, who have been baptized with the Holy Ghost? I think that while I mention this, I would persuade even those who are possessed of scanty intelligence.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 29:6
verses.text: For these words have neither been prepared by me, nor embellished by the art of man; but David sung them, Isaiah preached them, Zechariah proclaimed them, and Moses wrote them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 29:7
verses.text: Are you acquainted with them, Trypho? They are contained in your Scriptures, or rather not yours, but ours.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 29:8
verses.text: For we believe them; but you, though you read them, do not catch the spirit that is in them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 29:9
verses.text: Be not offended at, or reproach us with, the bodily uncircumcision with which God has created us; and think it not strange that we drink hot water on the Sabbaths, since God directs the government of the universe on this day equally as on all others; and the priests, as on other days, so on this, are ordered to offer sacrifices; and there are so many righteous men who have performed none of these legal ceremonies, and yet are witnessed to by God Himself.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 30:1
verses.text: Chapter 30 — Christians possess the true righteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 30:2
verses.text: "But impute it to your own wickedness, that God even can be accused by those who have no understanding, of not having always instructed all in the same righteous statutes.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 30:3
verses.text: For such institutions seemed to be unreasonable and unworthy of God to many men, who had not received grace to know that your nation were called to conversion and repentance of spirit, while they were in a sinful condition and labouring under spiritual disease; and that the prophecy which was announced subsequent to the death of Moses is everlasting.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 30:4
verses.text: And this is mentioned in the Psalm, my friends.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 30:5
verses.text: And that we, who have been made wise by them, confess that the statutes of the Lord are sweeter than honey and the honey-comb, is manifest from the fact that, though threatened with death, we do not deny His name.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 30:6
verses.text: Moreover, it is also manifest to all, that we who believe in Him pray to be kept by Him from strange,  i-e:, from wicked and deceitful, spirits; as the word of prophecy, personating one of those who believe in Him, figuratively declares.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 30:7
verses.text: For we do continually beseech God by Jesus Christ to preserve us from the demons which are hostile to the worship of God, and whom we of old time served, in order that, after our conversion by Him to God, we may be blameless.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 30:8
verses.text: For we call Him Helper and Redeemer, the power of whose name even the demons do fear; and at this day, when they are exorcised in the name of Jesus Christ, crucified under Pontius Pilate, governor of Judaea, they are overcome.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 30:9
verses.text: And thus it is manifest to all, that His Father has given Him so great power, by virtue of which demons are subdued to His name, and to the dispensation of His suffering.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:1
verses.text: Chapter 31 — If Christ's power be now so great, how much greater at the second advent!  "But if so great a power is shown to have followed and to be still following the dispensation of His suffering, how great shall that be which shall follow His glorious advent! For He shall come on the clouds as the Son of man, so Daniel foretold, and His angels shall come with Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:2
verses.text: These are the words: 'I beheld till the thrones were set; and the Ancient of days did sit, whose garment was white as snow, and the hair of His head like the pure wool.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:3
verses.text: His throne was like a fiery flame, His wheels as burning fire.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:4
verses.text: A fiery stream issued and came forth from before Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:5
verses.text: Thousand thousands ministered unto Him, and ten thousand times ten thousand stood before Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:6
verses.text: The books were opened, and the judgment was set.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:7
verses.text: I beheld then the voice of the great words which the horn speaks: and the beast was beat down, and his body destroyed, and given to the burning flame.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:8
verses.text: And the rest of the beasts were taken away from their dominion, and a period of life was given to the beasts until a season and time.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:9
verses.text: I saw in the vision of the night, and, behold, one like the Son of man coming with the clouds of heaven; and He came to the Ancient of days, and stood before Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:10
verses.text: And they who stood by brought Him near; and there were given Him power and kingly honour, and all nations of the earth by their families, and all glory, serve Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:11
verses.text: And His dominion is an everlasting dominion, which shall not be taken away; and His kingdom shall not be destroyed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:12
verses.text: And my spirit was chilled within my frame, and the visions of my head troubled me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:13
verses.text: I came near unto one of them that stood by, and inquired the precise meaning of all these things.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:14
verses.text: In answer he speaks to me, and showed me the judgment of the matters: These great beasts are four kingdoms, which shall perish from the earth, and shall not receive dominion for ever, even for ever and ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:15
verses.text: Then I wished to know exactly about the fourth beast, which destroyed all the others and was very terrible, its teeth of iron, and its nails of brass; which devoured, made waste, and stamped the residue with its feet: also about the ten horns upon its head, and of the one which came up, by means of which three of the former fell.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:16
verses.text: And that horn had eyes, and a mouth speaking great things; and its countenance excelled the rest.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:17
verses.text: And I beheld that horn waging war against the saints, and prevailing against them, until the Ancient of days came; and He gave judgment for the saints of the Most High.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:18
verses.text: And the time came, and the saints of the Most High possessed the kingdom.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:19
verses.text: And it was told me concerning the fourth beast: There shall be a fourth kingdom upon earth, which shall prevail over all these kingdoms, and shall devour the whole earth, and shall destroy and make it thoroughly waste.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:20
verses.text: And the ten horns are ten kings that shall arise; and one shall arise after them; and he shall surpass the first in evil deeds, and he shall subdue three kings, and he shall speak words against the Most High, and shall overthrow the rest of the saints of the Most High, and shall expect to change the seasons and the times.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:21
verses.text: And it shall be delivered into his hands for a time, and times, and half a time.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:22
verses.text: And the judgment sat, and they shall take away his dominion, to consume and to destroy it unto the end.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:23
verses.text: And the kingdom, and the power, and the great places of the kingdoms under the heavens, were given to the holy people of the Most High, to reign in an everlasting kingdom: and all powers shall be subject to Him, and shall obey Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:24
verses.text: Hitherto is the end of the matter.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 31:25
verses.text: I, Daniel, was possessed with a very great astonishment, and my speech was changed in me; yet I kept the matter in my heart.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:1
verses.text: Chapter 32 — Trypho objecting that Christ is described as glorious by Daniel, Justin distinguishes two advents.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:2
verses.text: And when I had ceased, Trypho said, "These and such like Scriptures, sir, compel us to wait for Him who, as Son of man, receives from the Ancient of days the everlasting kingdom.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:3
verses.text: But this so-called Christ of yours was dishonourable and inglorious, so much so that the last curse contained in the law of God fell on him, for he was crucified".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:4
verses.text: Then I replied to him, "If, sirs, it were not said by the Scriptures which I have already quoted, that His form was inglorious, and His generation not declared, and that for His death the rich would suffer death, and with His stripes we should be healed, and that He would be led away like a sheep; and if I had not explained that there would be two advents of His,—one in which He was pierced by you; a second, when you shall know Him whom you have pierced, and your tribes shall mourn, each tribe by itself, the women apart, and the men apart,—then I must have been speaking dubious and obscure things.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:5
verses.text: But now, by means of the contents of those Scriptures esteemed holy and prophetic amongst you, I attempt to prove all that I have adduced, in the hope that some one of you may be found to be of that remnant which has been left by the grace of the Lord of Sabaoth for the eternal salvation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:6
verses.text: In order, therefore, that the matter inquired into may be plainer to you, I will mention to you other words also spoken by the blessed David, from which you will perceive that the Lord is called the Christ by the Holy Spirit of prophecy; and that the Lord, the Father of all, has brought Him again from the earth, setting Him at His own right hand, until He makes His enemies His footstool; which indeed happens from the time that our Lord Jesus Christ ascended to heaven, after He rose again from the dead, the times now running on to their consummation; and he whom Daniel foretells would have dominion for a time, and times, and an half, is even already at the door, about to speak blasphemous and daring things against the Most High.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:7
verses.text: But you, being ignorant of how long he will have dominion, hold another opinion.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:8
verses.text: For you interpret the 'time' as being a hundred years.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:9
verses.text: But if this is so, the man of sin must, at the shortest, reign three hundred and fifty years, in order that we may compute that which is said by the holy Daniel— 'and times'—to be two times only.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:10
verses.text: All this I have said to you in digression, in order that you at length may be persuaded of what has been declared against you by God, that you are foolish sons; and of this, 'Therefore, behold, I will proceed to take away this people, and shall take them away; and I will strip the wise of their wisdom, and will hide the understanding of their prudent men;' and may cease to deceive yourselves and those who hear you, and may learn of us, who have been taught wisdom by the grace of Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:11
verses.text: The words, then, which were spoken by David, are these: 'The Lord said unto My Lord, Sit Thou at My right hand, until I make Thine enemies Thy footstool.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:12
verses.text: The Lord shall send the rod of Thy strength out of Sion: rule Thou also in the midst of Thine enemies.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:13
verses.text: With Thee shall be, in the day, the chief of Thy power, in the beauties of Thy saints.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:14
verses.text: From the womb, before the morning star, have I begotten Thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:15
verses.text: The Lord hath sworn, and will not repent: Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:16
verses.text: The Lord is at Thy right hand: He has crushed kings in the day of His wrath: He shall judge among the heathen, He shall fill with the dead bodies.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 32:17
verses.text: He shall drink of the brook in the way; therefore shall He lift up the head.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:1
verses.text: Chapter 33 — Ps.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:2
verses.text: cx.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:3
verses.text: is not spoken of Hezekiah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:4
verses.text: He proves that Christ was first humble, then shall be glorious.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:5
verses.text: "And," I continued, "I am not ignorant that you venture to expound this psalm as if it referred to king Hezekiah; but that you are mistaken, I shall prove to you from these very words forthwith.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:6
verses.text: 'The Lord hath sworn, and will not repent,' it is said; and, 'Thou art a priest forever, after the order of Melchizedek,' with what follows and precedes.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:7
verses.text: Not even you will venture to object that Hezekiah was either a priest, or is the everlasting priest of God; but that this is spoken of our Jesus, these expressions show.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:8
verses.text: But your ears are shut up, and your hearts are made dull.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:9
verses.text: For by this statement, 'The Lord hath sworn, and will not repent: Thou art a priest for ever, after the order of Melchizedek,' with an oath God has shown Him (on account of your unbelief) to be the High Priest after the order of Melchizedek;  i-e:, as Melchizedek was described by Moses as the priest of the Most High, and he was a priest of those who were in uncircumcision, and blessed the circumcised Abraham who brought him tithes, so God has shown that His everlasting Priest, called also by the Holy Spirit Lord, would be Priest of those in uncircumcision.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:10
verses.text: Those too in circumcision who approach Him, that is, believing Him and seeking blessings from Him, He will both receive and bless.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 33:11
verses.text: And that He shall be first humble as a man, and then exalted, these words at the end of the Psalm show: 'He shall drink of the brook in the way,' and then, 'Therefore shall He lift up the head.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:1
verses.text: Chapter 34 — Nor does Ps.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:2
verses.text: lxxii.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:3
verses.text: apply to Solomon, whose faults Christians shudder at.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:4
verses.text: "Further, to persuade you that you have not understood anything of the Scriptures, I will remind you of another psalm, dictated to David by the Holy Spirit, which you say refers to Solomon, who was also your king.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:5
verses.text: But it refers also to our Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:6
verses.text: But you deceive yourselves by the ambiguous forms of speech.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:7
verses.text: For where it is said, 'The law of the Lord is perfect,' you do not understand it of the law which was to be after Moses, but of the law which was given by Moses, although God declared that He would establish a new law and a new covenant.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:8
verses.text: And where it has been said, 'O God, give Thy judgment to the king,' since Solomon was king, you say that the Psalm refers to him, although the words of the Psalm expressly proclaim that reference is made to the everlasting King,  i-e:, to Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:9
verses.text: For Christ is King, and Priest, and God, and Lord, and angel, and man, and captain, and stone, and a Son born, and first made subject to suffering, then returning to heaven, and again coming with glory, and He is preached as having the everlasting kingdom: so I prove from all the Scriptures.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:10
verses.text: But that you may perceive what I have said, I quote the words of the Psalm; they are these: 'O God, give Thy judgment to the king, and Thy righteousness unto the king's son, to judge Thy people with righteousness, and Thy poor with judgment.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:11
verses.text: The mountains shall take up peace to the people, and the little hills righteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:12
verses.text: He shall judge the poor of the people, and shall save the children of the needy, and shall abase the slanderer.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:13
verses.text: He shall co-endure with the sun, and before the moon unto all generations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:14
verses.text: He shall come down like rain upon the fleece, as drops falling on the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:15
verses.text: In His days shall righteousness flourish, and abundance of peace until the moon be taken away.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:16
verses.text: And He shall have dominion from sea to sea, and from the rivers unto the ends of the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:17
verses.text: Ethiopians shall fall down before Him, and His enemies shall lick the dust.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:18
verses.text: The kings of Tarshish and the isles shall offer gifts; the kings of Arabia and Seba shall offer gifts; and all the kings of the earth shall worship Him, and all the nations shall serve Him: for He has delivered the poor from the man of power, and the needy that hath no helper.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:19
verses.text: He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy: He shall redeem their souls from usury and injustice, and His name shall be honourable before them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:20
verses.text: And He shall live, and to Him shall be given of the gold of Arabia, and they shall pray continually for Him: they shall bless Him all the day.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:21
verses.text: And there shall be a foundation on the earth, it shall be exalted on the tops of the mountains: His fruit shall be on Lebanon, and they of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:22
verses.text: His name shall be blessed for ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:23
verses.text: His name shall endure before the sun; and all tribes of the earth shall be blessed in Him, all nations shall call Him blessed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:24
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things; and blessed be His glorious name for ever, and for ever and ever; and the whole earth shall be filled with His glory, Amen, amen.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:25
verses.text: ' And at the close of this Psalm which I have quoted, it is written, 'The hymns of David the son of Jesse are ended.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:26
verses.text: ' Moreover, that Solomon was a renowned and great king, by whom the temple called that at Jerusalem was built, I know; but that none of those things mentioned in the Psalm happened to him, is evident.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:27
verses.text: For neither did all kings worship him; nor did he reign to the ends of the earth; nor did his enemies, falling before him, lick the dust.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 34:28
verses.text: Nay, also, I venture to repeat what is written in the book of Kings as committed by him, how through a woman's influence he worshipped the idols of Sidon, which those of the Gentiles who know God, the Maker of all things through Jesus the crucified, do not venture to do, but abide every torture and vengeance even to the extremity of death, rather than worship idols, or eat meat offered to idols".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:1
verses.text: Chapter 35 — Heretics confirm the Catholics in the faith.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:2
verses.text: And Trypho said, "I believe, however, that many of those who say that they confess Jesus, and are called Christians, eat meats offered to idols, and declare that they are by no means injured in consequence".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:3
verses.text: And I replied, "The fact that there are such men confessing themselves to be Christians, and admitting the crucified Jesus to be both Lord and Christ, yet not teaching His doctrines, but those of the spirits of error, causes us who are disciples of the true and pure doctrine of Jesus Christ, to be more faithful and stedfast in the hope announced by Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:4
verses.text: For what things He predicted would take place in His name, these we do see being actually accomplished in our sight.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:5
verses.text: For he said, 'Many shall come in My name, clothed outwardly in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:6
verses.text: ' " And, 'There shall be schisms and heresies.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:7
verses.text: ' And, 'Beware of false prophets, who shall come to you clothed outwardly in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:8
verses.text: ' And, 'Many false Christs and false apostles shall arise, and shall deceive many of the faithful.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:9
verses.text: ' There are, therefore, and there were many, my friends, who, coming forward in the name of Jesus, taught both to speak and act impious and blasphemous things; and these are called by us after the name of the men from whom each doctrine and opinion had its origin.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:10
verses.text: (For some in one way, others in another, teach to blaspheme the Maker of all things, and Christ, who was foretold by Him as coming, and the God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, with whom we have nothing in common, since we know them to be atheists, impious, unrighteous, and sinful, and confessors of Jesus in name only, instead of worshippers of Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:11
verses.text: Yet they style themselves Christians, just as certain among the Gentiles inscribe the name of God upon the works of their own hands, and partake in nefarious and impious rites;) Some are called Marcians, and some Valentinians, and some Basilidians, and some Saturnilians, and others by other names; each called after the originator of the individual opinion, just as each one of those who consider themselves philosophers, as I said before, thinks he must bear the name of the philosophy which he follows, from the name of the father of the particular doctrine.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:12
verses.text: So that, in consequence of these events, we know that Jesus foreknew what would happen after Him, as well as in consequence of many other events which He foretold would befall those who believed on and confessed Him, the Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:13
verses.text: For all that we suffer, even when killed by friends, He foretold would take place; so that it is manifest no word or act of His can be found fault with.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 35:14
verses.text: Wherefore we pray for you and for all other men who hate us; in order that you, having repented along with us, may not blaspheme Him who, by His works, by the mighty deeds even now wrought through His name, by the words He taught, by the prophecies announced concerning Him, is the blameless, and in all things irreproachable, Christ Jesus; but, believing on Him, may be saved in His second glorious advent, and may not be condemned to fire by Him".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:1
verses.text: Chapter 36 — He proves that Christ is called Lord of Hosts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:2
verses.text: Then he replied, "Let these things be so as you say—namely, that it was foretold Christ would suffer, and be called a stone; and after His first appearance, in which it had been announced He would suffer, would come in glory, and be Judge finally of all, and eternal King and Priest.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:3
verses.text: Now show if this man be He of whom these prophecies were made".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:4
verses.text: And I said, "As you wish, Trypho, I shall come to these proofs which you seek in the fitting place; but now you will permit me first to recount the prophecies, which I wish to do in order to prove that Christ is called both God and Lord of hosts, and Jacob, in parable by the Holy Spirit; and your interpreters, as God says, are foolish, since they say that reference is made to Solomon and not to Christ, when he bore the ark of testimony into the temple which he built.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:5
verses.text: The Psalm of David is this: 'The earth is the Lord's, and the fulness thereof; the world, and all that dwell therein.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:6
verses.text: He hath rounded it upon the seas, and prepared it upon the floods.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:7
verses.text: Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord? or who shall stand in His holy place? He that is clean of hands and pure of heart: who has not received his soul in vain, and has not sworn guilefully to his neighbour: he shall receive blessing from the Lord, and mercy from God his Saviour.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:8
verses.text: This is the generation of them that seek the Lord, that seek the face of the God of Jacob.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:9
verses.text: Lift up your gates, ye rulers; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:10
verses.text: Who is this King of glory? The Lord strong and mighty in battle.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:11
verses.text: Lift up your gates, ye rulers; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:12
verses.text: Who is this King of glory? The Lord of hosts, He is the King of glory.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:13
verses.text: ' Accordingly, it is shown that Solomon is not the Lord of hosts; but when our Christ rose from the dead and ascended to heaven, the rulers in heaven, under appointment of God, are commanded to open the gates of heaven, that He who is King of glory may enter in, and having ascended, may sit on the right hand of the Father until He make the enemies His footstool, as has been made manifest by another Psalm.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:14
verses.text: For when the rulers of heaven saw Him of uncomely and dishonoured appearance, and inglorious, not recognising Him, they inquired, 'Who is this King of glory?' And the Holy Spirit, either from the person of His Father, or from His own person, answers them, 'The Lord of hosts, He is this King of glory.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 36:15
verses.text: ' For every one will confess that not one of those who presided over the gates of the temple at Jerusalem would venture to say concerning Solomon, though he was so glorious a king, or concerning the ark of testimony, 'Who is this King of glory?'.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:1
verses.text: Chapter 37 — The same is proved from other Psalms.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:2
verses.text: "Moreover, in the diapsalm of the forty-sixth Psalm, reference is thus made to Christ: 'God went up with a shout, the Lord with the sound of a trumpet.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:3
verses.text: Sing ye to our God, sing ye: sing to our King, sing ye; for God is King of all the earth: sing with understanding.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:4
verses.text: God has ruled over the nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:5
verses.text: God sits upon His holy throne.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:6
verses.text: The rulers of the nations were assembled along with the God of Abraham, for the strong ones of God are greatly exalted on the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:7
verses.text: ' And in the ninety-eighth Psalm, the Holy Spirit reproaches you, and predicts Him whom you do not wish to be king to be King and Lord, both of Samuel, and of Aaron, and of Moses, and, in short, of all the others.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:8
verses.text: And the words of the Psalm are these: 'The Lord has reigned, let the nations be angry: it is He who sits upon the cherubim, let the earth be shaken.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:9
verses.text: The Lord is great in Zion, and He is high above all the nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:10
verses.text: Let them confess Thy great name, for it is fearful and holy, and the honour of the King loves judgment.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:11
verses.text: Thou hast prepared equity; judgment and righteousness hast Thou performed in Jacob.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:12
verses.text: Exalt the Lord our God, and worship the footstool of His feet; for He is holy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:13
verses.text: Moses and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among those who call upon His name.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:14
verses.text: They called (says the Scripture) on the Lord, and He heard them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:15
verses.text: In the pillar of the cloud He spake to them; for they kept His testimonies, and the commandment which he gave them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:16
verses.text: O Lord our God, Thou heardest them: O God, Thou wert propitious to them, and yet taking vengeance on all their inventions.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 37:17
verses.text: Exalt the Lord our God, and worship at His holy hill; for the Lord our God is holy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:1
verses.text: Chapter 38 — It is an annoyance to the Jew that Christ is said to be adored.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:2
verses.text: Justin confirms it, however, from Ps.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:3
verses.text: xlv.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:4
verses.text: And Trypho said, "Sir, it were good for us if we obeyed our teachers, who laid down a law that we should have no intercourse with any of you, and that we should not have even any communication with you on these questions.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:5
verses.text: For you utter many blasphemies, in that you seek to persuade us that this crucified man was with Moses and Aaron, and spoke to them in the pillar of the cloud; then that he became man, was crucified, and ascended up to heaven, and comes again to earth, and ought to be worshipped".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:6
verses.text: Then I answered, "I know that, as the word of God says, this great wisdom of God, the Maker of all things, and the Almighty, is hid from you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:7
verses.text: Wherefore, in sympathy with you, I am striving to the utmost that you may understand these matters which to you are paradoxical; but if not, that I myself may be innocent in the day of judgment.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:8
verses.text: For you shall hear other words which appear still more paradoxical; but be not confounded, nay, rather remain still more zealous hearers and investigators, despising the tradition of your teachers, since they are convicted by the Holy Spirit of inability to perceive the truths taught by God, and of preferring to teach their own doctrines.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:9
verses.text: Accordingly, in the forty-fourth forty-fifth Psalm, these words are in like manner referred to Christ: 'My heart has brought forth a good matter; I tell my works to the King.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:10
verses.text: My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:11
verses.text: Fairer in beauty than the sons of men: grace is poured forth into Thy lips: therefore hath God blessed Thee for ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:12
verses.text: Gird Thy sword upon Thy thigh, O mighty One.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:13
verses.text: Press on in Thy fairness and in Thy beauty, and prosper and reign, because of truth, and of meekness, and of righteousness: and Thy right hand shall instruct Thee marvellously.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:14
verses.text: Thine arrows are sharpened, O mighty One; the people shall fall under Thee; in the heart of the enemies of the King the arrows are fixed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:15
verses.text: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: a sceptre of equity is the sceptre of Thy kingdom.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:16
verses.text: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hast hated iniquity; therefore thy God hath anointed Thee with the oil of gladness above Thy fellows.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:17
verses.text: He hath anointed Thee with myrrh, and oil, and cassia, from Thy garments; from the ivory palaces, whereby they made Thee glad.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:18
verses.text: Kings' daughters are in Thy honour.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:19
verses.text: The queen stood at Thy right hand, clad in garments embroidered with gold.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:20
verses.text: Hearken, O daughter, and behold, and incline thine ear, and forget thy people and the house of thy father: and the King shall desire thy beauty; because He is thy Lord, they shall worship Him also.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:21
verses.text: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with gifts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:22
verses.text: The rich of the people shall entreat Thy face.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:23
verses.text: All the glory of the King's daughter is within, clad in embroidered garments of needlework.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:24
verses.text: The virgins that follow her shall be brought to the King; her neighbours shall be brought unto Thee: they shall be brought with joy and gladness: they shall be led into the King's shrine.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:25
verses.text: Instead of thy fathers, thy sons have been born: Thou shalt appoint them rulers over all the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 38:26
verses.text: I shall remember Thy name in every generation: therefore the people shall confess Thee for ever, and for ever and ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:1
verses.text: Chapter 39 — The Jews hate the Christians who believe this.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:2
verses.text: How great the distinction is between both!  "Now it is not surprising," I continued, "that you hate us who hold these opinions, and convict you of a continual hardness of heart.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:3
verses.text: For indeed Elijah, conversing with God concerning you, speaks thus: 'Lord, they have slain Thy prophets, and digged down Thine altars: and I am left alone, and they seek my life.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:4
verses.text: ' And He answers him: 'I have still seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee to Baal.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:5
verses.text: ' Therefore, just as God did not inflict His anger on account of those seven thousand men, even so He has now neither yet inflicted judgment, nor does inflict it, knowing that daily some of you are becoming disciples in the name of Christ, and quitting the path of error; who are also receiving gifts, each as he is worthy, illumined through the name of this Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:6
verses.text: For one receives the spirit of understanding, another of counsel, another of strength, another of healing, another of foreknowledge, another of teaching, and another of the fear of God".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:7
verses.text: To this Trypho said to me, "I wish you knew that you are beside yourself, talking these sentiments".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:8
verses.text: And I said to him, "Listen, O friend, for I am not mad or beside myself; but it was prophesied that, after the ascent of Christ to heaven, He would deliver us from error and give us gifts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:9
verses.text: The words are these: 'He ascended up on high; He led captivity captive; He gave gifts to men.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:10
verses.text: ' Accordingly, we who have received gifts from Christ, who has ascended up on high, prove from the words of prophecy that you, 'the wise in yourselves, and the men of understanding in your own eyes,' are foolish, and honour God and His Christ by lip only.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:11
verses.text: But we, who are instructed in the whole truth, honour Them both in acts, and in knowledge, and in heart, even unto death.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:12
verses.text: But you hesitate to confess that He is Christ, as the Scriptures and the events witnessed and done in His name prove, perhaps for this reason, lest you be persecuted by the rulers, who, under the influence of the wicked and deceitful spirit, the serpent, will not cease putting to death and persecuting those who confess the name of Christ until He come again, and destroy them all, and render to each his deserts".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:13
verses.text: And Trypho replied, "Now, then, render us the proof that this man who you say was crucified and ascended into heaven is the Christ of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:14
verses.text: For you have sufficiently proved by means of the Scriptures previously quoted by you, that it is declared in the Scriptures that Christ must suffer, and come again with glory, and receive the eternal kingdom over all the nations, every kingdom being made subject to Him: now show us that this man is He".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:15
verses.text: And I replied, "It has been already proved, sirs, to those who have ears, even from the facts which have been conceded by you; but that you may not think me at a loss, and unable to give proof of what you ask, as I promised, I shall do so at a fitting place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 39:16
verses.text: At present, I resume the consideration of the subject which I was discussing.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 40:1
verses.text: Chapter 40 — He returns to the Mosaic laws, and proves that they were figures of the things which pertain to Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 40:2
verses.text: "The mystery, then, of the lamb which God enjoined to be sacrificed as the passover, was a type of Christ; with whose blood, in proportion to their faith in Him, they anoint their houses,  i-e:, themselves, who believe on Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 40:3
verses.text: For that the creation which God created—to wit, Adam—was a house for the spirit which proceeded from God, you all can understand.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 40:4
verses.text: And that this injunction was temporary, I prove thus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 40:5
verses.text: God does not permit the lamb of the passover to be sacrificed in any other place than where His name was named; knowing that the days will come, after the suffering of Christ, when even the place in Jerusalem shall be given over to your enemies, and all the offerings, in short, shall cease; and that lamb which was commanded to be wholly roasted was a symbol of the suffering of the cross which Christ would undergo.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 40:6
verses.text: For the lamb, which is roasted, is roasted and dressed up in the form of the cross.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 40:7
verses.text: For one spit is transfixed right through from the lower parts up to the head, and one across the back, to which are attached the legs of the lamb.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 40:8
verses.text: And the two goats which were ordered to be offered during the fast, of which one was sent away as the scape goat, and the other sacrificed, were similarly declarative of the two appearances of Christ: the first, in which the elders of your people, and the priests, having laid hands on Him and put Him to death, sent Him away as the scape goat; and His second appearance, because in the same place in Jerusalem you shall recognise Him whom you have dishonoured, and who was an offering for all sinners willing to repent, and keeping the fast which Isaiah speaks of, loosening the terms of the violent contracts, and keeping the other precepts, likewise enumerated by him, and which I have quoted, which those believing in Jesus do.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 40:9
verses.text: And further, you are aware that the offering of the two goats, which were enjoined to be sacrificed at the fast, was not permitted to take place similarly anywhere else, but only in Jerusalem.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 41:1
verses.text: Chapter 41 — The oblation of fine flour was a figure of the Eucharist.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 41:2
verses.text: "And the offering of fine flour, sirs," I said, "which was prescribed to be presented on behalf of those purified from leprosy, was a type of the bread of the Eucharist, the celebration of which our Lord Jesus Christ prescribed, in remembrance of the suffering which He endured on behalf of those who are purified in soul from all iniquity, in order that we may at the same time thank God for having created the world, with all things therein, for the sake of man, and for delivering us from the evil in which we were, and for utterly overthrowing principalities and powers by Him who suffered according to His will.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 41:3
verses.text: Hence God speaks by the mouth of Malachi, one of the twelve prophets, as I said before, about the sacrifices at that time presented by you: 'I have no pleasure in you, saith the Lord; and I will not accept your sacrifices at your hands: for, from the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same, My name has been glorified among the Gentiles, and in every place incense is offered to My name, and a pure offering: for My name is great among the Gentiles, saith the Lord: but ye profane it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 41:4
verses.text: ' So He then speaks of those Gentiles, namely us, who in every place offer sacrifices to Him,  i-e:, the bread of the Eucharist, and also the cup of the Eucharist, affirming both that we glorify His name, and that you profane it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 41:5
verses.text: The command of circumcision, again, bidding them always circumcise the children on the eighth day, was a type of the true circumcision, by which we are circumcised from deceit and iniquity through Him who rose from the dead on the first day after the Sabbath, namely through our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 41:6
verses.text: For the first day after the Sabbath, remaining the first of all the days, is called, however, the eighth, according to the number of all the days of the cycle, and yet remains the first.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 42:1
verses.text: Chapter 42 — The bells on the priest's robe were a figure of the apostles.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 42:2
verses.text: "Moreover, the prescription that twelve bells be attached to the robe of the high priest, which hung down to the feet, was a symbol of the twelve apostles, who depend on the power of Christ, the eternal Priest; and through their voice it is that all the earth has been filled with the glory and grace of God and of His Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 42:3
verses.text: Wherefore David also says: 'Their sound has gone forth into all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 42:4
verses.text: ' And Isaiah speaks as if he were personating the apostles, when they say to Christ that they believe not in their own report, but in the power of Him who sent them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 42:5
verses.text: And so he says: 'Lord, who hath believed our report? and to whom is the arm of the Lord revealed? We have preached before Him as if He were a child, as if a root in a dry ground.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 42:6
verses.text: ' (And what follows in order of the prophecy already quoted;) But when the passage speaks as from the lips of many, 'We have preached before Him,' and adds, 'as if a child,' it signifies that the wicked shall become subject to Him, and shall obey His command, and that all shall become as one child.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 42:7
verses.text: Such a thing as you may witness in the body: although the members are enumerated as many, all are called one, and are a body.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 42:8
verses.text: For, indeed, a commonwealth and a church, though many individuals in number, are in fact as one, called and addressed by one appellation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 42:9
verses.text: And in short, sirs," said I, "by enumerating all the other appointments of Moses I can demonstrate that they were types, and symbols, and declarations of those things which would happen to Christ, of those who it was foreknown were to believe in Him, and of those things which would also be done by Christ Himself.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 42:10
verses.text: But since what I have now enumerated appears to me to be sufficient, I revert again to the order of the discourse.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:1
verses.text: Chapter 43 — He concludes that the law had an end in Christ, who was born of the Virgin.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:2
verses.text: "As, then, circumcision began with Abraham, and the Sabbath and sacrifices and offerings and feasts with Moses, and it has been proved they were enjoined on account of the hardness of your people's heart, so it was necessary, in accordance with the Father's will, that they should have an end in Him who was born of a virgin, of the family of Abraham and tribe of Judah, and of David; in Christ the Son of God, who was proclaimed as about to come to all the world, to be the everlasting law and the everlasting covenant, even as the forementioned prophecies show.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:3
verses.text: And we, who have approached God through Him, have received not carnal, but spiritual circumcision, which Enoch and those like him observed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:4
verses.text: And we have received it through baptism, since we were sinners, by God's mercy; and all men may equally obtain it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:5
verses.text: But since the mystery of His birth now demands our attention I shall speak of it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:6
verses.text: Isaiah then asserted in regard to the generation of Christ, that it could not be declared by man, in words already quoted: 'Who shall declare His generation? for His life is taken from the earth: for the transgressions of my people was He led to death.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:7
verses.text: ' The Spirit of prophecy thus affirmed that the generation of Him who was to die, that we sinful men might be healed by His stripes, was such as could not be declared.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:8
verses.text: Furthermore, that the men who believe in Him may possess the knowledge of the manner in which He came into the world, the Spirit of prophecy by the same Isaiah foretold how it would happen thus: 'And the Lord spoke again to Ahaz, saying, Ask for thyself a sign from the Lord thy God, in the depth, or in the height.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:9
verses.text: And Ahaz said, I will not ask, neither will I tempt the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:10
verses.text: And Isaiah said, Hear then, O house of David; Is it a small thing for you to contend with men, and how do you contend with the Lord? Therefore the Lord Himself will give you a sign.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:11
verses.text: Behold, the virgin shall conceive, and shall bear a son, and his name shall be called Immanuel.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:12
verses.text: Butter and honey shall he eat, before he knows or prefers the evil, and chooses out the good; for before the child knows good or ill, he rejects evil by choosing out the good.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:13
verses.text: For before the child knows how to call father or mother, he shall receive the power of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria in presence of the king of Assyria.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:14
verses.text: And the land shall be forsaken, which thou shalt with difficulty endure in consequence of the presence of its two kings.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:15
verses.text: But God shall bring on thee, and on thy people, and on the house of thy father, days which have not yet come upon thee since the day in which Ephraim took away from Judah the king of Assyria.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:16
verses.text: ' Now it is evident to all, that in the race of Abraham according to the flesh no one has been born of a virgin, or is said to have been born of a virgin, save this our Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 43:17
verses.text: But since you and your teachers venture to affirm that in the prophecy of Isaiah it is not said, 'Behold, the virgin shall conceive,' but, 'Behold, the young woman shall conceive, and bear a son;' and since you explain the prophecy as if it referred to Hezekiah, who was your king, I shall endeavour to discuss shortly this point in opposition to you, and to show that reference is made to Him who is acknowledged by us as Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 44:1
verses.text: Chapter 44 — The Jews in vain promise themselves salvation, which cannot be obtained except through Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 44:2
verses.text: "For thus, so far as you are concerned, I shall be found in all respects innocent, if I strive earnestly to persuade you by bringing forward demonstrations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 44:3
verses.text: But if you remain hard-hearted, or weak in forming a resolution, on account of death, which is the lot of the Christians, and are unwilling to assent to the truth, you shall appear as the authors of your own evils.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 44:4
verses.text: And you deceive yourselves while you fancy that, because you are the seed of Abraham after the flesh, therefore you shall fully inherit the good things announced to be bestowed by God through Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 44:5
verses.text: For no one, not even of them, has anything to look for, but only those who in mind are assimilated to the faith of Abraham, and who have recognised all the mysteries: for I say, that some injunctions were laid on you in reference to the worship of God and practice of righteousness; but some injunctions and acts were likewise mentioned in reference to the mystery of Christ, on account of the hardness of your people's hearts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 44:6
verses.text: And that this is so, God makes known in Ezekiel, when He said concerning it: 'If Noah and Jacob and Daniel should beg either sons or daughters, the request would not be granted them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 44:7
verses.text: ' And in Isaiah, of the very same matter He spake thus: 'The Lord God said, they shall both go forth and look on the members of the bodies of the men that have transgressed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 44:8
verses.text: For their worm shall not die, and their fire shall not be quenched, and they shall be a gazing-stock to all flesh.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 44:9
verses.text: ' So that it becomes you to eradicate this hope from your souls, and hasten to know in what way forgiveness of sins, and a hope of inheriting the promised good things, shall be yours.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 44:10
verses.text: But there is no other way than this, — to become acquainted with this Christ, to be washed in the fountain spoken of by Isaiah for the remission of sins; and for the rest, to live sinless lives".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 45:1
verses.text: Chapter 45 — Those who were righteous before and under the law shall be saved by Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 45:2
verses.text: And Trypho said, "If I seem to interrupt these matters, which you say must be investigated, yet the question which I mean to put is urgent.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 45:3
verses.text: Suffer me first".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 45:4
verses.text: And I replied, "Ask whatever you please, as it occurs to you; and I shall endeavour, after questions and answers, to resume and complete the discourse".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 45:5
verses.text: Then he said, "Tell me, then, shall those who lived according to the law given by Moses, live in the same manner with Jacob, Enoch, and Noah, in the resurrection of the dead, or not?"  I replied to him, "When I quoted, sir, the words spoken by Ezekiel, that 'even if Noah and Daniel and Jacob were to beg sons and daughters, the request would not be granted them,' but that each one, that is to say, shall be saved by his own righteousness, I said also, that those who regulated their lives by the law of Moses would in like manner be saved.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 45:6
verses.text: For what in the law of Moses is naturally good, and pious, and righteous, and has been prescribed to be done by those who obey it; and what was appointed to be performed by reason of the hardness of the people's hearts; was similarly recorded, and done also by those who were under the law.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 45:7
