verses.text: Since those who did that which is universally, naturally, and eternally good are pleasing to God, they shall be saved through this Christ in the resurrection equally with those righteous men who were before them, namely Noah, and Enoch, and Jacob, and whoever else there be, along with those who have known this Christ, Son of God, who was before the morning star and the moon, and submitted to become incarnate, and be born of this virgin of the family of David, in order that, by this dispensation, the serpent that sinned from the beginning, and the angels like him, may be destroyed, and that death may be contemned, and for ever quit, at the second coming of the Christ Himself, those who believe in Him and live acceptably,—and be no more: when some are sent to be punished unceasingly into judgment and condemnation of fire; but others shall exist in freedom from suffering, from corruption, and from grief, and in immortality".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:1
verses.text: Chapter 46 — Trypho asks whether a man who keeps the law even now will be saved.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:2
verses.text: Justin proves that it contributes nothing to righteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:3
verses.text: "But if some, even now, wish to live in the observance of the institutions given by Moses, and yet believe in this Jesus who was crucified, recognising Him to be the Christ of God, and that it is given to Him to be absolute Judge of all, and that His is the everlasting kingdom, can they also be saved?" he inquired of me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:4
verses.text: And I replied, "Let us consider that also together, whether one may now observe all the Mosaic institutions".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:5
verses.text: And he answered, "No.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:6
verses.text: For we know that, as you said, it is not possible either anywhere to sacrifice the lamb of the passover, or to offer the goats ordered for the fast; or, in short, to present all the other offerings".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:7
verses.text: And I said, "Tell me then yourself, I pray, some things which can be observed; for you will be persuaded that, though a man does not keep or has not performed the eternal decrees, he may assuredly be saved".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:8
verses.text: Then he replied, "To keep the Sabbath, to be circumcised, to observe months, and to be washed if you touch anything prohibited by Moses, or after sexual intercourse".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:9
verses.text: And I said, "Do you think that Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, Noah, and Job, and all the rest before  or after them equally righteous, also Sarah the wife of Abraham, Rebekah the wife of Isaac, Rachel the wife of Jacob, and Leah, and all the rest of them, until the mother of Moses the faithful servant, who observed none of these statutes, will be saved?"  And Trypho answered, "Were not Abraham and his descendants circumcised?"  And I said, "I know that Abraham and his descendants were circumcised.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:10
verses.text: The reason why circumcision was given to them I stated at length in what has gone before; and if what has been said does not convince you, let us again search into the matter.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:11
verses.text: But you are aware that, up to Moses, no one in fact who was righteous observed any of these rites at all of which we are talking, or received one commandment to observe, except that of circumcision, which began from Abraham".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:12
verses.text: And he replied, "We know it, and admit that they are saved".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:13
verses.text: Then I returned answer, "You perceive that God by Moses laid all such ordinances upon you on account of the hardness of your people's hearts, in order that, by the large number of them, you might keep God continually, and in every action, before your eyes, and never begin to act unjustly or impiously.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:14
verses.text: For He enjoined you to place around you a fringe of purple dye, in order that you might not forget God; and He commanded you to wear a phylactery, certain characters, which indeed we consider holy, being engraved on very thin parchment; and by these means stirring you up to retain a constant remembrance of God: at the same time, however, convincing you, that in your hearts you have not even a faint remembrance of God's worship.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:15
verses.text: Yet not even so were you dissuaded from idolatry: for in the times of Elijah, when God recounted the number of those who had not bowed the knee to Baal, He said the number was seven thousand; and in Isaiah He rebukes you for having sacrificed your children to idols.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 46:16
verses.text: But we, because we refuse to sacrifice to those to whom we were of old accustomed to sacrifice, undergo extreme penalties, and rejoice in death,—believing that God will raise us up by His Christ, and will make us incorruptible, and undisturbed, and immortal; and we know that the ordinances imposed by reason of the hardness of your people's hearts, contribute nothing to the performance of righteousness and of piety".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:1
verses.text: Chapter 47 — Justin communicates with Christians who observe the law.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:2
verses.text: Not a few Catholics do otherwise.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:3
verses.text: And Trypho again inquired, "But if some one, knowing that this is so, after he recognises that this man is Christ, and has believed in and obeys Him, wishes, however, to observe these institutions, will he be saved?"  I said, "In my opinion, Trypho, such an one will be saved, if he does not strive in every way to persuade other men, — I mean those Gentiles who have been circumcised from error by Christ, to observe the same things as himself, telling them that they will not be saved unless they do so.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:4
verses.text: This you did yourself at the commencement of the discourse, when you declared that I would not be saved unless I observe these institutions".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:5
verses.text: Then he replied, "Why then have you said, 'In my opinion, such an one will be saved,' unless there are some who affirm that such will not be saved?"  "There are such people, Trypho," I answered; "and these do not venture to have any intercourse with or to extend hospitality to such persons; but I do not agree with them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:6
verses.text: But if some, through weak-mindedness, wish to observe such institutions as were given by Moses, from which they expect some virtue, but which we believe were appointed by reason of the hardness of the people's hearts, along with their hope in this Christ, and wish to perform the eternal and natural acts of righteousness and piety, yet choose to live with the Christians and the faithful, as I said before, not inducing them either to be circumcised like themselves, or to keep the Sabbath, or to observe any other such ceremonies, then I hold that we ought to join ourselves to such, and associate with them in all things as kinsmen and brethren.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:7
verses.text: But if, Trypho," I continued, "some of your race, who say they believe in this Christ, compel those Gentiles who believe in this Christ to live in all respects according to the law given by Moses, or choose not to associate so intimately with them, I in like manner do not approve of them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:8
verses.text: But I believe that even those, who have been persuaded by them to observe the legal dispensation along with their confession of God in Christ, shall probably be saved.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:9
verses.text: And I hold, further, that such as have confessed and known this man to be Christ, yet who have gone back from some cause to the legal dispensation, and have denied that this man is Christ, and have repented not before death, shall by no means be saved.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:10
verses.text: Further, I hold that those of the seed of Abraham who live according to the law, and do not believe in this Christ before death, shall likewise not be saved, and especially those who have anathematized and do anathematize this very Christ in the synagogues, and everything by which they might obtain salvation and escape the vengeance of fire.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:11
verses.text: For the goodness and the loving-kindness of God, and His boundless riches, hold righteous and sinless the man who, as Ezekiel tells, repents of sins; and reckons sinful, unrighteous, and impious the man who fails away from piety and righteousness to unrighteousness and ungodliness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 47:12
verses.text: Wherefore also our Lord Jesus Christ said, 'In whatsoever things I shall take you, in these I shall judge you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 48:1
verses.text: Chapter 48 — Before the divinity of Christ is proved, he Trypho demands that it be settled that He is Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 48:2
verses.text: And Trypho said, "We have heard what you think of these matters.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 48:3
verses.text: Resume the discourse where you left off, and bring it to an end.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 48:4
verses.text: For some of it appears to me to be paradoxical, and wholly incapable of proof.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 48:5
verses.text: For when you say that this Christ existed as God before the ages, then that He submitted to be born and become man, yet that He is not man of man, this assertion appears to me to be not merely paradoxical, but also foolish".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 48:6
verses.text: And I replied to this, "I know that the statement does appear to be paradoxical, especially to those of your race, who are ever unwilling to understand or to perform the requirements of God, but ready to perform those of your teachers, as God Himself declares.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 48:7
verses.text: Now assuredly, Trypho," I continued," the proof that this man is the Christ of God does not fail, though I be unable to prove that He existed formerly as Son of the Maker of all things, being God, and was born a man by the Virgin.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 48:8
verses.text: But since I have certainly proved that this man is the Christ of God, whoever He be, even if I do not prove that He pre-existed, and submitted to be born a man of like passions with us, having a body, according to the Father's will; in this last matter alone is it just to say that I have erred, and not to deny that He is the Christ, though it should appear that He was born man of men, and nothing more is proved than this, that He has become Christ by election.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 48:9
verses.text: For there are some, my friends," I said, "of our race, who admit that He is Christ, while holding Him to be man of men; with whom I do not agree, nor would I, even though most of those who have now the same opinions as myself should say so; since we were enjoined by Christ Himself to put no faith in human doctrines, but in those proclaimed by the blessed prophets and taught by Himself".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:1
verses.text: Chapter 49 — To those who object that Elijah has not yet come, he replies that he is the precursor of the first advent.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:2
verses.text: And Trypho said, "Those who affirm him to have been a man, and to have been anointed by election, and then to have become Christ, appear to me to speak more plausibly than you who hold those opinions which you express.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:3
verses.text: For we all expect that Christ will be a man born of men, and that Elijah when he comes will anoint him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:4
verses.text: But if this man appear to be Christ, he must certainly be known as man born of men; but from the circumstance that Elijah has not yet come, I infer that this man is not He the Christ".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:5
verses.text: Then I inquired of him, "Does not Scripture, in the book of Zechariah, say that Elijah shall come before the great and terrible day of the Lord?"  And he answered, "Certainly".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:6
verses.text: "If therefore Scripture compels you to admit that two advents of Christ were predicted to take place,—one in which He would appear suffering, and dishonoured, and without comeliness; but the other in which He would come glorious and Judge of all, as has been made manifest in many of the fore-cited passages,—shall we not suppose that the word of God has proclaimed that Elijah shall be the precursor of the great and terrible day, that is, of His second advent?"  "Certainly," he answered.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:7
verses.text: "And, accordingly, our Lord in His teaching," I continued, "proclaimed that this very thing would take place, saying that Elijah would also come.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:8
verses.text: And we know that this shall take place when our Lord Jesus Christ shall come in glory from heaven; whose first manifestation the Spirit of God who was in Elijah preceded as herald in the person of John, a prophet among your nation; after whom no other prophet appeared among you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:9
verses.text: He cried, as he sat by the river Jordan: 'I baptize you with water to repentance; but He that is stronger than I shall come, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: He shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire: whose fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly purge His floor, and will gather the wheat into the barn; but the chaff He will burn up with unquenchable fire.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:10
verses.text: ' And this very prophet your king Herod had shut up in prison; and when his birthday was celebrated, and the niece of the same Herod by her dancing had pleased him, he told her to ask whatever she pleased.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:11
verses.text: Then the mother of the maiden instigated her to ask the head of John, who was in prison; and having asked it, Herod sent and ordered the head of John to be brought in on a charger.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:12
verses.text: Wherefore also our Christ said, when He was on earth, to those who were affirming that Elijah must come before Christ: 'Elijah shall come, and restore all things; but I say unto you, that Elijah has already come, and they knew him not, but have done to him whatsoever they chose.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:13
verses.text: ' And it is written, 'Then the disciples understood that He spake to them about John the Baptist.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:14
verses.text: ' "  And Trypho said, "This statement also seems to me paradoxical; namely, that the prophetic Spirit of God, who was in Elijah, was also in John".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:15
verses.text: To this I replied, "Do you not think that the same thing happened in the case of Joshua the son of Nave (Nun), who succeeded to the command of the people after Moses, when Moses was commanded to lay his hands on Joshua, and God said to him, 'I will take of the spirit which is in thee, and put it on him?' "  And he said, "Certainly".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:16
verses.text: "As therefore," I say, "while Moses was still among men, God took of the spirit which was in Moses and put it on Joshua, even so God was able to cause the spirit of Elijah to come upon John; in order that, as Christ at His first coming appeared inglorious, even so the first coming of the spirit, which remained always pure in Elijah like that of Christ, might be perceived to be inglorious.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:17
verses.text: For the Lord said He would wage war against Amalek with concealed hand; and you will not deny that Amalek fell.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 49:18
verses.text: But if it is said that only in the glorious advent of Christ war will be waged with Amalek, how great will the fulfilment of Scripture be which says, 'God will wage war against Amalek with concealed hand!' You can perceive that the concealed power of God was in Christ the crucified, before whom demons, and all the principalities and powers of the earth, tremble".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:1
verses.text: Chapter 50 — It is proved from Isaiah that John is the precursor of Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:2
verses.text: And Trypho said, "You seem to me to have come out of a great conflict with many persons about all the points we have been searching into, and therefore quite ready to return answers to all questions put to you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:3
verses.text: Answer me then, first, how you can show that there is another God besides the Maker of all things; and then you will show, further, that He submitted to be born of the Virgin".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:4
verses.text: I replied, "Give me permission first of all to quote certain passages from the prophecy of Isaiah, which refer to the office of forerunner discharged by John the Baptist and prophet before this our Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:5
verses.text: "I grant it," said he.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:6
verses.text: Then I said, "Isaiah thus foretold John's forerunning: 'And Hezekiah said to Isaiah, Good is the word of the Lord which He spake: Let there be peace and righteousness in my days.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:7
verses.text: ' And, 'Encourage the people; ye priests, speak to the heart of Jerusalem, and encourage her, because her humiliation is accomplished.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:8
verses.text: Her sin is annulled; for she has received of the Lord's hand double for her sins.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:9
verses.text: A voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare the ways of the Lord; make straight the paths of our God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:10
verses.text: Every valley shall be filled up, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low: and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough way shall be plain ways; and the glory of the Lord shall be seen, and all flesh shall see the salvation of God: for the Lord hath spoken it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:11
verses.text: A voice of one saying, Cry; and I said, What shall I cry? All flesh is grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of grass.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:12
verses.text: The grass has withered, and the flower of it has fallen away; but the word of the Lord endureth for ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:13
verses.text: Thou that bringest good tidings to Zion, go up to the high mountain; thou that bringest good tidings to Jerusalem, lift up thy voice with strength.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:14
verses.text: Lift ye up, be not afraid; tell the cities of Judah, Behold your God! Behold, the Lord comes with strength, and His arm comes with authority.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:15
verses.text: Behold, His reward is with Him, and His work before Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:16
verses.text: As a shepherd He will tend His flock, and will gather the lambs with His arm, and cheer on her that is with young.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:17
verses.text: Who has measured the water with his hand, and the heaven with a span, and all the earth with his fist? Who has weighed the mountains, and put the valleys into a balance? Who has known the mind of the Lord? And who has been His counsellor, and who shall advise Him? Or with whom did He take counsel, and he instructed Him? Or who showed Him judgment? Or who made Him to know the way of understanding? All the nations are reckoned as a drop of a bucket, and as a turning of a balance, and shall be reckoned as spittle.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 50:18
verses.text: But Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor the beasts sufficient for a burnt-offering; and all the nations are considered nothing, and for nothing.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 51:1
verses.text: Chapter 51 — It is proved that this prophecy has been fulfilled.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 51:2
verses.text: And when I ceased, Trypho said, "All the words of the prophecy you repeat, sir, are ambiguous, and have no force in proving what you wish to prove".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 51:3
verses.text: Then I answered, "If the prophets had not ceased, so that there were no more in your nation, Trypho, after this John, it is evident that what I say in reference to Jesus Christ might be regarded perhaps as ambiguous.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 51:4
verses.text: But if John came first calling on men to repent, and Christ, while John still sat by the river Jordan, having come, put an end to his prophesying and baptizing, and preached also Himself, saying that the kingdom of heaven is at hand, and that He must suffer many things from the Scribes and Pharisees, and be crucified, and on the third day rise again, and would appear again in Jerusalem, and would again eat and drink with His disciples; and foretold that in the interval between His first and second advent, as I previously said, priests and false prophets would arise in His name, which things do actually appear; then how can they be ambiguous, when you may be persuaded by the facts? Moreover, He referred to the fact that there would be no longer in your nation any prophet, and to the fact that men recognised how that the New Testament, which God formerly announced His intention of promulgating, was then present,  i-e:, Christ Himself; and in the following terms: 'The law and the prophets were until John the Baptist; from that time the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 51:5
verses.text: And if you can receive it, he is Elijah, who was to come.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 51:6
verses.text: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:1
verses.text: Chapter 52 — Jacob predicted two advents of Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:2
verses.text: "And it was prophesied by Jacob the patriarch that there would be two advents of Christ, and that in the first He would suffer, and that after He came there would be neither prophet nor king in your nation (I proceeded), and that the nations who believed in the suffering Christ would look for His future appearance.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:3
verses.text: And for this reason the Holy Spirit had uttered these truths in a parable, and obscurely: for," I added, "it is said, 'Judah, thy brethren have praised thee: thy hands shall be on the neck of thine enemies; the sons of thy father shall worship thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:4
verses.text: Judah is a lion's whelp; from the germ, my son, thou art sprung up.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:5
verses.text: Reclining, he lay down like a lion, and like a lion's whelp: who shall raise him up? A ruler shall not depart from Judah, or a leader from his thighs, until that which is laid up in store for him shall come; and he shall be the desire of nations, binding his foal to the vine, and the foal of his ass to the tendril of the vine.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:6
verses.text: He shall wash his garments in wine, and his vesture in the blood of the grape.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:7
verses.text: His eyes shall be bright with wine, and his teeth white like milk.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:8
verses.text: ' Moreover, that in your nation there never failed either prophet or ruler, from the time when they began until the time when this Jesus Christ appeared and suffered, you will not venture shamelessly to assert, nor can you prove it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:9
verses.text: For though you affirm that Herod, after whose reign He suffered, was an Ashkelonite, nevertheless you admit that there was a high priest in your nation; so that you then had one who presented offerings according to the law of Moses, and observed the other legal ceremonies; also you had prophets in succession until John, (even then, too, when your nation was carried captive to Babylon, when your land was ravaged by war, and the sacred vessels carried off); there never failed to be a prophet among you, who was lord, and leader, and ruler of your nation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:10
verses.text: For the Spirit which was in the prophets anointed your kings, and established them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:11
verses.text: But after the manifestation and death of our Jesus Christ in your nation, there was and is nowhere any prophet: nay, further, you ceased to exist under your own king, your land was laid waste, and forsaken like a lodge in a vineyard; and the statement of Scripture, in the mouth of Jacob, 'And He shall be the desire of nations,' meant symbolically His two advents, and that the nations would believe in Him; which facts you may now at length discern.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 52:12
verses.text: For those out of all the nations who are pious and righteous through the faith of Christ, look for His future appearance.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:1
verses.text: Chapter 53 — Jacob predicted that Christ would ride on an ass, and Zechariah confirms it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:2
verses.text: "And that expression, 'binding his foal to the vine, and the ass's foal to the vine tendril,' was a declaring beforehand both of the works wrought by Him at His first advent, and also of that belief in Him which the nations would repose.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:3
verses.text: For they were like an unharnessed foal, which was not bearing a yoke on its neck, until this Christ came, and sent His disciples to instruct them; and they bore the yoke of His word, and yielded the neck to endure all hardships, for the sake of the good things promised by Himself, and expected by them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:4
verses.text: And truly our Lord Jesus Christ, when He intended to go into Jerusalem, requested His disciples to bring Him a certain ass, along with its foal, which was bound in an entrance of a village called Bethphage; and having seated Himself on it, He entered into Jerusalem.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:5
verses.text: And as this was done by Him in the manner in which it was prophesied in precise terms that it would be done by the Christ, and as the fulfilment was recognised, it became a clear proof that He was the Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:6
verses.text: And though all this happened and is proved from Scripture, you are still hard-hearted.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:7
verses.text: Nay, it was prophesied by Zechariah, one of the twelve prophets, that such would take place, in the following words: 'Rejoice greatly, daughter of Zion; shout, and declare, daughter of Jerusalem; behold, thy King shall come to thee, righteous, bringing salvation, meek, and lowly, riding on an ass, and the foal of an ass.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:8
verses.text: ' Now, that the Spirit of prophecy, as well as the patriarch Jacob, mentioned both an ass and its foal, which would be used by Him; and, further, that He, as I previously said, requested His disciples to bring both beasts; this fact was a prediction that you of the synagogue, along with the Gentiles, would believe in Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:9
verses.text: For as the unharnessed colt was a symbol of the Gentiles even so the harnessed ass was a symbol of your nation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:10
verses.text: For you possess the law which was imposed upon you by the prophets.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:11
verses.text: Moreover, the prophet Zechariah foretold that this same Christ would be smitten, and His disciples scattered: which also took place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:12
verses.text: For after His crucifixion, the disciples that accompanied Him were dispersed, until He rose from the dead, and persuaded them that so it had been prophesied concerning Him, that He would suffer; and being thus persuaded, they went into all the world, and taught these truths.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:13
verses.text: Hence also we are strong in His faith and doctrine, since we have this our persuasion both from the prophets, and from those who throughout the world are seen to be worshippers of God in the name of that crucified One.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:14
verses.text: The following is said, too, by Zechariah: 'O sword, rise up against My Shepherd, and against the man of My people, saith the Lord of hosts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 53:15
verses.text: Smite the Shepherd, and His flock shall be scattered.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 54:1
verses.text: Chapter 54 — What the blood of the grape signifies.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 54:2
verses.text: "And that expression which was committed to writing by Moses, and prophesied by the patriarch Jacob, namely, 'He shall wash His garments with wine, and His vesture with the blood of the grape,' signified that He would wash those that believe in Him with His own blood.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 54:3
verses.text: For the Holy Spirit called those who receive remission of sins through Him, His garments; amongst whom He is always present in power, but will be manifestly present at His second coming.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 54:4
verses.text: That the Scripture mentions the blood of the grape has been evidently designed, because Christ derives blood not from the seed of man, but from the power of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 54:5
verses.text: For as God, and not man, has produced the blood of the vine, so also the Scripture has predicted that the blood of Christ would be not of the seed of man, but of the power of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 54:6
verses.text: But this prophecy, sirs, which I repeated, proves that Christ is not man of men, begotten in the ordinary course of humanity".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 55:1
verses.text: Chapter 55 — Trypho asks that Christ be proved God, but without metaphor.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 55:2
verses.text: Justin promises to do so.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 55:3
verses.text: And Trypho answered, "We shall remember this your exposition, if you strengthen your solution of this difficulty by other arguments: but now resume the discourse, and show us that the Spirit of prophecy admits another God besides the Maker of all things, taking care not to speak of the sun and moon, which, it is written, God has given to the nations to worship as gods; and oftentimes the prophets, employing this manner of speech, say that 'thy God is a God of gods, and a Lord of lords,' adding frequently, 'the great and strong and terrible God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 55:4
verses.text: ' For such expressions are used, not as if they really were gods, but because the Scripture is teaching us that the true God, who made all things, is Lord alone of those who are reputed gods and lords.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 55:5
verses.text: And in order that the Holy Spirit may convince us of this, He said by the holy David, 'The gods of the nations, reputed gods, are idols of demons, and not gods;' and He denounces a curse on those who worship them".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 55:6
verses.text: And I replied, "I would not bring forward these proofs, Trypho, by which I am aware those who worship these idols and such like are condemned, but such proofs as no one could find any objection to.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 55:7
verses.text: They will appear strange to you, although you read them every day; so that even from this fact we understand that, because of your wickedness, God has withheld from you the ability to discern the wisdom of His Scriptures; yet there are some exceptions, to whom, according to the grace of His long-suffering, as Isaiah said, He has left a seed of salvation, lest your race be utterly destroyed, like Sodom and Gomorrah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 55:8
verses.text: Pay attention, therefore, to what I shall record out of the holy Scriptures, which do not need to be expounded, but only listened to.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:1
verses.text: Chapter 56 — God who appeared to Moses is distinguished from God the Father.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:2
verses.text: "Moses, then, the blessed and faithful servant of God, declares that He who appeared to Abraham under the oak in Mamre is God, sent with the two angels in His company to judge Sodom by Another who remains ever in the supercelestial places, invisible to all men, holding personal intercourse with none, whom we believe to be Maker and Father of all things; for he speaks thus: 'God appeared to him under the oak in Mamre, as he sat at his tent-door at noontide.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:3
verses.text: And lifting up his eyes, he saw, and behold, three men stood before him; and when he saw them, he ran to meet them from the door of his tent; and he bowed himself toward the ground, and said;' " (and so on;) " 'Abraham gat up early in the morning to the place where he stood before the Lord: and he looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and toward the adjacent country, and beheld, and, lo, a flame went up from the earth, like the smoke of a furnace.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:4
verses.text: ' " And when I had made an end of quoting these words, I asked them if they had understood them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:5
verses.text: And they said they had understood them, but that the passages adduced brought forward no proof that there is any other God or Lord, or that the Holy Spirit says so, besides the Maker of all things.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:6
verses.text: Then I replied, "I shall attempt to persuade you, since you have understood the Scriptures, of the truth of what I say, that there is, and that there is said to be, another God and Lord subject to the Maker of all things; who is also called an Angel, because He announces to men whatsoever the Maker of all things—above whom there is no other God—wishes to announce to them".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:7
verses.text: And quoting once more the previous passage, I asked Trypho, "Do you think that God appeared to Abraham under the oak in Mamre, as the Scripture asserts?"  He said, "Assuredly".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:8
verses.text: "Was He one of those three," I said, "whom Abraham saw, and whom the Holy Spirit of prophecy describes as men?"  He said, "No; but God appeared to him, before the vision of the three.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:9
verses.text: Then those three whom the Scripture calls men, were angels; two of them sent to destroy Sodom, and one to announce the joyful tidings to Sarah, that she would bear a son; for which cause he was sent, and having accomplished his errand, went away".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:10
verses.text: "How then," said I, "does the one of the three, who was in the tent, and who said, 'I shall return to thee hereafter, and Sarah shall have a son,' appear to have returned when Sarah had begotten a son, and to be there declared, by the prophetic word, God? But that you may clearly discern what I say, listen to the words expressly employed by Moses; they are these: 'And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian bond-woman, whom she bore to Abraham, sporting with Isaac her son, and said to Abraham, Cast out this bond-woman and her son; for the son of this bond-woman shall not share the inheritance of my son Isaac.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:11
verses.text: And the matter seemed very grievous in Abraham's sight, because of his son.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:12
verses.text: But God said to Abraham, Let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the son, and because of the bond-woman.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:13
verses.text: In all that Sarah hath said unto thee, hearken to her voice; for in Isaac shall thy seed be called.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:14
verses.text: ' Have you perceived, then, that He who said under the oak that He would return, since He knew it would be necessary to advise Abraham to do what Sarah wished him, came back as it is written; and is God, as the words declare, when they so speak: 'God said to Abraham, Let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the son, and because of the bond-woman?' " I inquired.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:15
verses.text: And Trypho said, "Certainly; but you have not proved from this that there is another God besides Him who appeared to Abraham, and who also appeared to the other patriarchs and prophets.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:16
verses.text: You have proved, however, that we were wrong in believing that the three who were in the tent with Abraham were all angels".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:17
verses.text: I replied again, "If I could not have proved to you from the Scriptures that one of those three is God, and is called Angel, because, as I already said, He brings messages to those to whom God the Maker of all things wishes messages to be brought, then in regard to Him who appeared to Abraham on earth in human form in like manner as the two angels who came with Him, and who was God even before the creation of the world, it were reasonable for you to entertain the same belief as is entertained by the whole of your nation".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:18
verses.text: "Assuredly," he said, "for up to this moment this has been our belief".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:19
verses.text: Then I replied, "Reverting to the Scriptures, I shall endeavour to persuade you, that He who is said to have appeared to Abraham, and to Jacob, and to Moses, and who is called God, is distinct from Him who made all things,—numerically, I mean, not distinct in will.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:20
verses.text: For I affirm that He has never at any time done anything  which He who made the world—above whom there is no other God—has not wished Him both to do and to engage Himself with".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:21
verses.text: And Trypho said, "Prove now that this is the case, that we also may agree with you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:22
verses.text: For we do not understand you to affirm that He has done or said anything contrary to the will of the Maker of all things".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:23
verses.text: Then I said, "The Scripture just quoted by me will make this plain to you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:24
verses.text: It is thus: 'The sun was risen on the earth, and Lot entered into Segor (Zoar); and the Lord rained on Sodom sulphur and fire from the Lord out of heaven, and overthrew these cities and all the neighbourhood.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:25
verses.text: ' "  Then the fourth of those who had remained with Trypho said, "It must therefore necessarily be said that one of the two angels who went to Sodom, and is named by Moses in the Scripture Lord, is different from Him who also is God and appeared to Abraham".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:26
verses.text: "It is not on this ground solely," I said, "that it must be admitted absolutely that some other one is called Lord by the Holy Spirit besides Him who is considered Maker of all things; not solely for what is said by Moses, but also for what is said by David.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:27
verses.text: For there is written by him: 'The Lord says to my Lord, Sit on My right hand, until I make Thine enemies Thy footstool,' as I have already quoted.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:28
verses.text: And again, in other words: 'Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:29
verses.text: A sceptre of equity is the sceptre of Thy kingdom: Thou hast loved righteousness and hated iniquity: therefore God, even Thy God, hath anointed Thee with the oil of gladness above Thy fellows.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:30
verses.text: ' If, therefore, you assert that the Holy Spirit calls some other one God and Lord, besides the Father of all things and His Christ, answer me; for I undertake to prove to you from Scriptures themselves, that He whom the Scripture calls Lord is not one of the two angels that went to Sodom, but He who was with them, and is called God, that appeared to Abraham".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:31
verses.text: And Trypho said, "Prove this; for, as you see, the day advances, and we are not prepared for such perilous replies; since never yet have we heard any man investigating, or searching into, or proving these matters; nor would we have tolerated your conversation, had you not referred everything to the Scriptures: for you are very zealous in adducing proofs from them; and you are of opinion that there is no God above the Maker of all things".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:32
verses.text: Then I replied, "You are aware, then, that the Scripture says, 'And the Lord said to Abraham, Why did Sarah laugh, saying, Shall I truly conceive? for I am old.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:33
verses.text: Is anything impossible with God? At the time appointed shall I return to thee according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:34
verses.text: ' And after a little interval: 'And the men rose up from thence, and looked towards Sodom and Gomorrah; and Abraham went with them, to bring them on the way.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:35
verses.text: And the Lord said, I will not conceal from Abraham, my servant, what I do.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:36
verses.text: ' And again, after a little, it thus says: 'The Lord said, The cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and their sins are very grievous.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:37
verses.text: I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to their cry which has come unto me; and if not, that I may know.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:38
verses.text: And the men turned away thence, and went to Sodom.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:39
verses.text: But Abraham was standing before the Lord; and Abraham drew near, and said, Wilt Thou destroy the righteous with the wicked?' " (and so on, for I do not think fit to write over again the same words, having written them all before, but shall of necessity give those by which I established the proof to Trypho and his companions.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:40
verses.text: Then I proceeded to what follows, in which these words are recorded:) " 'And the Lord went His way as soon as He had left communing with Abraham; and Abraham went to his place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:41
verses.text: And there came two angels to Sodom at even.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:42
verses.text: And Lot sat in the gate of Sodom;' and what follows until, 'But the men put forth their hands, and pulled Lot into the house to them, and shut to the door of the house;' and what follows till, 'And the angels laid hold on his hand, and on the hand of his wife, and on the hands of his daughters, the Lord being merciful to him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:43
verses.text: And it came to pass, when they had brought them forth abroad, that they said, Save, save thy life.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:44
verses.text: Look not behind thee, nor stay in all the neighbourhood; escape to the mountain, lest thou be taken along with them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:45
verses.text: And Lot said to them, I beseech Thee, O Lord, since Thy servant hath found grace in Thy sight, and Thou hast magnified Thy righteousness, which Thou showest towards me in saving my life; but I cannot escape to the mountain, lest evil overtake me, and I die.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:46
verses.text: Behold, this city is near to flee unto, and it is small: there I shall be safe, since it is small; and any soul shall live.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:47
verses.text: And He said to him, Behold, I have accepted thee also in this matter, so as not to destroy the city for which thou hast spoken.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:48
verses.text: Make haste to save thyself there; for I shall not do anything till thou be come thither.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:49
verses.text: Therefore he called the name of the city Segor (Zoar).

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:50
verses.text: The sun was risen upon the earth; and Lot entered into Segor (Zoar).

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:51
verses.text: And the Lord rained on Sodom and Gomorrah sulphur and fire from the Lord out of heaven; and He overthrew these cities, and all the neighbourhood.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:52
verses.text: ' " And after another pause I added: "And now have you not perceived, my friends, that one of the three, who is both God and Lord, and ministers to Him who is in the heavens, is Lord of the two angels? For when the angels proceeded to Sodom, He remained behind, and communed with Abraham in the words recorded by Moses; and when He departed after the conversation, Abraham went back to his place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 56:53
verses.text: And when he came to Sodom, the two angels no longer conversed with Lot, but Himself, as the Scripture makes evident; and He is the Lord who received commission from the Lord who remains in the heavens,  i-e:, the Maker of all things, to inflict upon Sodom and Gomorrah the judgments which the Scripture describes in these terms: 'The Lord rained down upon Sodom and Gomorrah sulphur and fire from the Lord out of heaven.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 57:1
verses.text: Chapter 57 — The Jew objects, why is He said to have eaten, if He be God? Answer of Justin.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 57:2
verses.text: Then Trypho said when I was silent, "That Scripture compels us to admit this, is manifest; but there is a matter about which we are deservedly at a loss — namely, about what was said to the effect that the Lord ate what was prepared and placed before him by Abraham; and you would admit this".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 57:3
verses.text: I answered, "It is written that they ate; and if we believe that it is said the three ate, and not the two alone—who were really angels, and are nourished in the heavens, as is evident to us, even though they are not nourished by food similar to that which mortals use—(for, concerning the sustenance of manna which supported your fathers in the desert, Scripture speaks thus, that they ate angels' food): if we believe that three ate, then I would say that the Scripture which affirms they ate bears the same meaning as when we would say about fire that it has devoured all things; yet it is not certainly understood that they ate, masticating with teeth and jaws.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 57:4
verses.text: So that not even here should we be at a loss about anything, if we are acquainted even slightly with figurative modes of expression, and able to rise above them".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 57:5
verses.text: And Trypho said, "It is possible that the question about the mode of eating may be thus explained: the mode, that is to say, in which it is written, they took and ate what had been prepared by Abraham: so that you may now proceed to explain to us how this God who appeared to Abraham, and is minister to God the Maker of all things, being born of the Virgin, became man, of like passions with all, as you said previously".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 57:6
verses.text: Then I replied, "Permit me first, Trypho, to collect some other proofs on this head, so that you, by the large number of them, may be persuaded of the truth of it, and thereafter I shall explain what you ask".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 57:7
verses.text: And he said, "Do as seems good to you; for I shall be thoroughly pleased".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:1
verses.text: Chapter 58 — The same is proved from the visions which appeared to Jacob.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:2
verses.text: Then I continued, "I purpose to quote to you Scriptures, not that I am anxious to make merely an artful display of words; for I possess no such faculty, but God's grace alone has been granted to me to the understanding of His Scriptures, of which grace I exhort all to become partakers freely and bounteously, in order that they may not, through want of it, incur condemnation in the judgment which God the Maker of all things shall hold through my Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:3
verses.text: And Trypho said, "What you do is worthy of the worship of God; but you appear to me to feign ignorance when you say that you do not possess a store of artful words".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:4
verses.text: I again replied, "Be it so, since you think so; yet I am persuaded that I speak the truth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:5
verses.text: But give me your attention, that I may now rather adduce the remaining proofs".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:6
verses.text: "Proceed," said he.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:7
verses.text: And I continued: "It is again written by Moses, my brethren, that He who is called God and appeared to the patriarchs is called both Angel and Lord, in order that from this you may understand Him to be minister to the Father of all things, as you have already admitted, and may remain firm, persuaded by additional arguments.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:8
verses.text: The word of God, therefore, recorded by Moses, when referring to Jacob the grandson of Abraham, speaks thus: 'And it came to pass, when the sheep conceived, that I saw them with my eyes in the dream: And, behold, the he-goats and the rams which leaped upon the sheep and she-goats were spotted with white, and speckled and sprinkled with a dun colour.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:9
verses.text: And the Angel of God said to me in the dream, Jacob, Jacob.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:10
verses.text: And I said, What is it, Lord? And He said, Lift up thine eyes, and see that the he-goats and rams leaping on the sheep and she-goats are spotted with white, speckled, and sprinkled with a dun colour.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:11
verses.text: For I have seen what Laban doeth unto thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:12
verses.text: I am the God who appeared to thee in Bethel, where thou anointedst a pillar and vowedst a vow unto Me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:13
verses.text: Now therefore arise, and get thee out of this land, and depart to the land of thy birth, and I shall be with thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:14
verses.text: ' And again, in other words, speaking of the same Jacob, it thus says: 'And having risen up that night, he took the two wives, and the two women-servants, and his eleven children, and passed over the ford Jabbok; and he took them and went over the brook, and sent over all his belongings.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:15
verses.text: But Jacob was left behind alone, and an Angel wrestled with him until morning.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:16
verses.text: And He saw that He is not prevailing against him, and He touched the broad part of his thigh; and the broad part of Jacob's thigh grew stiff while he wrestled with Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:17
verses.text: And He said, Let Me go, for the day breaketh.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:18
verses.text: But he said, I will not let Thee go, except Thou bless me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:19
verses.text: And He said to him, What is thy name? And he said, Jacob.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:20
verses.text: And He said, Thy name shall be called no more Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name; for thou hast prevailed with God, and with men shalt be powerful.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:21
verses.text: And Jacob asked Him, and said, Tell me Thy name.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:22
verses.text: But he said, Why dost thou ask after My name? And He blessed him there.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:23
verses.text: And Jacob called the name of that place Peniel, for I saw God face to face, and my soul rejoiced.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:24
verses.text: ' And again, in other terms, referring to the same Jacob, it says the following: 'And Jacob came to Luz, in the land of Canaan, which is Bethel, he and all the people that were with him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:25
verses.text: And there he built an altar, and called the name of that place Bethel; for there God appeared to him when he fled from the face of his brother Esau.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:26
verses.text: And Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died, and was buried beneath Bethel under an oak: and Jacob called the name of it The Oak of Sorrow.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:27
verses.text: And God appeared again to Jacob in Luz, when he came out from Mesopotamia in Syria, and He blessed him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:28
verses.text: And God said to him, Thy name shall be no more called Jacob, but Israel shall he thy name.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:29
verses.text: ' He is called God, and He is and shall be God".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:30
verses.text: And when all had agreed on these grounds, I continued: "Moreover, I consider it necessary to repeat to you the words which narrate how He who is both Angel and God and Lord, and who appeared as a man to Abraham, and who wrestled in human form with Jacob, was seen by him when he fled from his brother Esau.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:31
verses.text: They are as follows: 'And Jacob went out from the well of the oath, and went toward Charran.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:32
verses.text: And he lighted on a spot, and slept there, for the sun was set; and he gathered of the stones of the place, and put them under his head.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:33
verses.text: And he slept in that place; and he dreamed, and, behold, a ladder was set up on the earth, whose top reached to heaven; and the angels of God ascended and descended upon it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:34
verses.text: And the Lord stood above it, and He said, I am the Lord, the God of Abraham thy father, and of Isaac; be not afraid: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed; and thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and shall be extended to the west, and south, and north, and east: and in thee, and in thy seed, shall all families of the earth be blessed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:35
verses.text: And, behold, I am with thee, keeping thee in every way wherein thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for I will not leave thee, until I have done all that I have spoken to thee of.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:36
verses.text: And Jacob awaked out of his sleep, and said, Surely the Lord is in this place, and I knew it not.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:37
verses.text: And he was afraid, and said, How dreadful is this place! this is none other than the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 58:38
verses.text: And Jacob rose up in the morning, and took the stone which he had placed under his head, and he set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it; and Jacob called the name of the place The House of God, and the name of the city formerly was Ulammaus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 59:1
verses.text: Chapter 59 — God distinct from the Father conversed with Moses.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 59:2
verses.text: When I had spoken these words, I continued: "Permit me, further, to show you from the book of Exodus how this same One, who is both Angel, and God, and Lord, and man, and who appeared in human form to Abraham and Isaac, appeared in a flame of fire from the bush, and conversed with Moses".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 59:3
verses.text: And after they said they would listen cheerfully, patiently, and eagerly, I went on: "These words are in the book which bears the title of Exodus: 'And after many days the king of Egypt died, and the children of Israel groaned by reason of the works;' and so on until, 'Go and gather the elders of Israel, and thou shalt say unto them, The Lord God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath appeared to me, saying, I am surely beholding you, and the things which have befallen you in Egypt.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 59:4
verses.text: ' " In addition to these words, I went on: "Have you perceived, sirs, that this very God whom Moses speaks of as an Angel that talked to him in the flame of fire, declares to Moses that He is the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob?".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 60:1
verses.text: Chapter 60 — Opinions of the Jews with regard to Him who appeared in the bush.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 60:2
verses.text: Then Trypho said, "We do not perceive this from the passage quoted by you, but only this, that it was an angel who appeared in the flame of fire, but God who conversed with Moses; so that there were really two persons in company with each other, an angel and God, that appeared in that vision".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 60:3
verses.text: I again replied, "Even if this were so, my friends, that an angel and God were together in the vision seen by Moses, yet, as has already been proved to you by the passages previously quoted, it will not be the Creator of all things that is the God that said to Moses that He was the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, but it will be He who has been proved to you to have appeared to Abraham, ministering to the will of the Maker of all things, and likewise carrying into execution His counsel in the judgment of Sodom; so that, even though it be as you say, that there were two—an angel and God—he who has but the smallest intelligence will not venture to assert that the Maker and Father of all things, having left all supercelestial matters, was visible on a little portion of the earth".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 60:4
verses.text: And Trypho said, "Since it has been previously proved that He who is called God and Lord, and appeared to Abraham, received from the Lord, who is in the heavens, that which He inflicted on the land of Sodom, even although an angel had accompanied the God who appeared to Moses, we shall perceive that the God who communed with Moses from the bush was not the Maker of all things, but He who has been shown to have manifested Himself to Abraham and to Isaac and to Jacob; who also is called and is perceived to be the Angel of God the Maker of all things, because He publishes to men the commands of the Father and Maker of all things".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 60:5
verses.text: And I replied, "Now assuredly, Trypho, I shall show that, in the vision of Moses, this same One alone who is called an Angel, and who is God, appeared to and communed with Moses.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 60:6
verses.text: For the Scripture says thus: 'The Angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire from the bush; and he sees that the bush burns with fire, but the bush was not consumed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 60:7
verses.text: And Moses said, I will turn aside and see this great sight, for the bush is not burnt.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 60:8
verses.text: And when the Lord saw that he is turning aside to behold, the Lord called to him out of the bush.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 60:9
verses.text: ' In the same manner, therefore, in which the Scripture calls Him who appeared to Jacob in the dream an Angel, then says that the same Angel who appeared in the dream spoke to him, saying, 'I am the God that appeared to thee when thou didst flee from the face of Esau thy brother;' and again says that, in the judgment which befell Sodom in the days of Abraham, the Lord had inflicted the punishment of the Lord who dwells in the heavens;—even so here, the Scripture, in announcing that the Angel of the Lord appeared to Moses, and in afterwards declaring him to be Lord and God, speaks of the same One, whom it declares by the many testimonies already quoted to be minister to God, who is above the world, above whom there is no other God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:1
verses.text: Chapter LXI—Wisdom is begotten of the Father, as fire from fire.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:2
verses.text: "I shall give you another testimony, my friends," said I, "from the Scriptures, that God begat before all creatures a Beginning, who was a certain rational power proceeding from Himself, who is called by the Holy Spirit, now the Glory of the Lord, now the Son, again Wisdom, again an Angel, then God, and then Lord and Logos; and on another occasion He calls Himself Captain, when He appeared in human form to Joshua the son of Nave (Nun).

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:3
verses.text: For He can be called by all those names, since He ministers to the Father's will, and since He was begotten of the Father by an act of will; just as we see happening among ourselves: for when we give out some word, we beget the word; yet not by abscission, so as to lessen the word which remains in us, when we give it out: and just as we see also happening in the case of a fire, which is not lessened when it has kindled another, but remains the same; and that which has been kindled by it likewise appears to exist by itself, not diminishing that from which it was kindled.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:4
verses.text: The Word of Wisdom, who is Himself this God begotten of the Father of all things, and Word, and Wisdom, and Power, and the Glory of the Begetter, will bear evidence to me, when He speaks by Solomon the following: 'If I shall declare to you what happens daily, I shall call to mind events from everlasting, and review them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:5
verses.text: The Lord made me the beginning of His ways for His works.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:6
verses.text: From everlasting He established me in the beginning, before He had made the earth, and before He had made the deeps, before the springs of the waters had issued forth, before the mountains had been established.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:7
verses.text: Before all the hills He begets me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:8
verses.text: God made the country, and the desert, and the highest inhabited places under the sky.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:9
verses.text: When He made ready the heavens, I was along with Him, and when He set up His throne on the winds: when He made the high clouds strong, and the springs of the deep safe, when He made the foundations of the earth, I was with Him arranging.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:10
verses.text: I was that in which He rejoiced; daily and at all times I delighted in His countenance, because He delighted in the finishing of the habitable world, and delighted in the sons of men.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:11
verses.text: Now, therefore, O son, hear me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:12
verses.text: Blessed is the man who shall listen to me, and the mortal who shall keep my ways, watching daily at my doors, observing the posts of my ingoings.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:13
verses.text: For my outgoings are the outgoings of life, and my will has been prepared by the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 61:14
verses.text: But they who sin against me, trespass against their own souls; and they who hate me love death.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:1
verses.text: Chapter 62 — The words "Let Us make man" agree with the testimony of Proverbs.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:2
verses.text: "And the same sentiment was expressed, my friends, by the word of God written by Moses, when it indicated to us, with regard to Him whom it has pointed out, that God speaks in the creation of man with the very same design, in the following words: 'Let Us make man after our image and likeness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:3
verses.text: And let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the heaven, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over all the creeping things that creep on the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:4
verses.text: And God created man: after the image of God did He create him; male and female created He them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:5
verses.text: And God blessed them, and said, Increase and multiply, and fill the earth, and have power over it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:6
verses.text: ' And that you may not change the force of the words just quoted, and repeat what your teachers assert,—either that God said to Himself, 'Let Us make,' just as we, when about to do something, oftentimes say to ourselves, 'Let us make;' or that God spoke to the elements, to wit, the earth and other similar substances of which we believe man was formed, 'Let Us make,'—I shall quote again the words narrated by Moses himself, from which we can indisputably learn that God conversed with some one who was numerically distinct from Himself, and also a rational Being.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:7
verses.text: These are the words: 'And God said, Behold, Adam has become as one of us, to know good and evil.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:8
verses.text: ' In saying, therefore, 'as one of us,' Moses has declared that there is a certain number of persons associated with one another, and that they are at least two.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:9
verses.text: For I would not say that the dogma of that heresy which is said to be among you is true, or that the teachers of it can prove that God spoke to angels, or that the human frame was the workmanship of angels.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:10
verses.text: But this Offspring, which was truly brought forth from the Father, was with the Father before all the creatures, and the Father communed with Him; even as the Scripture by Solomon has made clear, that He whom Solomon calls Wisdom, was begotten as a Beginning before all His creatures and as Offspring by God, who has also declared this same thing in the revelation made by Joshua the son of Nave (Nun).

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:11
verses.text: Listen, therefore, to the following from the book of Joshua, that what I say may become manifest to you; it is this: 'And it came to pass, when Joshua was near Jericho, he lifted up his eyes, and sees a man standing over against him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:12
verses.text: And Joshua approached to Him, and said, Art thou for us, or for our adversaries? And He said to him, I am Captain of the Lord's host: now have I come.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:13
verses.text: And Joshua fell on his face on the ground, and said to Him, Lord, what commandest Thou Thy servant? And the Lord's Captain says to Joshua, Loose the shoes off thy feet; for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:14
verses.text: And Jericho was shut up and fortified, and no one went out of it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 62:15
verses.text: And the Lord said to Joshua, Behold, I give into thine hand Jericho, and its king, and its mighty men.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:1
verses.text: Chapter 63 — It is proved that this God was incarnate.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:2
verses.text: And Trypho said, "This point has been proved to me forcibly, and by many arguments, my friend.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:3
verses.text: It remains, then, to prove that He submitted to become man by the Virgin, according to the will of His Father; and to be crucified, and to die.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:4
verses.text: Prove also clearly, that after this He rose again and ascended to heaven".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:5
verses.text: I answered, "This, too, has been already demonstrated by me in the previously quoted words of the prophecies, my friends; which, by recalling and expounding for your sakes, I shall endeavour to lead you to agree with me also about this matter.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:6
verses.text: The passage, then, which Isaiah records, 'Who shall declare His generation? for His life is taken away from the earth,'—does it not appear to you to refer to One who, not having descent from men, was said to be delivered over to death by God for the transgressions of the people?—of whose blood, Moses (as I mentioned before), when speaking in parable, said, that He would wash His garments in the blood of the grape; since His blood did not spring from the seed of man, but from the will of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:7
verses.text: And then, what is said by David, 'In the splendours of Thy holiness have I begotten Thee from the womb, before the morning star.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:8
verses.text: The Lord hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever, after the order of Melchizedek,' — does this not declare to you that He was from of old, and that the God and Father of all things intended Him to be begotten by a human womb? And speaking in other words, which also have been already quoted, he says: 'Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: a sceptre of rectitude is the sceptre of Thy kingdom.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:9
verses.text: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hast hated iniquity: therefore God, even thy God, hath anointed Thee with the oil of gladness above Thy fellows.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:10
verses.text: He hath anointed Thee with myrrh, and oil, and cassia from Thy garments, from the ivory palaces, whereby they made Thee glad.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:11
verses.text: Kings' daughters are in Thy honour.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:12
verses.text: The queen stood at Thy right hand, clad in garments embroidered with gold.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:13
verses.text: Hearken, O daughter, and behold, and incline thine ear, and forget thy people and the house of thy father; and the King shall desire thy beauty: because he is thy Lord, and thou shalt worship Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:14
verses.text: ' Therefore these words testify explicitly that He is witnessed to by Him who established these things, as deserving to be worshipped, as God and as Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 63:15
verses.text: Moreover, that the word of God speaks to those who believe in Him as being one soul, and one synagogue, and one church, as to a daughter; that it thus addresses the church which has sprung from His name and partakes of His name (for we are all called Christians), is distinctly proclaimed in like manner in the following words, which teach us also to forget our old ancestral customs, when they speak thus: 'Hearken, O daughter, and behold, and incline thine ear; forget thy people and the house of thy father, and the King shall desire thy beauty: because He is thy Lord, and thou shalt worship Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:1
verses.text: Chapter 64 — Justin adduces other proofs to the Jew, who denies that he needs this Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:2
verses.text: Here Trypho said, "Let Him be recognised as Lord and Christ and God, as the Scriptures declare, by you of the Gentiles, who have from His name been all called Christians; but we who are servants of God that made this same Christ, do not require to confess or worship Him".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:3
verses.text: To this I replied, "If I were to be quarrelsome and light-minded like you, Trypho, I would no longer continue to converse with you, since you are prepared not to understand what has been said, but only to return some captious answer; but now, since I fear the judgment of God, I do not state an untimely opinion concerning any one of your nation, as to whether or not some of them may be saved by the grace of the Lord of Sabaoth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:4
verses.text: Therefore, although you act wrongfully, I shall continue to reply to any proposition you shall bring forward, and to any contradiction which you make; and, in fact, I do the very same to all men of every nation, who wish to examine along with me, or make inquiry at me, regarding this subject.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:5
verses.text: Accordingly, if you had bestowed attention on the Scriptures previously quoted by me, you would already have understood, that those who are saved of your own nation are saved through this man, and partake of His lot; and you would not certainly have asked me about this matter.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:6
verses.text: I shall again repeat the words of David previously quoted by me, and beg of you to comprehend them, and not to act wrongfully, and stir each other up to give merely some contradiction.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:7
verses.text: The words which David speaks, then, are these: 'The Lord has reigned; let the nations be angry: it is He who sits upon the cherubim; let the earth be shaken.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:8
verses.text: The Lord is great in Zion; and He is high above all the nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:9
verses.text: Let them confess Thy great name, for it is fearful and holy; and the honour of the king loves judgment.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:10
verses.text: Thou hast prepared equity; judgment and righteousness hast Thou performed in Jacob.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:11
verses.text: Exalt the Lord our God, and worship the footstool of His feet; for He is holy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:12
verses.text: Moses and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among them that call upon His name; they called on the Lord, and He heard them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:13
verses.text: In the pillar of the cloud He spake to them; for they kept His testimonies and His commandments which He gave them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:14
