verses.text: ' And from the other words of David, also previously quoted, which you foolishly affirm refer to Solomon, because inscribed for Solomon, it can be proved that they do not refer to Solomon, and that this Christ existed before the sun, and that those of your nation who are saved shall be saved through Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:15
verses.text: The words are these: 'O God, give Thy judgment to the king, and Thy righteousness unto the king's son.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:16
verses.text: He shall judge Thy people with righteousness, and Thy poor with judgment.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:17
verses.text: The mountains shall take up peace to the people, and the little hills righteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:18
verses.text: He shall judge the poor of the people, and shall save the children of the needy, and shall abase the slanderer: and He shall co-endure with the sun, and before the moon unto all generations;' and so on until, 'His name endureth before the sun, and all tribes of the earth shall be blessed in Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:19
verses.text: All nations shall call Him blessed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:20
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things: and blessed be His glorious name for ever and ever: and the whole earth shall be filled with His glory, Amen, Amen.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:21
verses.text: ' And you remember from other words also spoken by David, and which I have mentioned before, how it is declared that He would come forth from the highest heavens, and again return to the same places, in order that you may recognise Him as God coming forth from above, and man living among men; and how it is declared that He will again appear, and they who pierced Him shall see Him, and shall bewail Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:22
verses.text: The words are these: 'The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament showeth His handiwork.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:23
verses.text: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night showeth knowledge: They are not speeches or words whose voices are heard.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:24
verses.text: Their sound has gone out through all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 64:25
verses.text: In the sun has he set his habitation; and he, like a bridegroom going forth from his chamber, will rejoice as a giant to run his race: from the highest heaven is his going forth, and he returns to the highest heaven, and there is not one who shall be hidden from his heat.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:1
verses.text: Chapter 65 — The Jew objects that God does not give His glory to another.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:2
verses.text: Justin explains the passage.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:3
verses.text: And Trypho said, "Being shaken by so many Scriptures, I know not what to say about the Scripture which Isaiah writes, in which God says that He gives not His glory to another, speaking thus 'I am the Lord God; this is my name; my glory will I not give to another, nor my virtues.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:4
verses.text: ' "  And I answered, "If you spoke these words, Trypho, and then kept silence in simplicity and with no ill intent, neither repeating what goes before nor adding what comes after, you must be forgiven; but if you have done so because you imagined that you could throw doubt on the passage, in order that I might say the Scriptures contradicted each other, you have erred.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:5
verses.text: But I shall not venture to suppose or to say such a thing; and if a Scripture which appears to be of such a kind be brought forward, and if there be a pretext for saying that it is contrary to some other, since I am entirely convinced that no Scripture contradicts another, I shall admit rather that I do not understand what is recorded, and shall strive to persuade those who imagine that the Scriptures are contradictory, to be rather of the same opinion as myself.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:6
verses.text: With what intent, then, you have brought forward the difficulty, God knows.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:7
verses.text: But I shall remind you of what the passage says, in order that you may recognise even from this very place that God gives glory to His Christ alone.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:8
verses.text: And I shall take up some short passages, sirs, those which are in connection with what has been said by Trypho, and those which are also joined on in consecutive order.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:9
verses.text: For I will not repeat those of another section, but those which are joined together in one.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:10
verses.text: Do you also give me your attention.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:11
verses.text: The words are these: 'Thus saith the Lord, the God that created the heavens, and made them fast, that established the earth, and that which is in it; and gave breath to the people upon it, and spirit to them who walk therein: I the Lord God have called Thee in righteousness, and will hold Thine hand, and will strengthen Thee; and I have given Thee for a covenant of the people, for a light of the Gentiles, to open the eyes of the blind, to bring out them that are bound from the chains, and those who sit in darkness from the prison-house.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:12
verses.text: I am the Lord God; this is my name: my glory will I not give to another, nor my virtues to graven images.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:13
verses.text: Behold, the former things are come to pass; new things which I announce, and before they are announced they are made manifest to you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:14
verses.text: Sing unto the Lord a new song: His sovereignty is from the end of the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:15
verses.text: Sing, ye who descend into the sea, and continually sail on it; ye islands, and inhabitants thereof.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:16
verses.text: Rejoice, O wilderness, and the villages thereof, and the houses; and the inhabitants of Cedar shall rejoice, and the inhabitants of the rock shall cry aloud from the top of the mountains: they shall give glory to God; they shall publish His virtues among the islands.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:17
verses.text: The Lord God of hosts shall go forth, He shall destroy war utterly, He shall stir up zeal, and He shall cry aloud to the enemies with strength.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 65:18
verses.text: ' " And when I repeated this, I said to them, "Have you perceived, my friends, that God says He will give Him whom He has established as a light of the Gentiles, glory, and to no other; and not, as Trypho said, that God was retaining the glory to Himself?"  Then Trypho answered, "We have perceived this also; pass on therefore to the remainder of the discourse".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:1
verses.text: Chapter 66 — He proves from Isaiah that God was born from a virgin.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:2
verses.text: And I, resuming the discourse where I had left off at a previous stage, when proving that He was born of a virgin, and that His birth of a virgin had been predicted by Isaiah, quoted again the same prophecy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:3
verses.text: It is as follows 'And the Lord spoke again to Ahaz, saying, Ask for thyself a sign from the Lord thy God, in the depth or in the height.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:4
verses.text: And Ahaz said I will not ask, neither will I tempt the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:5
verses.text: And Isaiah said, Hear then, O house of David; Is it no small thing for you to contend with men? And how do you contend with the Lord? Therefore the Lord Himself will give you a sign; Behold, the virgin shall conceive, and shall bear a son, and they shall call his name Immanuel.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:6
verses.text: Butter and honey shall he eat; before he knows or prefers the evil he will choose out the good.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:7
verses.text: For before the child knows ill or good, he rejects evil by choosing out the good.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:8
verses.text: For before the child knows how to call father or mother, he shall receive the power of Damascus, and the spoil of Samaria, in presence of the king of Assyria.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:9
verses.text: And the land shall be forsaken, which thou shalt with difficulty endure in consequence of the presence of its two kings.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:10
verses.text: But God shall bring on thee, and on thy people, and on the house of thy father, days which have not yet come upon thee since the day in which Ephraim took away from Judah the king of Assyria.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 66:11
verses.text: ' " And I continued: "Now it is evident to all, that in the race of Abraham according to the flesh no one has been born of a virgin, or is said to have been born of a virgin, save this our Christ".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:1
verses.text: Chapter 67 — Trypho compares Jesus with Perseus; and would prefer to say that He was elected to be Christ on account of observance of the law.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:2
verses.text: Justin speaks of the law as formerly.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:3
verses.text: And Trypho answered, "The Scripture has not, 'Behold, the virgin shall conceive, and bear a son,' but, 'Behold, the young woman shall conceive, and bear a son,' and so on, as you quoted.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:4
verses.text: But the whole prophecy refers to Hezekiah, and it is proved that it was fulfilled in him, according to the terms of this prophecy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:5
verses.text: Moreover, in the fables of those who are called Greeks, it is written that Perseus was begotten of Danae, who was a virgin; he who was called among them Zeus having descended on her in the form of a golden shower.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:6
verses.text: And you ought to feel ashamed when you make assertions similar to theirs, and rather should say that this Jesus was born man of men.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:7
verses.text: And if you prove from the Scriptures that He is the Christ, and that on account of having led a life conformed to the law, and perfect, He deserved the honour of being elected to be Christ, it is well; but do not venture to tell monstrous phenomena, lest you be convicted of talking foolishly like the Greeks".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:8
verses.text: Then I said to this, "Trypho, I wish to persuade you, and all men in short, of this, that even though you talk worse things in ridicule and in jest, you will not move me from my fixed design; but I shall always adduce from the words which you think can be brought forward by you as proof of your own views, the demonstration of what I have stated along with the testimony of the Scriptures.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:9
verses.text: You are not, however, acting fairly or truthfully in attempting to undo those things in which there has been constantly agreement between us; namely, that certain commands were instituted by Moses on account of the hardness of your people's hearts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:10
verses.text: For you said that, by reason of His living conformably to law, He was elected and became Christ, if indeed He were proved to be so".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:11
verses.text: And Trypho said, "You admitted to us that He was both circumcised, and observed the other legal ceremonies ordained by Moses".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:12
verses.text: And I replied, "I have admitted it, and do admit it: yet I have admitted that He endured all these not as if He were justified by them, but completing the dispensation which His Father, the Maker of all things, and Lord and God, wished Him to complete.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:13
verses.text: For I admit that He endured crucifixion and death, and the incarnation, and the suffering of as many afflictions as your nation put upon Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:14
verses.text: But since again you dissent from that to which you but lately assented, Trypho, answer me: Are those righteous patriarchs who lived before Moses, who observed none of those ordinances which, the Scripture shows, received the commencement of their institution from Moses, saved, and have they attained to the inheritance of the blessed?"  And Trypho said, "The Scriptures compel me to admit it".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:15
verses.text: "Likewise I again ask you," said I, "did God enjoin your fathers to present the offerings and sacrifices because He had need of them, or because of the hardness of their hearts and tendency to idolatry?"  "The latter," said he, "the Scriptures in like manner compel us to admit".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:16
verses.text: "Likewise," said I, "did not the Scriptures predict that God promised to dispense a new covenant besides that which was dispensed in the mountain Horeb?"  This, too, he replied, had been predicted.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:17
verses.text: Then I said again, "Was not the old covenant laid on your fathers with fear and trembling, so that they could not give ear to God?"  He admitted it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:18
verses.text: "What then?" said I: "God promised that there would be another covenant, not like that old one, and said that it would be laid on them without fear, and trembling, and lightnings, and that it would be such as to show what kind of commands and deeds God knows to be eternal and suited to every nation, and what commandments He has given, suiting them to the hardness of your people's hearts, as He exclaims also by the prophets".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:19
verses.text: "To this also," said he, "those who are lovers of truth and not lovers of strife must assuredly assent".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 67:20
verses.text: Then I replied, "I know not how you speak of persons very fond of strife, since you yourself oftentimes were plainly acting in this very manner, frequently contradicting what you had agreed to".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:1
verses.text: Chapter 68 — He complains of the obstinacy of Trypho; he answers his objection; he convicts the Jews of bad faith.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:2
verses.text: And Trypho said, "You endeavour to prove an incredible and well-nigh impossible thing; namely, that God endured to be born and become man".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:3
verses.text: "If I undertook," said I, "to prove this by doctrines or arguments of man, you should not bear with me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:4
verses.text: But if I quote frequently Scriptures, and so many of them, referring to this point, and ask you to comprehend them, you are hard-hearted in the recognition of the mind and will of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:5
verses.text: But if you wish to remain for ever so, I would not be injured at all; and for ever retaining the same opinions which I had before I met with you, I shall leave you".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:6
verses.text: And Trypho said, "Look, my friend, you made yourself master of these truths with much labour and toil.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:7
verses.text: And we accordingly must diligently scrutinize all that we meet with, in order to give our assent to those things which the Scriptures compel us to believe".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:8
verses.text: Then I said to this, "I do not ask you not to strive earnestly by all means, in making an investigation of the matters inquired into; but I ask you, when you have nothing to say, not to contradict those things which you said you had admitted".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:9
verses.text: And Trypho said, "So we shall endeavour to do".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:10
verses.text: I continued again: "In addition to the questions I have just now put to you, I wish to put more: for by means of these questions I shall strive to bring the discourse to a speedy termination".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:11
verses.text: And Trypho said, "Ask the questions".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:12
verses.text: Then I said, "Do you think that any other one is said to be worthy of worship and called Lord and God in the Scriptures, except the Maker of all, and Christ, who by so many Scriptures was proved to you to have become man?"  And Trypho replied, "How can we admit this, when we have instituted so great an inquiry as to whether there is any other than the Father alone?"  Then I again said, "I must ask you this also, that I may know whether or not you are of a different opinion from that which you admitted some time ago".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:13
verses.text: He replied, "It is not, sir".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:14
verses.text: Then again I, "Since you certainly admit these things, and since Scripture says, 'Who shall declare His generation?' ought you not now to suppose that He is not the seed of a human race?"  And Trypho said, "How then does the Word say to David, that out of his loins God shall take to Himself a Son, and shall establish His kingdom, and shall set Him on the throne of His glory?"  And I said, "Trypho, if the prophecy which Isaiah uttered, 'Behold, the virgin shall conceive,' is said not to the house of David, but to another house of the twelve tribes, perhaps the matter would have some difficulty; but since this prophecy refers to the house of David, Isaiah has explained how that which was spoken by God to David in mystery would take place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:15
verses.text: But perhaps you are not aware of this, my friends, that there were many sayings written obscurely, or parabolically, or mysteriously, and symbolical actions, which the prophets who lived after the persons who said or did them expounded".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:16
verses.text: "Assuredly," said Trypho.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:17
verses.text: "If therefore, I shall show that this prophecy of Isaiah refers to our Christ, and not to Hezekiah, as you say, shall I not in this matter, too, compel you not to believe your teachers, who venture to assert that the explanation which your seventy elders that were with Ptolemy the king of the Egyptians gave, is untrue in certain respects? For some statements in the Scriptures, which appear explicitly to convict them of a foolish and vain opinion, these they venture to assert have not been so written.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:18
verses.text: But other statements, which they fancy they can distort and harmonize with human actions, these, they say, refer not to this Jesus Christ of ours, but to him of whom they are pleased to explain them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:19
verses.text: Thus, for instance, they have taught you that this Scripture which we are now discussing refers to Hezekiah, in which, as I promised, I shall show they are wrong.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:20
verses.text: And since they are compelled, they agree that some Scriptures which we mention to them, and which expressly prove that Christ was to suffer, to be worshipped, and to be called God, and which I have already recited to you, do refer indeed to Christ, but they venture to assert that this man is not Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:21
verses.text: But they admit that He will come to suffer, and to reign, and to be worshipped, and to be God; and this opinion I shall in like manner show to be ridiculous and silly.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 68:22
verses.text: But since I am pressed to answer first to what was said by you in jest, I shall make answer to it, and shall afterwards give replies to what follows.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:1
verses.text: Chapter 69 — The devil, since he emulates the truth, has invented fables about Bacchus, Hercules, and aesculapius.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:2
verses.text: "Be well assured, then, Trypho," I continued, "that I am established in the knowledge of and faith in the Scriptures by those counterfeits which he who is called the devil is said to have performed among the Greeks; just as some were wrought by the Magi in Egypt, and others by the false prophets in Elijah's days.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:3
verses.text: For when they tell that Bacchus, son of Jupiter, was begotten by Jupiter's intercourse with Semele, and that he was the discoverer of the vine; and when they relate, that being torn in pieces, and having died, he rose again, and ascended to heaven; and when they introduce wine into his mysteries, do I not perceive that the devil has imitated the prophecy announced by the patriarch Jacob, and recorded by Moses? And when they tell that Hercules was strong, and travelled over all the world, and was begotten by Jove of Alcmene, and ascended to heaven when he died, do I not perceive that the Scripture which speaks of Christ, 'strong as a giant to run his race,' has been in like manner imitated? And when he the devil brings forward aesculapius as the raiser of the dead and healer of all diseases, may I not say that in this matter likewise he has imitated the prophecies about Christ? But since I have not quoted to you such Scripture as tells that Christ will do these things, I must necessarily remind you of one such: from which you can understand, how that to those destitute of a knowledge of God, I mean the Gentiles, who, 'having eyes, saw not, and having a heart, understood not,' worshipping the images of wood, how even to them Scripture prophesied that they would renounce these vanities, and hope in this Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:4
verses.text: It is thus written: 'Rejoice, thirsty wilderness: let the wilderness be glad, and blossom as the lily: the deserts of the Jordan shall both blossom and be glad: and the glory of Lebanon was given to it, and the honour of Carmel.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:5
verses.text: And my people shall see the exaltation of the Lord, and the glory of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:6
verses.text: Be strong, ye careless hands and enfeebled knees.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:7
verses.text: Be comforted, ye faint in soul: be strong, fear not.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:8
verses.text: Behold, our God gives, and will give, retributive judgment.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:9
verses.text: He shall come and save us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:10
verses.text: Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall hear.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:11
verses.text: Then the lame shall leap as an hart, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be distinct: for water has broken forth in the wilderness, and a valley in the thirsty land; and the parched ground shall become pools, and a spring of water shall rise up in the thirsty land.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:12
verses.text: ' The spring of living water which gushed forth from God in the land destitute of the knowledge of God, namely the land of the Gentiles, was this Christ, who also appeared in your nation, and healed those who were maimed, and deaf, and lame in body from their birth, causing them to leap, to hear, and to see, by His word.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:13
verses.text: And having raised the dead, and causing them to live, by His deeds He compelled the men who lived at that time to recognise Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:14
verses.text: But though they saw such works, they asserted it was magical art.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:15
verses.text: For they dared to call Him a magician, and a deceiver of the people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 69:16
verses.text: Yet He wrought such works, and persuaded those who were destined to believe on Him; for even if any one be labouring under a defect of body, yet be an observer of the doctrines delivered by Him, He shall raise him up at His second advent perfectly sound, after He has made him immortal, and incorruptible, and free from grief.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:1
verses.text: Chapter 70 — So also the mysteries of Mithras are distorted from the prophecies of Daniel and Isaiah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:2
verses.text: "And when those who record the mysteries of Mithras say that he was begotten of a rock, and call the place where those who believe in him are initiated a cave, do I not perceive here that the utterance of Daniel, that a stone without hands was cut out of a great mountain, has been imitated by them, and that they have attempted likewise to imitate the whole of Isaiah's words? For they contrived that the words of righteousness be quoted also by them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:3
verses.text: But I must repeat to you the words of Isaiah referred to, in order that from them you may know that these things are so.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:4
verses.text: They are these: 'Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; those that are near shall know my might.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:5
verses.text: The sinners in Zion are removed; trembling shall seize the impious.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:6
verses.text: Who shall announce to you the everlasting place? The man who walks in righteousness, speaks in the right way, hates sin and unrighteousness, and keeps his hands pure from bribes, stops the ears from hearing the unjust judgment of blood closes the eyes from seeing unrighteousness: he shall dwell in the lofty cave of the strong rock.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:7
verses.text: Bread shall be given to him, and his water shall be sure.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:8
verses.text: Ye shall see the King with glory, and your eyes shall look far off.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:9
verses.text: Your soul shall pursue diligently the fear of the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:10
verses.text: Where is the scribe? where are the counsellors? where is he that numbers those who are nourished,—the small and great people? with whom they did not take counsel, nor knew the depth of the voices, so that they heard not.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:11
verses.text: The people who are become depreciated, and there is no understanding in him who hears.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:12
verses.text: ' Now it is evident, that in this prophecy allusion is made to the bread which our Christ gave us to eat, in remembrance of His being made flesh for the sake of His believers, for whom also He suffered; and to the cup which He gave us to drink, in remembrance of His own blood, with giving of thanks.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:13
verses.text: And this prophecy proves that we shall behold this very King with glory; and the very terms of the prophecy declare loudly, that the people foreknown to believe in Him were foreknown to pursue diligently the fear of the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:14
verses.text: Moreover, these Scriptures are equally explicit in saying, that those who are reputed to know the writings of the Scriptures, and who hear the prophecies, have no understanding.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 70:15
verses.text: And when I hear, Trypho," said I, "that Perseus was begotten of a virgin, I understand that the deceiving serpent counterfeited also this.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 71:1
verses.text: Chapter 71 — The Jews reject the interpretation of the LXX.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 71:2
verses.text: , from which, moreover, they have taken away some passages.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 71:3
verses.text: "But I am far from putting reliance in your teachers, who refuse to admit that the interpretation made by the seventy elders who were with Ptolemy king of the Egyptians is a correct one; and they attempt to frame another.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 71:4
verses.text: And I wish you to observe, that they have altogether taken away many Scriptures from the translations effected by those seventy elders who were with Ptolemy, and by which this very man who was crucified is proved to have been set forth expressly as God, and man, and as being crucified, and as dying; but since I am aware that this is denied by all of your nation, I do not address myself to these points, but I proceed to carry on my discussions by means of those passages which are still admitted by you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 71:5
verses.text: For you assent to those which I have brought before your attention, except that you contradict the statement, 'Behold, the virgin shall conceive,' and say it ought to be read, 'Behold, the young woman shall conceive.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 71:6
verses.text: ' And I promised to prove that the prophecy referred, not, as you were taught, to Hezekiah, but to this Christ of mine: and now I shall go to the proof".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 71:7
verses.text: Here Trypho remarked, "We ask you first of all to tell us some of the Scriptures which you allege have been completely cancelled".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 72:1
verses.text: Chapter 72 — Passages have been removed by the Jews from Esdras and Jeremiah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 72:2
verses.text: And I said, "I shall do as you please.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 72:3
verses.text: From the statements, then, which Esdras made in reference to the law of the passover, they have taken away the following: 'And Esdras said to the people, This passover is our Saviour and our refuge.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 72:4
verses.text: And if you have understood, and your heart has taken it in, that we shall humble Him on a standard, and thereafter hope in Him, then this place shall not be forsaken for ever, says the God of hosts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 72:5
verses.text: But if you will not believe Him, and will not listen to His declaration, you shall be a laughing-stock to the nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 72:6
verses.text: ' And from the sayings of Jeremiah they have cut out the following: 'I was like a lamb that is brought to the slaughter: they devised a device against me, saying, Come, let us lay on wood on His bread, and let us blot Him out from the land of the living; and His name shall no more be remembered.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 72:7
verses.text: ' And since this passage from the sayings of Jeremiah is still written in some copies of the Scriptures in the synagogues of the Jews (for it is only a short time since they were cut out), and since from these words it is demonstrated that the Jews deliberated about the Christ Himself, to crucify and put Him to death, He Himself is both declared to be led as a sheep to the slaughter, as was predicted by Isaiah, and is here represented as a harmless lamb; but being in a difficulty about them, they give themselves over to blasphemy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 72:8
verses.text: And again, from the sayings of the same Jeremiah these have been cut out: 'The Lord God remembered His dead people of Israel who lay in the graves; and He descended to preach to them His own salvation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:1
verses.text: Chapter 73 — The words "From the wood" have been cut out of Ps.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:2
verses.text: xcvi.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:3
verses.text: "And from the ninety-fifth (ninety-sixth) Psalm they have taken away this short saying of the words of David: 'From the wood.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:4
verses.text: ' For when the passage said, 'Tell ye among the nations, the Lord hath reigned from the wood,' they have left, 'Tell ye among the nations, the Lord hath reigned.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:5
verses.text: ' Now no one of your people has ever been said to have reigned as God and Lord among the nations, with the exception of Him only who was crucified, of whom also the Holy Spirit affirms in the same Psalm that He was raised again, and freed from the grave, declaring that there is none like Him among the gods of the nations: for they are idols of demons.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:6
verses.text: But I shall repeat the whole Psalm to you, that you may perceive what has been said.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:7
verses.text: It is thus: 'Sing unto the Lord a new song; sing unto the Lord, all the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:8
verses.text: Sing unto the Lord, and bless His name; show forth His salvation from day to day.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:9
verses.text: Declare His glory among the nations, His wonders among all people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:10
verses.text: For the Lord is great, and greatly to be praised: He is to be feared above all the gods.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:11
verses.text: For all the gods of the nations are demons but the Lord made the heavens.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:12
verses.text: Confession and beauty are in His presence; holiness and magnificence are in His sanctuary.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:13
verses.text: Bring to the Lord, O ye countries of the nations, bring to the Lord glory and honour, bring to the Lord glory in His name.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:14
verses.text: Take sacrifices, and go into His courts; worship the Lord in His holy temple.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:15
verses.text: Let the whole earth be moved before Him: tell ye among the nations, the Lord hath reigned.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:16
verses.text: For He hath established the world, which shall not be moved; He shall judge the nations with equity.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:17
verses.text: Let the heavens rejoice, and the earth be glad; let the sea and its fulness shake.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:18
verses.text: Let the fields and all therein be joyful.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:19
verses.text: Let all the trees of the wood be glad before the Lord: for He comes, for He comes to judge the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:20
verses.text: He shall judge the world with righteousness, and the people with His truth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:21
verses.text: ' "  Here Trypho remarked, "Whether or not the rulers of the people have erased any portion of the Scriptures, as you affirm, God knows; but it seems incredible".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:22
verses.text: "Assuredly," said I, "it does seem incredible.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:23
verses.text: For it is more horrible than the calf which they made, when satisfied with manna on the earth; or than the sacrifice of children to demons; or than the slaying of the prophets.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:24
verses.text: But," said I, "you appear to me not to have heard the Scriptures which I said they had stolen away.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 73:25
verses.text: For such as have been quoted are more than enough to prove the points in dispute, besides those which are retained by us, and shall yet be brought forward".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:1
verses.text: Chapter 74 — The beginning of Ps.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:2
verses.text: xcvi.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:3
verses.text: is attributed to the Father by Trypho.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:4
verses.text: But it refers to Christ by these words: "Tell ye among the nations that the Lord," etc.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:5
verses.text: Then Trypho said, "We know that you quoted these because we asked you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:6
verses.text: But it does not appear to me that this Psalm which you quoted last from the words of David refers to any other than the Father and Maker of the heavens and earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:7
verses.text: You, however, asserted that it referred to Him who suffered, whom you also are eagerly endeavouring to prove to be Christ".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:8
verses.text: And I answered, "Attend to me, I beseech you, while I speak of the statement which the Holy Spirit gave utterance to in this Psalm; and you shall know that I speak not sinfully, and that we are not really bewitched; for so you shall be enabled of yourselves to understand many other statements made by the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:9
verses.text: 'Sing unto the Lord a new song; sing unto the Lord, all the earth: sing unto the Lord, and bless His name; show forth His salvation from day to day, His wonderful works among all people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:10
verses.text: ' He bids the inhabitants of all the earth, who have known the mystery of this salvation,  i-e:, the suffering of Christ, by which He saved them, sing and give praises to God the Father of all things, and recognise that He is to be praised and feared, and that He is the Maker of heaven and earth, who effected this salvation in behalf of the human race, who also was crucified and was dead, and who was deemed worthy by Him (God) to reign over all the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:11
verses.text: As is clearly seen also by the land into which He said He would bring your fathers; for He thus speaks: 'This people shall go a whoring after other gods, and shall forsake Me, and shall break my covenant which I made with them in that day; and I will forsake them, and will turn away My face from them; and they shall be devoured, and many evils and afflictions shall find them out; and they shall say in that day, Because the Lord my God is not amongst us, these misfortunes have found us out.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 74:12
verses.text: And I shall certainly turn away My face from them in that day, on account of all the evils which they have committed, in that they have turned to other gods.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:1
verses.text: Chapter 75 — It is proved that Jesus was the name of God in the book of Exodus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:2
verses.text: "Moreover, in the book of Exodus we have also perceived that the name of God Himself which, He says, was not revealed to Abraham or to Jacob, was Jesus, and was declared mysteriously through Moses.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:3
verses.text: Thus it is written: 'And the Lord spake to Moses, Say to this people, Behold, I send My angel before thy face, to keep thee in the way, to bring thee into the land which I have prepared for thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:4
verses.text: Give heed to Him, and obey Him; do not disobey Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:5
verses.text: For He will not draw back from you; for My name is in Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:6
verses.text: ' Now understand that He who led your fathers into the land is called by this name Jesus, and first called Auses (Oshea).

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:7
verses.text: For if you shall understand this, you shall likewise perceive that the name of Him who said to Moses, 'for My name is in Him,' was Jesus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:8
verses.text: For, indeed, He was also called Israel, and Jacob's name was changed to this also.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:9
verses.text: Now Isaiah shows that those prophets who are sent to publish tidings from God are called His angels and apostles.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:10
verses.text: For Isaiah says in a certain place, 'Send me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:11
verses.text: ' And that the prophet whose name was changed, Jesus Joshua, was strong and great, is manifest to all.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 75:12
verses.text: If, then, we know that God revealed Himself in so many forms to Abraham, and to Jacob, and to Moses, how are we at a loss, and do not believe that, according to the will of the Father of all things, it was possible for Him to be born man of the Virgin, especially after we have such Scriptures, from which it can be plainly perceived that He became so according to the will of the Father?.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:1
verses.text: Chapter 76 — From other passages the same majesty and government of Christ are proved.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:2
verses.text: "For when Daniel speaks of 'one like unto the Son of man' who received the everlasting kingdom, does he not hint at this very thing? For he declares that, in saying 'like unto the Son of man,' He appeared, and was man, but not of human seed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:3
verses.text: And the same thing he proclaimed in mystery when he speaks of this stone which was cut out without hands.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:4
verses.text: For the expression 'it was cut out without hands' signified that it is not a work of man, but a work of the will of the Father and God of all things, who brought Him forth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:5
verses.text: And when Isaiah says, 'Who shall declare His generation?' he meant that His descent could not be declared.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:6
verses.text: Now no one who is a man of men has a descent that cannot be declared.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:7
verses.text: And when Moses says that He will wash His garments in the blood of the grape, does not this signify what I have now often told you is an obscure prediction, namely, that He had blood, but not from men; just as not man, but God, has begotten the blood of the vine? And when Isaiah calls Him the Angel of mighty counsel, did he not foretell Him to be the Teacher of those truths which He did teach when He came to earth? For He alone taught openly those mighty counsels which the Father designed both for all those who have been and shall be well-pleasing to Him, and also for those who have rebelled against His will, whether men or angels, when He said: 'They shall come from the east and from the west, and shall sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven: but the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:8
verses.text: ' And, 'Many shall say to Me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not eaten, and drunk, and prophesied, and cast out demons in Thy name? And I will say to them, Depart from Me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:9
verses.text: ' Again, in other words, by which He shall condemn those who are unworthy of salvation, He said, 'Depart into outer darkness, which the Father has prepared for Satan and his, angels.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:10
verses.text: ' And again, in other words, He said, 'I give unto you power to tread on serpents, and on scorpions, and on scolopendras, and on all the might of the enemy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:11
verses.text: ' And now we, who believe on our Lord Jesus, who was crucified under Pontius Pilate, when we exorcise all demons and evil spirits, have them subjected to us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:12
verses.text: For if the prophets declared obscurely that Christ would suffer, and thereafter be Lord of all, yet that declaration could not be understood by any man until He Himself persuaded the apostles that such statements were expressly related in the Scriptures.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:13
verses.text: For He exclaimed before His crucifixion: 'The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the Scribes and Pharisees, and be crucified, and on the third day rise again.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 76:14
verses.text: ' And David predicted that He would be born from the womb before sun and moon, according to the Father's will, and made Him known, being Christ, as God strong and to be worshipped".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:1
verses.text: Chapter 77 — He returns to explain the prophecy of Isaiah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:2
verses.text: Then Trypho said, "I admit that such and so great arguments are sufficient to persuade one; but I wish you to know that I ask you for the proof which you have frequently proposed to give me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:3
verses.text: Proceed then to make this plain to us, that we may see how you prove that that passage refers to this Christ of yours.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:4
verses.text: For we assert that the prophecy relates to Hezekiah".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:5
verses.text: And I replied, "I shall do as you wish.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:6
verses.text: But show me yourselves first of all how it is said of Hezekiah, that before he knew how to call father or mother, he received the power of Damascus and the spoils of Samaria in the presence of the king of Assyria.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:7
verses.text: For it will not be conceded to you, as you wish to explain it, that Hezekiah waged war with the inhabitants of Damascus and Samaria in presence of the king of Assyria.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:8
verses.text: 'For before the child knows how to call father or mother,' the prophetic word said, 'He shall take the power of Damascus and spoils of Samaria in presence of the king of Assyria.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:9
verses.text: ' For if the Spirit of prophecy had not made the statement with an addition, 'Before the child knows how to call father or mother, he shall take the power of Damascus and spoils of Samaria,' but had only said, 'And shall bear a son, and he shall take the power of Damascus and spoils of Samaria,' then you might say that God foretold that he would take these things, since He foreknew it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:10
verses.text: But now the prophecy has stated it with this addition: 'Before the child knows how to call father or mother, he shall take the power of Damascus and spoils of Samaria.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:11
verses.text: ' And you cannot prove that such a thing ever happened to any one among the Jews.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:12
verses.text: But we are able to prove that it happened in the case of our Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:13
verses.text: For at the time of His birth, Magi who came from Arabia worshipped Him, coming first to Herod, who then was sovereign in your land, and whom the Scripture calls king of Assyria on account of his ungodly and sinful character.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 77:14
verses.text: For you know," continued I, "that the Holy Spirit oftentimes announces such events by parables and similitudes; just as He did towards all the people in Jerusalem, frequently saying to them, 'Thy father is an Amorite, and thy mother a Hittite.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:1
verses.text: Chapter 78 — He proves that this prophecy harmonizes with Christ alone, from what is afterwards written.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:2
verses.text: "Now this king Herod, at the time when the Magi came to him from Arabia, and said they knew from a star which appeared in the heavens that a King had been born in your country, and that they had come to worship Him, learned from the elders of your people that it was thus written regarding Bethlehem in the prophet: 'And thou, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, art by no means least among the princes of Judah; for out of thee shall go forth the leader who shall feed my people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:3
verses.text: ' Accordingly the Magi from Arabia came to Bethlehem and worshipped the Child, and presented Him with gifts, gold and frankincense, and myrrh; but returned not to Herod, being warned in a revelation after worshipping the Child in Bethlehem.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:4
verses.text: And Joseph, the spouse of Mary, who wished at first to put away his betrothed Mary, supposing her to be pregnant by intercourse with a man,  i-e:, from fornication, was commanded in a vision not to put away his wife; and the angel who appeared to him told him that what is in her womb is of the Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:5
verses.text: Then he was afraid, and did not put her away; but on the occasion of the first census which was taken in Judaea, under Cyrenius, he went up from Nazareth, where he lived, to Bethlehem, to which he belonged, to be enrolled; for his family was of the tribe of Judah, which then inhabited that region.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:6
verses.text: Then along with Mary he is ordered to proceed into Egypt, and remain there with the Child until another revelation warn them to return into Judaea.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:7
verses.text: But when the Child was born in Bethlehem, since Joseph could not find a lodging in that village, he took up his quarters in a certain cave near the village; and while they were there Mary brought forth the Christ and placed Him in a manger, and here the Magi who came from Arabia found Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:8
verses.text: I have repeated to you," I continued, "what Isaiah foretold about the sign which foreshadowed the cave; but for the sake of those who have come with us to-day, I shall again remind you of the passage".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:9
verses.text: Then I repeated the passage from Isaiah which I have already written, adding that, by means of those words, those who presided over the mysteries of Mithras were stirred up by the devil to say that in a place, called among them a cave, they were initiated by him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:10
verses.text: "So Herod, when the Magi from Arabia did not return to him, as he had asked them to do, but had departed by another way to their own country, according to the commands laid on them; and when Joseph, with Mary and the Child, had now gone into Egypt, as it was revealed to them to do; as he did not know the Child whom the Magi had gone to worship, ordered simply the whole of the children then in Bethlehem to be massacred.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:11
verses.text: And Jeremiah prophesied that this would happen, speaking by the Holy Ghost thus: 'A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation and much wailing, Rachel weeping for her children; and she would not be comforted, because they are not.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:12
verses.text: ' Therefore, on account of the voice which would be heard from Ramah,  i-e:, from Arabia (for there is in Arabia at this very time a place called Rama), wailing would come on the place where Rachel the wife of Jacob called Israel, the holy patriarch, has been buried,  i-e:, on Bethlehem; while the women weep for their own slaughtered children, and have no consolation by reason of what has happened to them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:13
verses.text: For that expression of Isaiah 'He shall take the power of Damascus and spoils of Samaria,' foretold that the power of the evil demon that dwelt in Damascus should be overcome by Christ as soon as He was born; and this is proved to have happened.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:14
verses.text: For the Magi, who were held in bondage for the commission of all evil deeds through the power of that demon, by coming to worship Christ, shows that they have revolted from that dominion which held them captive; and this dominion the Scripture has showed us to reside in Damascus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:15
verses.text: Moreover, that sinful and unjust power is termed well in parable, Samaria.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:16
verses.text: And none of you can deny that Damascus was, and is, in the region of Arabia, although now it belongs to what is called Syrophoenicia.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:17
verses.text: Hence it would be becoming for you, sirs, to learn what you have not perceived, from those who have received grace from God, namely, from us Christians; and not to strive in every way to maintain your own doctrines, dishonouring those of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:18
verses.text: Therefore also this grace has been transferred to us, as Isaiah says, speaking to the following effect: 'This people draws near to Me, they honour Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me; but in vain they worship Me, teaching the commands and doctrines of men.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 78:19
verses.text: Therefore, behold, I will proceed to remove this people, and I shall remove them; and I shall take away the wisdom of their wise men, and bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent men.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:1
verses.text: Chapter 79 — He proves against Trypho that the wicked angels have revolted from God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:2
verses.text: On this, Trypho, who was somewhat angry, but respected the Scriptures, as was manifest from his countenance, said to me, "The utterances of God are holy, but your expositions are mere contrivances, as is plain from what has been explained by you; nay, even blasphemies, for you assert that angels sinned and revolted from God".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:3
verses.text: And I, wishing to get him to listen to me, answered in milder tones, thus: "I admire, sir, this piety of yours; and I pray that you may entertain the same disposition towards Him to whom angels are recorded to minister, as Daniel says; for one like the Son of man is led to the Ancient of days, and every kingdom is given to Him for ever and ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:4
verses.text: But that you may know, sir," continued I, "that it is not our audacity which has induced us to adopt this exposition, which you reprehend, I shall give you evidence from Isaiah himself; for he affirms that evil angels have dwelt and do dwell in Tanis, in Egypt.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:5
verses.text: These are his words: 'Woe to the rebellious children! Thus saith the Lord, You have taken counsel, but not through Me; and made agreements, but not through My Spirit, to add sins to sins; who have sinned in going down to Egypt (but they have not inquired at Me), that they may be assisted by Pharaoh, and be covered with the shadow of the Egyptians.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:6
verses.text: For the shadow of Pharaoh shall be a disgrace to you, and a reproach to those who trust in the Egyptians; for the princes in Tanis are evil angels.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:7
verses.text: In vain will they labour for a people which will not profit them by assistance, but will be for a disgrace and a reproach to them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:8
verses.text: ' And, further, Zechariah tells, as you yourself have related, that the devil stood on the right hand of Joshua the priest, to resist him; and the Lord said, 'The Lord, who has taken Jerusalem, rebuke thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:9
verses.text: ' And again, it is written in Job, as you said yourself, how that the angels came to stand before the Lord, and the devil came with them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:10
verses.text: And we have it recorded by Moses in the beginning of Genesis, that the serpent beguiled Eve, and was cursed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:11
verses.text: And we know that in Egypt there were magicians who emulated the mighty power displayed by God through the faithful servant Moses.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 79:12
verses.text: And you are aware that David said, 'The gods of the nations are demons.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 80:1
verses.text: Chapter 80 — The opinion of Justin with regard to the reign of a thousand years.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 80:2
verses.text: Several Catholics reject it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 80:3
verses.text: And Trypho to this replied, "I remarked to you sir, that you are very anxious to be safe in all respects, since you cling to the Scriptures.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 80:4
verses.text: But tell me, do you really admit that this place, Jerusalem, shall be rebuilt; and do you expect your people to be gathered together, and made joyful with Christ and the patriarchs, and the prophets, both the men of our nation, and other proselytes who joined them before your Christ came? or have you given way, and admitted this in order to have the appearance of worsting us in the controversies?"  Then I answered, "I am not so miserable a fellow, Trypho, as to say one thing and think another.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 80:5
verses.text: I admitted to you formerly, that I and many others are of this opinion, and believe that such will take place, as you assuredly are aware; but, on the other hand, I signified to you that many who belong to the pure and pious faith, and are true Christians, think otherwise.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 80:6
verses.text: Moreover, I pointed out to you that some who are called Christians, but are godless, impious heretics, teach doctrines that are in every way blasphemous, atheistical, and foolish.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 80:7
verses.text: But that you may know that I do not say this before you alone, I shall draw up a statement, so far as I can, of all the arguments which have passed between us; in which I shall record myself as admitting the very same things which I admit to you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 80:8
verses.text: For I choose to follow not men or men's doctrines, but God and the doctrines delivered by Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 80:9
verses.text: For if you have fallen in with some who are called Christians, but who do not admit this truth, and venture to blaspheme the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob; who say there is no resurrection of the dead, and that their souls, when they die, are taken to heaven; do not imagine that they are Christians, even as one, if he would rightly consider it, would not admit that the Sadducees, or similar sects of Genistae, Meristae, Galilaeans, Hellenists, Pharisees, Baptists, are Jews (do not hear me impatiently when I tell you what I think), but are only called Jews and children of Abraham, worshipping God with the lips, as God Himself declared, but the heart was far from Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 80:10
verses.text: But I and others, who are right-minded Christians on all points, are assured that there will be a resurrection of the dead, and a thousand years in Jerusalem, which will then be built, adorned, and enlarged, as the prophets Ezekiel and Isaiah and others declare.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:1
verses.text: Chapter 81 — He endeavours to prove this opinion from Isaiah and the Apocalypse.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:2
verses.text: "For Isaiah spake thus concerning this space of a thousand years: 'For there shall be the new heaven and the new earth, and the former shall not be remembered, or come into their heart; but they shall find joy and gladness in it, which things I create.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:3
verses.text: For, Behold, I make Jerusalem a rejoicing, and My people a joy; and I shall rejoice over Jerusalem, and be glad over My people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:4
verses.text: And the voice of weeping shall be no more heard in her, or the voice of crying.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:5
verses.text: And there shall be no more there a person of immature years, or an old man who shall not fulfil his days.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:6
verses.text: For the young man shall be an hundred years old; but the sinner who dies an hundred years old, he shall be accursed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:7
verses.text: And they shall build houses, and shall themselves inhabit them; and they shall plant vines, and shall themselves eat the produce of them, and drink the wine.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:8
verses.text: They shall not build, and others inhabit; they shall not plant, and others eat.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:9
verses.text: For according to the days of the tree of life shall be the days of my people; the works of their toil shall abound.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:10
verses.text: Mine elect shall not toil fruitlessly, or beget children to be cursed; for they shall be a seed righteous and blessed by the Lord, and their offspring with them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:11
verses.text: And it shall come to pass, that before they call I will hear; while they are still speaking, I shall say, What is it? Then shall the wolves and the lambs feed together, and the lion shall eat straw like the ox; but the serpent shall eat earth as bread.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:12
verses.text: They shall not hurt or maltreat each other on the holy mountain, saith the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:13
verses.text: ' Now we have understood that the expression used among these words, 'According to the days of the tree of life shall be the days of my people; the works of their toil shall abound' obscurely predicts a thousand years.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:14
verses.text: For as Adam was told that in the day he ate of the tree he would die, we know that he did not complete a thousand years.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:15
verses.text: We have perceived, moreover, that the expression, 'The day of the Lord is as a thousand years,' is connected with this subject.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:16
verses.text: And further, there was a certain man with us, whose name was John, one of the apostles of Christ, who prophesied, by a revelation that was made to him, that those who believed in our Christ would dwell a thousand years in Jerusalem; and that thereafter the general, and, in short, the eternal resurrection and judgment of all men would likewise take place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 81:17
verses.text: Just as our Lord also said, 'They shall neither marry nor be given in marriage, but shall be equal to the angels, the children of the God of the resurrection.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:1
verses.text: Chapter 82 — The prophetical gifts of the Jews were transferred to the Christians.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:2
verses.text: "For the prophetical gifts remain with us, even to the present time.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:3
verses.text: And hence you ought to understand that the gifts formerly among your nation have been transferred to us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:4
verses.text: And just as there were false prophets contemporaneous with your holy prophets, so are there now many false teachers amongst us, of whom our Lord forewarned us to beware; so that in no respect are we deficient, since we know that He foreknew all that would happen to us after His resurrection from the dead and ascension to heaven.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:5
verses.text: For He said we would be put to death, and hated for His name's sake; and that many false prophets and false Christs would appear in His name, and deceive many: and so has it come about.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:6
verses.text: For many have taught godless, blasphemous, and unholy doctrines, forging them in His name; have taught, too, and even yet are teaching, those things which proceed from the unclean spirit of the devil, and which were put into their hearts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:7
verses.text: Therefore we are most anxious that you be persuaded not to be misled by such persons, since we know that every one who can speak the truth, and yet speaks it not, shall be judged by God, as God testified by Ezekiel, when He said, 'I have made thee a watchman to the house of Judah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:8
verses.text: If the sinner sin, and thou warn him not, he himself shall die in his sin; but his blood will I require at thine hand.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:9
verses.text: But if thou warn him, thou shalt be innocent.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:10
verses.text: ' And on this account we are, through fear, very earnest in desiring to converse with men according to the Scriptures, but not from love of money, or of glory, or of pleasure.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:11
verses.text: For no man can convict us of any of these vices.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:12
verses.text: No more do we wish to live like the rulers of your people, whom God reproaches when He says, 'Your rulers are companions of thieves, lovers of bribes, followers of the rewards.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 82:13
verses.text: ' Now, if you know certain amongst us to be of this sort, do not for their sakes blaspheme the Scriptures and Christ, and do not assiduously strive to give falsified interpretations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:1
verses.text: Chapter 83 — It is proved that the Psalm, "The Lord said to My Lord," etc.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:2
verses.text: , does not suit Hezekiah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:3
verses.text: "For your teachers have ventured to refer the passage, 'The Lord says to my Lord, Sit at my right hand, till I make Thine enemies Thy footstool,' to Hezekiah; as if he were requested to sit on the right side of the temple, when the king of Assyria sent to him and threatened him; and he was told by Isaiah not to be afraid.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:4
verses.text: Now we know and admit that what Isaiah said took place; that the king of Assyria desisted from waging war against Jerusalem in Hezekiah's days, and the angel of the Lord slew about ,  of the host of the Assyrians.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:5
verses.text: But it is manifest that the Psalm does not refer to him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:6
verses.text: For thus it is written, 'The Lord says to my Lord, Sit at My right hand, till I make Thine enemies Thy footstool.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:7
verses.text: He shall send forth a rod of power over Jerusalem, and it shall rule in the midst of Thine enemies.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:8
verses.text: In the splendour of the saints before the morning star have I begotten Thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:9
verses.text: The Lord hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:10
verses.text: ' Who does not admit, then, that Hezekiah is no priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek? And who does not know that he is not the redeemer of Jerusalem? And who does not know that he neither sent a rod of power into Jerusalem, nor ruled in the midst of his enemies; but that it was God who averted from him the enemies, after he mourned and was afflicted? But our Jesus, who has not yet come in glory, has sent into Jerusalem a rod of power, namely, the word of calling and repentance meant for all nations over which demons held sway, as David says, 'The gods of the nations are demons.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:11
verses.text: ' And His strong word has prevailed on many to forsake the demons whom they used to serve, and by means of it to believe in the Almighty God because the gods of the nations are demons.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 83:12
verses.text: And we mentioned formerly that the statement, 'In the splendour of the saints before the morning star have I begotten Thee from the womb,' is made to Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 84:1
verses.text: Chapter 84 — That prophecy, "Behold, a virgin," etc.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 84:2
verses.text: , suits Christ alone.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 84:3
verses.text: "Moreover, the prophecy, 'Behold, the virgin shall conceive, and bear a son,' was uttered respecting Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 84:4
verses.text: For if He to whom Isaiah referred was not to be begotten of a virgin, of whom did the Holy Spirit declare, 'Behold, the Lord Himself shall give us a sign: behold, the virgin shall conceive, and bear a son?' For if He also were to be begotten of sexual intercourse, like all other first-born sons, why did God say that He would give a sign which is not common to all the first-born sons? But that which is truly a sign, and which was to be made trustworthy to mankind,—namely, that the first-begotten of all creation should become incarnate by the Virgin's womb, and be a child,—this he anticipated by the Spirit of prophecy, and predicted it, as I have repeated to you, in various ways; in order that, when the event should take place, it might be known as the operation of the power and will of the Maker of all things; just as Eve was made from one of Adam's ribs, and as all living beings were created in the beginning by the word of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 84:5
verses.text: But you in these matters venture to pervert the expositions which your elders that were with Ptolemy king of Egypt gave forth, since you assert that the Scripture is not so as they have expounded it, but says, 'Behold, the young woman shall conceive,' as if great events were to be inferred if a woman should beget from sexual intercourse: which indeed all young women, with the exception of the barren, do; but even these, God, if He wills, is able to cause to bear.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 84:6
verses.text: For Samuel's mother, who was barren, brought forth by the will of God; and so also the wife of the holy patriarch Abraham; and Elisabeth, who bore John the Baptist, and other such.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 84:7
verses.text: So that you must not suppose that it is impossible for God to do anything He wills.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 84:8
verses.text: And especially when it was predicted that this would take place, do not venture to pervert or misinterpret the prophecies, since you will injure yourselves alone, and will not harm God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:1
verses.text: Chapter 85 — He proves that Christ is the Lord of Hosts from Ps.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:2
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:3
verses.text: , and from his authority over demons.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:4
verses.text: "Moreover, some of you venture to expound the prophecy which runs, 'Lift up your gates, ye rulers; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors, that the King of glory may enter,' as if it referred likewise to Hezekiah, and others of you expound it of Solomon; but neither to the latter nor to the former, nor, in short, to any of your kings, can it be proved to have reference, but to this our Christ alone, who appeared without comeliness, and inglorious, as Isaiah and David and all the Scriptures said; who is the Lord of hosts, by the will of the Father who conferred on Him the dignity; who also rose from the dead, and ascended to heaven, as the Psalm and the other Scriptures manifested when they announced Him to be Lord of hosts; and of this you may, if you will, easily be persuaded by the occurrences which take place before your eyes.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:5
verses.text: For every demon, when exorcised in the name of this very Son of God — who is the First-born of every creature, who became man by the Virgin, who suffered, and was crucified under Pontius Pilate by your nation, who died, who rose from the dead, and ascended into heaven — is overcome and subdued.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:6
verses.text: But though you exorcise any demon in the name of any of those who were amongst you—either kings, or righteous men, or prophets, or patriarchs—it will not be subject to you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:7
verses.text: But if any of you exorcise it in the name of the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, it will perhaps be subject to you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:8
verses.text: Now assuredly your exorcists, I have said, make use of craft when they exorcise, even as the Gentiles do, and employ fumigations and incantations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:9
verses.text: But that they are angels and powers whom the word of prophecy by David commands to lift up the gates, that He who rose from the dead, Jesus Christ, the Lord of hosts, according to the will of the Father, might enter, the word of David has likewise showed; which I shall again recall to your attention for the sake of those who were not with us yesterday, for whose benefit, moreover, I sum up many things I said yesterday.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:10
verses.text: And now, if I say this to you, although I have repeated it many times, I know that it is not absurd so to do.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:11
verses.text: For it is a ridiculous thing to see the sun, and the moon, and the other stars, continually keeping the same course, and bringing round the different seasons; and to see the computer who may be asked how many are twice two, because he has frequently said that they are four, not ceasing to say again that they are four; and equally so other things, which are confidently admitted, to be continually mentioned and admitted in like manner; yet that he who founds his discourse on the prophetic Scriptures should leave them and abstain from constantly referring to the same Scriptures, because it is thought he can bring forth something better than Scripture.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:12
verses.text: The passage, then, by which I proved that God reveals that there are both angels and hosts in heaven is this: 'Praise the Lord from the heavens: praise Him in the highest.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:13
verses.text: Praise Him, all His angels: praise Him, all His hosts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:14
verses.text: ' "  Then one of those who had come with them on the second day, whose name was Mnaseas, said, "We are greatly pleased that you undertake to repeat the same things on our account".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:15
verses.text: And I said, "Listen, my friends, to the Scripture which induces me to act thus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:16
verses.text: Jesus commanded us to love even our enemies, as was predicted by Isaiah in many passages, in which also is contained the mystery of our own regeneration, as well, in fact, as the regeneration of all who expect that Christ will appear in Jerusalem, and by their works endeavour earnestly to please Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:17
