verses.text: These are the words spoken by Isaiah: 'Hear the word of the Lord, ye that tremble at His word.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:18
verses.text: Say, our brethren, to them that hate you and detest you, that the name of the Lord has been glorified.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:19
verses.text: He has appeared to your joy, and they shall be ashamed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:20
verses.text: A voice of noise from the city, a voice from the temple, a voice of the Lord who rendereth recompense to the proud.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:21
verses.text: Before she that travailed brought forth, and before the pains of labour came, she brought forth a male child.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:22
verses.text: Who hath heard such a thing? and who hath seen such a thing? has the earth brought forth in one day? and has she produced a nation at once? for Zion has travailed and borne her children.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:23
verses.text: But I have given such an expectation even to her that does not bring forth, said the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:24
verses.text: Behold, I have made her that begetteth, and her that is barren, saith the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:25
verses.text: Rejoice, O Jerusalem, and hold a joyous assembly, all ye that love her.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 85:26
verses.text: Be glad, all ye that mourn for her, that ye may suck and be filled with the breast of her consolation, that having suck ye may be delighted with the entrance of His glory.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:1
verses.text: Chapter 86 — There are various figures in the Old Testament of the wood of the cross by which Christ reigned.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:2
verses.text: And when I had quoted this, I added, "Hear, then, how this Man, of whom the Scriptures declare that He will come again in glory after His crucifixion, was symbolized both by the tree of life, which was said to have been planted in paradise, and by those events which should happen to all the just.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:3
verses.text: Moses was sent with a rod to effect the redemption of the people; and with this in his hands at the head of the people, he divided the sea.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:4
verses.text: By this he saw the water gushing out of the rock; and when he cast a tree into the waters of Marah, which were bitter, he made them sweet.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:5
verses.text: Jacob, by putting rods into the water-troughs, caused the sheep of his uncle to conceive, so that he should obtain their young.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:6
verses.text: With his rod the same Jacob boasts that he had crossed the river.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:7
verses.text: He said he had seen a ladder, and the Scripture has declared that God stood above it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:8
verses.text: But that this was not the Father, we have proved from the Scriptures.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:9
verses.text: And Jacob, having poured oil on a stone in the same place, is testified to by the very God who appeared to him, that he had anointed a pillar to the God who appeared to him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:10
verses.text: And that the stone symbolically proclaimed Christ, we have also proved by many Scriptures; and that the unguent, whether it was of oil, or of stacte, or of any other compounded sweet balsams, had reference to Him, we have also proved, inasmuch as the word says: 'Therefore God, even Thy God, hath anointed Thee with the oil of gladness above Thy fellows.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:11
verses.text: ' For indeed all kings and anointed persons obtained from Him their share in the names of kings and anointed: just as He Himself received from the Father the titles of King, and Christ, and Priest, and Angel, and such like other titles which He bears or did bear.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:12
verses.text: Aaron's rod, which blossomed, declared him to be the high priest.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:13
verses.text: Isaiah prophesied that a rod would come forth from the root of Jesse, and this was Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:14
verses.text: And David says that the righteous man is 'like the tree that is planted by the channels of waters, which should yield its fruit in its season, and whose leaf should not fade.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:15
verses.text: ' Again, the righteous is said to flourish like the palm-tree.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:16
verses.text: God appeared from a tree to Abraham, as it is written, near the oak in Mamre.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:17
verses.text: The people found seventy willows and twelve springs after crossing the Jordan.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:18
verses.text: David affirms that God comforted him with a rod and staff.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:19
verses.text: Elisha, by casting a stick into the river Jordan, recovered the iron part of the axe with which the sons of the prophets had gone to cut down trees to build the house in which they wished to read and study the law and commandments of God; even as our Christ, by being crucified on the tree, and by purifying us with water, has redeemed us, though plunged in the direst offences which we have committed, and has made us a house of prayer and adoration.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 86:20
verses.text: Moreover, it was a rod that pointed out Judah to be the father of Tamar's sons by a great mystery".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:1
verses.text: Chapter 87 — Trypho maintains in objection these words: "And shall rest on Him," etc.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:2
verses.text: They are explained by Justin.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:3
verses.text: Hereupon Trypho, after I had spoken these words, said, "Do not now suppose that I am endeavouring, by asking what I do ask, to overturn the statements you have made; but I wish to receive information respecting those very points about which I now inquire.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:4
verses.text: Tell me, then, how, when the Scripture asserts by Isaiah, 'There shall come forth a rod from the root of Jesse; and a flower shall grow up from the root of Jesse; and the Spirit of God shall rest upon Him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and piety: and the spirit of the fear of the Lord shall fill Him:' (now you admitted to me," continued he, "that this referred to Christ, and you maintain Him to be pre-existent God, and having become incarnate by God's will, to be born man by the Virgin:) how He can be demonstrated to have been pre-existent, who is filled with the powers of the Holy Ghost, which the Scripture by Isaiah enumerates, as if He were in lack of them?"  Then I replied, "You have inquired most discreetly and most prudently, for truly there does seem to be a difficulty; but listen to what I say, that you may perceive the reason of this also.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:5
verses.text: The Scripture says that these enumerated powers of the Spirit have come on Him, not because He stood in need of them, but because they would rest in Him,  i-e:, would find their accomplishment in Him, so that there would be no more prophets in your nation after the ancient custom: and this fact you plainly perceive.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:6
verses.text: For after Him no prophet has arisen among you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:7
verses.text: Now, that you may know that your prophets, each receiving some one or two powers from God, did and spoke the things which we have learned from the Scriptures, attend to the following remarks of mine.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:8
verses.text: Solomon possessed the spirit of wisdom, Daniel that of understanding and counsel, Moses that of might and piety, Elijah that of fear, and Isaiah that of knowledge; and so with the others: each possessed one power, or one joined alternately with another; also Jeremiah, and the twelve prophets, and David, and, in short, the rest who existed amongst you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:9
verses.text: Accordingly He rested,  i-e:, ceased, when He came, after whom, in the times of this dispensation wrought out by Him amongst men, it was requisite that such gifts should cease from you; and having received their rest in Him, should again, as had been predicted, become gifts which, from the grace of His Spirit's power, He imparts to those who believe in Him, according as He deems each man worthy thereof.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:10
verses.text: I have already said, and do again say, that it had been prophesied that this would be done by Him after His ascension to heaven.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:11
verses.text: It is accordingly said, 'He ascended on high, He led captivity captive, He gave gifts unto the sons of men.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 87:12
verses.text: ' And again, in another prophecy it is said: 'And it shall come to pass after this, I will pour out My Spirit on all flesh, and on My servants, and on My handmaids, and they shall prophesy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 88:1
verses.text: Chapter 88 — Christ has not received the Holy Spirit on account of poverty.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 88:2
verses.text: "Now, it is possible to see amongst us women and men who possess gifts of the Spirit of God; so that it was prophesied that the powers enumerated by Isaiah would come upon Him, not because He needed power, but because these would not continue after Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 88:3
verses.text: And let this be a proof to you, namely, what I told you was done by the Magi from Arabia, who as soon as the Child was born came to worship Him, for even at His birth He was in possession of His power; and as He grew up like all other men, by using the fitting means, He assigned its own requirements to each development, and was sustained by all kinds of nourishment, and waited for thirty years, more or less, until John appeared before Him as the herald of His approach, and preceded Him in the way of baptism, as I have already shown.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 88:4
verses.text: And then, when Jesus had gone to the river Jordan, where John was baptizing, and when He had stepped into the water, a fire was kindled in the Jordan; and when He came out of the water, the Holy Ghost lighted on Him like a dove, as the apostles of this very Christ of ours wrote.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 88:5
verses.text: Now, we know that he did not go to the river because He stood in need of baptism, or of the descent of the Spirit like a dove; even as He submitted to be born and to be crucified, not because He needed such things, but because of the human race, which from Adam had fallen under the power of death and the guile of the serpent, and each one of which had committed personal transgression.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 88:6
verses.text: For God, wishing both angels and men, who were endowed with free-will, and at their own disposal, to do whatever He had strengthened each to do, made them so, that if they chose the things acceptable to Himself, He would keep them free from death and from punishment; but that if they did evil, He would punish each as He sees fit.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 88:7
verses.text: For it was not His entrance into Jerusalem sitting on an ass, which we have showed was prophesied, that empowered Him to be Christ, but it furnished men with a proof that He is the Christ; just as it was necessary in the time of John that men have proof, that they might know who is Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 88:8
verses.text: For when John remained by the Jordan, and preached the baptism of repentance, wearing only a leathern girdle and a vesture made of camels' hair, eating nothing but locusts and wild honey, men supposed him to be Christ; but he cried to them, 'I am not the Christ, but the voice of one crying; for He that is stronger than I shall come, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 88:9
verses.text: ' And when Jesus came to the Jordan, He was considered to be the son of Joseph the carpenter; and He appeared without comeliness, as the Scriptures declared; and He was deemed a carpenter (for He was in the habit of working as a carpenter when among men, making ploughs and yokes; by which He taught the symbols of righteousness and an active life); but then the Holy Ghost, and for man's sake, as I formerly stated, lighted on Him in the form of a dove, and there came at the same instant from the heavens a voice, which was uttered also by David when he spoke, personating Christ, what the Father would say to Him: 'Thou art My Son: this day have I begotten Thee;' the Father saying that His generation would take place for men, at the time when they would become acquainted with Him: 'Thou art My Son; this day have I begotten thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 89:1
verses.text: Chapter 89 — The cross alone is offensive to Trypho on account of the curse, yet it proves that Jesus is Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 89:2
verses.text: Then Trypho remarked, "Be assured that all our nation waits for Christ; and we admit that all the Scriptures which you have quoted refer to Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 89:3
verses.text: Moreover, I do also admit that the name of Jesus, by which the the son of Nave (Nun) was called, has inclined me very strongly to adopt this view.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 89:4
verses.text: But whether Christ should be so shamefully crucified, this we are in doubt about.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 89:5
verses.text: For whosoever is crucified is said in the law to be accursed, so that I am exceedingly incredulous on this point.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 89:6
verses.text: It is quite clear, indeed, that the Scriptures announce that Christ had to suffer; but we wish to learn if you can prove it to us whether it was by the suffering cursed in the law".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 89:7
verses.text: I replied to him, "If Christ was not to suffer, and the prophets had not foretold that He would be led to death on account of the sins of the people, and be dishonoured and scourged, and reckoned among the transgressors, and as a sheep be led to the slaughter, whose generation, the prophet says, no man can declare, then you would have good cause to wonder.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 89:8
verses.text: But if these are to be characteristic of Him and mark Him out to all, how is it possible for us to do anything else than believe in Him most confidently? And will not as many as have understood the writings of the prophets, whenever they hear merely that He was crucified, say that this is He and no other?".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:1
verses.text: Chapter 90 — The stretched-out hands of Moses signified beforehand the cross.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:2
verses.text: "Bring us on, then," said Trypho, "by the Scriptures, that we may also be persuaded by you; for we know that He should suffer and be led as a sheep.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:3
verses.text: But prove to us whether He must be crucified and die so disgracefully and so dishonourably by the death cursed in the law.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:4
verses.text: For we cannot bring ourselves even to think of this".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:5
verses.text: "You know," said I, "that what the prophets said and did they veiled by parables and types, as you admitted to us; so that it was not easy for all to understand the most of what they said, since they concealed the truth by these means, that those who are eager to find out and learn it might do so with much labour".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:6
verses.text: They answered, "We admitted this".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:7
verses.text: "Listen, therefore," say I, "to what follows; for Moses first exhibited this seeming curse of Christ's by the signs which he made".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:8
verses.text: "Of what signs do you speak?" said he.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:9
verses.text: "When the people," replied I, "waged war with Amalek, and the son of Nave (Nun) by name Jesus (Joshua), led the fight, Moses himself prayed to God, stretching out both hands, and Hur with Aaron supported them during the whole day, so that they might not hang down when he got wearied.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:10
verses.text: For if he gave up any part of this sign, which was an imitation of the cross, the people were beaten, as is recorded in the writings of Moses; but if he remained in this form, Amalek was proportionally defeated, and he who prevailed prevailed by the cross.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:11
verses.text: For it was not because Moses so prayed that the people were stronger, but because, while one who bore the name of Jesus (Joshua) was in the forefront of the battle, he himself made the sign of the cross.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:12
verses.text: For who of you knows not that the prayer of one who accompanies it with lamentation and tears, with the body prostrate, or with bended knees, propitiates God most of all? But in such a manner neither he nor any other one, while sitting on a stone, prayed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 90:13
verses.text: Nor even the stone symbolized Christ, as I have shown.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:1
verses.text: Chapter 91 — The cross was foretold in the blessings of Joseph, and in the serpent that was lifted up.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:2
verses.text: "And God by Moses shows in another way the force of the mystery of the cross, when He said in the blessing wherewith Joseph was blessed, 'From the blessing of the Lord is his land; for the seasons of heaven, and for the dews, and for the deep springs from beneath, and for the seasonable fruits of the sun, and for the coming together of the months, and for the heights of the everlasting mountains, and for the heights of the hills, and for the ever-flowing rivers, and for the fruits of the fatness of the earth; and let the things accepted by Him who appeared in the bush come on the head and crown of Joseph.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:3
verses.text: Let him be glorified among his brethren; his beauty is like the firstling of a bullock; his horns the horns of an unicorn: with these shall he push the nations from one end of the earth to another.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:4
verses.text: ' Now, no one could say or prove that the horns of an unicorn represent any other fact or figure than the type which portrays the cross.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:5
verses.text: For the one beam is placed upright, from which the highest extremity is raised up into a horn, when the other beam is fitted on to it, and the ends appear on both sides as horns joined on to the one horn.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:6
verses.text: And the part which is fixed in the centre, on which are suspended those who are crucified, also stands out like a horn; and it also looks like a horn conjoined and fixed with the other horns.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:7
verses.text: And the expression, 'With these shall he push as with horns the nations from one end of the earth to another,' is indicative of what is now the fact among all the nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:8
verses.text: For some out of all the nations, through the power of this mystery, having been so pushed, that is, pricked in their hearts, have turned from vain idols and demons to serve God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:9
verses.text: But the same figure is revealed for the destruction and condemnation of the unbelievers; even as Amalek was defeated and Israel victorious when the people came out of Egypt, by means of the type of the stretching out of Moses' hands, and the name of Jesus (Joshua), by which the son of Nave (Nun) was called.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:10
verses.text: And it seems that the type and sign, which was erected to counteract the serpents which bit Israel, was intended for the salvation of those who believe that death was declared to come thereafter on the serpent through Him that would be crucified, but salvation to those who had been bitten by him and had betaken themselves to Him that sent His Son into the world to be crucified.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 91:11
verses.text: For the Spirit of prophecy by Moses did not teach us to believe in the serpent, since it shows us that he was cursed by God from the beginning; and in Isaiah tells us that he shall be put to death as an enemy by the mighty sword, which is Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 92:1
verses.text: Chapter 92 — Unless the scriptures be understood through God's great grace, God will not appear to have taught always the same righteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 92:2
verses.text: "Unless, therefore, a man by God's great grace receives the power to understand what has been said and done by the prophets, the appearance of being able to repeat the words or the deeds will not profit him, if he cannot explain the argument of them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 92:3
verses.text: And will they not assuredly appear contemptible to many, since they are related by those who understood them not? For if one should wish to ask you why, since Enoch, Noah with his sons, and all others in similar circumstances, who neither were circumcised nor kept the Sabbath, pleased God, God demanded by other leaders, and by the giving of the law after the lapse of so many generations, that those who lived between the times of Abraham and of Moses be justified by circumcision, and that those who lived after Moses be justified by circumcision and the other ordinances—to wit, the Sabbath, and sacrifices, and libations, and offerings; God will be slandered unless you show, as I have already said, that God who foreknew was aware that your nation would deserve expulsion from Jerusalem, and that none would be permitted to enter into it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 92:4
verses.text: (For you are not distinguished in any other way than by the fleshly circumcision, as I remarked previously.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 92:5
verses.text: For Abraham was declared by God to be righteous, not on account of circumcision, but on account of faith.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 92:6
verses.text: For before he was circumcised the following statement was made regarding him: 'Abraham believed God, and it was accounted unto him for righteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 92:7
verses.text: ' And we, therefore, in the uncircumcision of our flesh, believing God through Christ, and having that circumcision which is of advantage to us who have acquired it — namely, that of the heart—we hope to appear righteous before and well-pleasing to God: since already we have received His testimony through the words of the prophets;) And, further, God will be slandered unless you show that you were commanded to observe the Sabbath, and to present offerings, and that the Lord submitted to have a place called by the name of God, in order that, as has been said, you might not become impious and godless by worshipping idols and forgetting God, as indeed you do always appear to have been.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 92:8
verses.text: (Now, that God enjoined the ordinances of Sabbaths and offerings for these reasons, I have proved in what I previously remarked; but for the sake of those who came to-day, I wish to repeat nearly the whole;) For if this is not the case, God will be slandered, as having no foreknowledge, and as not teaching all men to know and to do the same acts of righteousness (for many generations of men appear to have existed before Moses); and the Scripture is not true which affirms that 'God is true and righteous, and all His ways are judgments, and there is no unrighteousness in him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 92:9
verses.text: ' But since the Scripture is true, God is always willing that such even as you be neither foolish nor lovers of yourselves, in order that you may obtain the salvation of Christ, who pleased God, and received testimony from Him, as I have already said, by alleging proof from the holy words of prophecy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:1
verses.text: Chapter 93 — The same kind of righteousness is bestowed on all.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:2
verses.text: Christ comprehends it in two precepts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:3
verses.text: "For God sets before every race of mankind that which is always and universally just, as well as all righteousness; and every race knows that adultery, and fornication, and homicide, and such like, are sinful; and though they all commit such practices, yet they do not escape from the knowledge that they act unrighteously whenever they so do, with the exception of those who are possessed with an unclean spirit, and who have been debased by education, by wicked customs, and by sinful institutions, and who have lost, or rather quenched and put under, their natural ideas.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:4
verses.text: For we may see that such persons are unwilling to submit to the same things which they inflict upon others, and reproach each other with hostile consciences for the acts which they perpetrate.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:5
verses.text: And hence I think that our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ spoke well when He summed up all righteousness and piety in two commandments.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:6
verses.text: They are these: 'Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy strength, and thy neighbour as thyself.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:7
verses.text: ' For the man who loves God with all the heart, and with all the strength, being filled with a God-fearing mind, will reverence no other god; and since God wishes it, he would reverence that angel who is beloved by the same Lord and God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:8
verses.text: And the man who loves his neighbour as himself will wish for him the same good things that he wishes for himself, and no man will wish evil things for himself.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:9
verses.text: Accordingly, he who loves his neighbour would pray and labour that his neighbour may be possessed of the same benefits as himself.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:10
verses.text: Now nothing else is neighbour to man than that similarly-affectioned and reasonable being—man.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:11
verses.text: Therefore, since all righteousness is divided into two branches, namely, in so far as it regards God and men, whoever, says the Scripture, loves the Lord God with all the heart, and all the strength, and his neighbour as himself, would be truly a righteous man.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:12
verses.text: But you were never shown to be possessed of friendship or love either towards God, or towards the prophets, or towards yourselves, but, as is evident, you are ever found to be idolaters and murderers of righteous men, so that you laid hands even on Christ Himself; and to this very day you abide in your wickedness, execrating those who prove that this man who was crucified by you is the Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:13
verses.text: Nay, more than this, you suppose that He was crucified as hostile to and cursed by God, which supposition is the product of your most irrational mind.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 93:14
verses.text: For though you have the means of understanding that this man is Christ from the signs given by Moses, yet you will not; but, in addition, fancying that we can have no arguments, you put whatever question comes into your minds, while you yourselves are at a loss for arguments whenever you meet with some firmly established Christian.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 94:1
verses.text: Chapter 94 — In what sense he who hangs on a tree is cursed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 94:2
verses.text: "For tell me, was it not God who commanded by Moses that no image or likeness of anything which was in heaven above or which was on the earth should be made, and yet who caused the brazen serpent to be made by Moses in the wilderness, and set it up for a sign by which those bitten by serpents were saved? Yet is He free from unrighteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 94:3
verses.text: For by this, as I previously remarked, He proclaimed the mystery, by which He declared that He would break the power of the serpent which occasioned the transgression of Adam, and would bring to them that believe on Him who was foreshadowed by this sign,  i-e:, Him who was to be crucified, salvation from the fangs of the serpent, which are wicked deeds, idolatries, and other unrighteous acts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 94:4
verses.text: Unless the matter be so understood, give me a reason why Moses set up the brazen serpent for a sign, and bade those that were bitten gaze at it, and the wounded were healed; and this, too, when he had himself commanded that no likeness of anything whatsoever should be made".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 94:5
verses.text: On this, another of those who came on the second day said, "You have spoken truly: we cannot give a reason.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 94:6
verses.text: For I have frequently interrogated the teachers about this matter, and none of them gave me a reason: therefore continue what you are speaking; for we are paying attention while you unfold the mystery, on account of which the doctrines of the prophets are falsely slandered".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 94:7
verses.text: Then I replied, "Just as God commanded the sign to be made by the brazen serpent, and yet He is blameless; even so, though a curse lies in the law against persons who are crucified, yet no curse lies on the Christ of God, by whom all that have committed things worthy of a curse are saved.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 95:1
verses.text: Chapter 95 — Christ took upon Himself the curse due to us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 95:2
verses.text: "For the whole human race will be found to be under a curse.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 95:3
verses.text: For it is written in the law of Moses, 'Cursed is every one that continueth not in all things that are written in the book of the law to do them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 95:4
verses.text: ' And no one has accurately done all, nor will you venture to deny this; but some more and some less than others have observed the ordinances enjoined.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 95:5
verses.text: But if those who are under this law appear to be under a curse for not having observed all the requirements, how much more shall all the nations appear to be under a curse who practise idolatry, who seduce youths, and commit other crimes? If, then, the Father of all wished His Christ for the whole human family to take upon Him the curses of all, knowing that, after He had been crucified and was dead, He would raise Him up, why do you argue about Him, who submitted to suffer these things according to the Father's will, as if He were accursed, and do not rather bewail yourselves? For although His Father caused Him to suffer these things in behalf of the human family, yet you did not commit the deed as in obedience to the will of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 95:6
verses.text: For you did not practise piety when you slew the prophets.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 95:7
verses.text: And let none of you say: If His Father wished Him to suffer this, in order that by His stripes the human race might be healed, we have done no wrong.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 95:8
verses.text: If, indeed, you repent of your sins, and recognise Him to be Christ, and observe His commandments, then you may assert this; for, as I have said before, remission of sins shall be yours.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 95:9
verses.text: But if you curse Him and them that believe on Him, and, when you have the power, put them to death, how is it possible that requisition shall not be made of you, as of unrighteous and sinful men, altogether hard-hearted and without understanding, because you laid your hands on Him?.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 96:1
verses.text: Chapter 96 — That curse was a prediction of the things which the Jews would do.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 96:2
verses.text: "For the statement in the law, 'Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree,' confirms our hope which depends on the crucified Christ, not because He who has been crucified is cursed by God, but because God foretold that which would be done by you all, and by those like to you, who do not know that this is He who existed before all, who is the eternal Priest of God, and King, and Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 96:3
verses.text: And you clearly see that this has come to pass.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 96:4
verses.text: For you curse in your synagogues all those who are called from Him Christians; and other nations effectively carry out the curse, putting to death those who simply confess themselves to be Christians; to all of whom we say, You are our brethren; rather recognise the truth of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 96:5
verses.text: And while neither they nor you are persuaded by us, but strive earnestly to cause us to deny the name of Christ, we choose rather and submit to death, in the full assurance that all the good which God has promised through Christ He will reward us with.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 96:6
verses.text: And in addition to all this we pray for you, that Christ may have mercy upon you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 96:7
verses.text: For He taught us to pray for our enemies also, saying, 'Love your enemies; be kind and merciful, as your heavenly Father is.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 96:8
verses.text: ' For we see that the Almighty God is kind and merciful, causing His sun to rise on the unthankful and on the righteous, and sending rain on the holy and on the wicked; all of whom He has taught us He will judge.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:1
verses.text: Chapter 97 — Other predictions of the cross of Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:2
verses.text: "For it was not without design that the prophet Moses, when Hur and Aaron upheld his hands, remained in this form until evening.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:3
verses.text: For indeed the Lord remained upon the tree almost until evening, and they buried Him at eventide; then on the third day He rose again.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:4
verses.text: This was declared by David thus: 'With my voice I cried to the Lord, and He heard me out of His holy hill.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:5
verses.text: I laid me down, and slept; I awaked, for the Lord sustained me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:6
verses.text: ' And Isaiah likewise mentions concerning Him the manner in which He would die, thus: 'I have spread out My hands unto a people disobedient, and gainsaying, that walk in a way which is not good.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:7
verses.text: ' And that He would rise again, Isaiah himself said: 'His burial has been taken away from the midst, and I will give the rich for His death.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:8
verses.text: ' And again, in other words, David in the twenty-first Psalm thus refers to the suffering and to the cross in a parable of mystery: 'They pierced my hands and my feet; they counted all my bones.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:9
verses.text: They considered and gazed on me; they parted my garments among themselves, and cast lots upon my vesture.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:10
verses.text: ' For when they crucified Him, driving in the nails, they pierced His hands and feet; and those who crucified Him parted His garments among themselves, each casting lots for what he chose to have, and receiving according to the decision of the lot.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 97:11
verses.text: And this very Psalm you maintain does not refer to Christ; for you are in all respects blind, and do not understand that no one in your nation who has been called King or Christ has ever had his hands or feet pierced while alive, or has died in this mysterious fashion—to wit, by the cross—save this Jesus alone.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:1
verses.text: Chapter 98 — Predictions of Christ in Ps.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:2
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:3
verses.text: "I shall repeat the whole Psalm, in order that you may hear His reverence to the Father, and how He refers all things to Him, and prays to be delivered by Him from this death; at the same time declaring in the Psalm who they are that rise up against Him, and showing that He has truly become man capable of suffering.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:4
verses.text: It is as follows: 'O God, my God, attend to me: why hast Thou forsaken me? The words of my transgressions are far from my salvation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:5
verses.text: O my God, I will cry to Thee in the day-time, and Thou wilt not hear; and in the night-season, and it is not for want of understanding in me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:6
verses.text: But Thou, the Praise of Israel, inhabitest the holy place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:7
verses.text: Our fathers trusted in Thee; they trusted, and Thou didst deliver them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:8
verses.text: They cried unto Thee, and were delivered: they trusted in Thee, and were not confounded.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:9
verses.text: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:10
verses.text: All they that see me laughed me to scorn; they spake with the lips, they shook the head: He trusted on the Lord: let Him deliver him, let Him save him, since he desires Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:11
verses.text: For Thou art He that took me out of the womb; my hope from the breasts of my mother: I was cast upon Thee from the womb.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:12
verses.text: Thou art my God from my mother's belly: be not far from me, for trouble is near; for there is none to help.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:13
verses.text: Many calves have compassed me; fat bulls have beset me round.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:14
verses.text: They opened their mouth upon me, as a ravening and roaring lion.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:15
verses.text: All my bones are poured out and dispersed like water.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:16
verses.text: My heart has become like wax melting in the midst of my belly.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:17
verses.text: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue has cleaved to my throat; and Thou hast brought me into the dust of death.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:18
verses.text: For many dogs have surrounded me; the assembly of the wicked have beset me round.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:19
verses.text: They pierced my hands and my feet, they did tell all my bones.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:20
verses.text: They did look and stare upon me; they parted my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:21
verses.text: But do not Thou remove Thine assistance from me, O Lord: give heed to help me; deliver my soul from the sword, and my only-begotten from the hand of the dog.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:22
verses.text: Save me from the lion's mouth, and my humility from the horns of the unicorns.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:23
verses.text: I will declare Thy name to my brethren; in the midst of the Church will I praise Thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:24
verses.text: Ye that fear the Lord, praise Him: all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 98:25
verses.text: Let all the seed of Israel fear Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 99:1
verses.text: Chapter 99 — In the commencement of the Psalm are Christ's dying words.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 99:2
verses.text: And when I had said these words, I continued: "Now I will demonstrate to you that the whole Psalm refers thus to Christ, by the words which I shall again explain.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 99:3
verses.text: What is said at first—'O God, my God, attend to me: why hast Thou forsaken me?'—announced from the beginning that which was to be said in the time of Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 99:4
verses.text: For when crucified, He spake: 'O God, my God, why hast Thou forsaken me?' And what follows: 'The words of my transgressions are far from my salvation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 99:5
verses.text: O my God, I will cry to Thee in the day-time, and Thou wilt not hear; and in the night-season, and it is not for want of understanding in me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 99:6
verses.text: ' These, as well as the things which He was to do, were spoken.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 99:7
verses.text: For on the day on which He was to be crucified, having taken three of His disciples to the hill called Olivet, situated opposite to the temple in Jerusalem, He prayed in these words: 'Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 99:8
verses.text: ' And again He prayed: 'Not as I will, but as Thou wilt;' showing by this that He had become truly a suffering man.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 99:9
verses.text: But lest any one should say, He did not know then that He had to suffer, He adds immediately in the Psalm: 'And it is not for want of understanding in me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 99:10
verses.text: ' Even as there was no ignorance on God's part when He asked Adam where he was, or asked Cain where Abel was; but it was done to convince each what kind of man he was, and in order that through the record of Scripture we might have a knowledge of all: so likewise Christ declared that ignorance was not on His side, but on theirs, who thought that He was not the Christ, but fancied they would put Him to death, and that He, like some common mortal, would remain in Hades.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:1
verses.text: Chapter 100 — In what sense Christ is called Jacob, and Israel, and Son of Man.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:2
verses.text: "Then what follows — 'But Thou, the praise of Israel, inhabitest the holy place'—declared that He is to do something worthy of praise and wonderment, being about to rise again from the dead on the third day after the crucifixion; and this He has obtained from the Father.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:3
verses.text: For I have showed already that Christ is called both Jacob and Israel; and I have proved that it is not in the blessing of Joseph and Judah alone that what relates to Him was proclaimed mysteriously, but also in the Gospel it is written that He said: 'All things are delivered unto me by My Father;' and, 'No man knoweth the Father but the Son; nor the Son but the Father, and they to whom the Son will reveal Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:4
verses.text: ' Accordingly He revealed to us all that we have perceived by His grace out of the Scriptures, so that we know Him to be the first-begotten of God, and to be before all creatures; likewise to be the Son of the patriarchs, since He assumed flesh by the Virgin of their family, and submitted to become a man without comeliness, dishonoured, and subject to suffering.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:5
verses.text: Hence, also, among His words He said, when He was discoursing about His future sufferings: 'The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the Pharisees and Scribes, and be crucified, and on the third day rise again.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:6
verses.text: ' He said then that He was the Son of man, either because of His birth by the Virgin, who was, as I said, of the family of David and Jacob, and Isaac, and Abraham; or because Adam was the father both of Himself and of those who have been first enumerated from whom Mary derives her descent.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:7
verses.text: For we know that the fathers of women are the fathers likewise of those children whom their daughters bear.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:8
verses.text: For Christ called one of His disciples— previously known by the name of Simon—Peter; since he recognised Him to be Christ the Son of God, by the revelation of His Father: and since we find it recorded in the memoirs of His apostles that He is the Son of God, and since we call Him the Son, we have understood that He proceeded before all creatures from the Father by His power and will (for He is addressed in the writings of the prophets in one way or another as Wisdom, and the Day, and the East, and a Sword, and a Stone, and a Rod, and Jacob, and Israel); and that He became man by the Virgin, in order that the disobedience which proceeded from the serpent might receive its destruction in the same manner in which it derived its origin.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:9
verses.text: For Eve, who was a virgin and undefiled, having conceived the word of the serpent, brought forth disobedience and death.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:10
verses.text: But the Virgin Mary received faith and joy, when the angel Gabriel announced the good tidings to her that the Spirit of the Lord would come upon her, and the power of the Highest would overshadow her: wherefore also the Holy Thing begotten of her is the Son of God; and she replied, 'Be it unto me according to thy word.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 100:11
verses.text: '" And by her has He been born, to whom we have proved so many Scriptures refer, and by whom God destroys both the serpent and those angels and men who are like him; but works deliverance from death to those who repent of their wickedness and believe upon Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 101:1
verses.text: Chapter 101 — Christ refers all things to the Father  "Then what follows of the Psalm is this, in which He says: 'Our fathers trusted in Thee; they trusted, and Thou didst deliver them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 101:2
verses.text: They cried unto Thee, and were not confounded.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 101:3
verses.text: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people;' which show that He admits them to be His fathers, who trusted in God and were saved by Him, who also were the fathers of the Virgin, by whom He was born and became man; and He foretells that He shall be saved by the same God, but boasts not in accomplishing anything through His own will or might.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 101:4
verses.text: For when on earth He acted in the very same manner, and answered to one who addressed Him as 'Good Master:' 'Why callest thou me good? One is good, my Father who is in heaven.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 101:5
verses.text: ' But when He says, 'I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people,' He prophesied the things which do exist, and which happen to Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 101:6
verses.text: For we who believe on Him are everywhere a reproach, 'despised of the people;' for, rejected and dishonoured by your nation, He suffered those indignities which you planned against Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 101:7
verses.text: And the following: 'All they that see me laughed me to scorn; they spake with the lips, they shook the head: He trusted in the Lord; let Him deliver him, since he desires Him;' this likewise He foretold should happen to Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 101:8
verses.text: For they that saw Him crucified shook their heads each one of them, and distorted their lips, and twisting their noses to each other, they spake in mockery the words which are recorded in the memoirs of His apostles: 'He said he was the Son of God: let him come down; let God save him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:1
verses.text: Chapter 102 — The prediction of the events which happened to Christ when He was born.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:2
verses.text: Why God permitted it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:3
verses.text: "And what follows — 'My hope from the breasts of my mother.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:4
verses.text: On Thee have I been cast from the womb; from my mother's belly Thou art my God: for there is no helper.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:5
verses.text: Many calves have compassed me; fat bulls have beset me round.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:6
verses.text: They opened their mouth upon me, as a ravening and a roaring lion.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:7
verses.text: All my bones are poured out and dispersed like water.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:8
verses.text: My heart has become likes wax melting in the midst of my belly.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:9
verses.text: My strength is become dry like a potsherd; and my tongue has cleaved to my throat' — foretold what would come to pass; for the statement, 'My hope from the breasts of my mother,' is thus explained.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:10
verses.text: As soon as He was born in Bethlehem, as I previously remarked, king Herod, having learned from the Arabian Magi about Him, made a plot to put Him to death and by God's command Joseph took Him with Mary and departed into Egypt.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:11
verses.text: For the Father had decreed that He whom He had begotten should be put to death, but not before He had grown to manhood, and proclaimed the word which proceeded from Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:12
verses.text: But if any of you say to us, Could not God rather have put Herod to death? I return answer by anticipation: Could not God have cut off in the beginning the serpent, so that he exist not, rather than have said, 'And I will put enmity between him and the woman, and between his seed and her seed?' Could He not have at once created a multitude of men? But yet, since He knew that it would be good, He created both angels and men free to do that which is righteous, and He appointed periods of time during which He knew it would be good for them to have the exercise of free-will; and because He likewise knew it would be good, He made general and particular judgments; each one's freedom of will, however, being guarded.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:13
verses.text: Hence Scripture says the following, at the destruction of the tower, and division and alteration of tongues: 'And the Lord said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they have begun to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them of all which they have attempted to do.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:14
verses.text: ' And the statement, 'My strength is become dry like a potsherd, and my tongue has cleaved to my throat,' was also a prophecy of what would be done by Him according to the Father's will.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:15
verses.text: For the power of His strong word, by which He always confuted the Pharisees and Scribes, and, in short, all your nation's teachers that questioned Him, had a cessation like a plentiful and strong spring, the waters of which have been turned off, when He kept silence, and chose to return no answer to any one in the presence of Pilate; as has been declared in the memoirs of His apostles, in order that what is recorded by Isaiah might have efficacious fruit, where it is written, 'The Lord gives me a tongue, that I may know when I ought to speak.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:16
verses.text: ' Again, when He said, 'Thou art my God; be not far from me,' He taught that all men ought to hope in God who created all things, and seek salvation and help from Him alone; and not suppose, as the rest of men do, that salvation can be obtained by birth, or wealth, or strength, or wisdom.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:17
verses.text: And such have ever been your practices: at one time you made a calf, and always you have shown yourselves ungrateful, murderers of the righteous, and proud of your descent.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 102:18
verses.text: For if the Son of God evidently states that He can be saved, neither because He is a son, nor because He is strong or wise, but that without God He cannot be saved, even though He be sinless, as Isaiah declares in words to the effect that even in regard to His very language He committed no sin (for He committed no iniquity or guile with His mouth), how do you or others who expect to be saved without this hope, suppose that you are not deceiving yourselves?.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:1
verses.text: Chapter 103 — The Pharisees are the bulls: the roaring lion is Herod or the devil.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:2
verses.text: "Then what is next said in the Psalm—'For trouble is near, for there is none to help me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:3
verses.text: Many calves have compassed me; fat bulls have beset me round.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:4
verses.text: They opened their mouth upon me as a ravening and roaring lion.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:5
verses.text: All my bones are poured out and dispersed like water,'—was likewise a prediction of the events which happened to Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:6
verses.text: For on that night when some of your nation, who had been sent by the Pharisees and Scribes, and teachers, came upon Him from the Mount of Olives, those whom Scripture called butting and prematurely destructive calves surrounded Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:7
verses.text: And the expression, 'Fat bulls have beset me round,' He spoke beforehand of those who acted similarly to the calves, when He was led before your teachers.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:8
verses.text: And the Scripture described them as bulls, since we know that bulls are authors of calves' existence.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:9
verses.text: As therefore the bulls are the begetters of the calves, so your teachers were the cause why their children went out to the Mount of Olives to take Him and bring Him to them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:10
verses.text: And the expression, 'For there is none to help,' is also indicative of what took place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:11
verses.text: For there was not even a single man to assist Him as an innocent person.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:12
verses.text: And the expression, 'They opened their mouth upon me like a roaring lion,' designates him who was then king of the Jews, and was called Herod, a successor of the Herod who, when Christ was born, slew all the infants in Bethlehem born about the same time, because he imagined that amongst them He would assuredly be of whom the Magi from Arabia had spoken; for he was ignorant of the will of Him that is stronger than all, how He had commanded Joseph and Mary to take the Child and depart into Egypt, and there to remain until a revelation should again be made to them to return into their own country.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:13
verses.text: And there they did remain until Herod, who slew the infants in Bethlehem, was dead, and Archelaus had succeeded him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:14
verses.text: And he died before Christ came to the dispensation on the cross which was given Him by His Father.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:15
verses.text: And when Herod succeeded Archelaus, having received the authority which had been allotted to him, Pilate sent to him by way of compliment Jesus bound; and God foreknowing that this would happen, had thus spoken: 'And they brought Him to the Assyrian, a present to the king.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:16
verses.text: ' Or He meant the devil by the lion roaring against Him: whom Moses calls the serpent, but in Job and Zechariah he is called the devil, and by Jesus is addressed as Satan, showing that a compounded name was acquired by him from the deeds which he performed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:17
verses.text: For 'Sata' in the Jewish and Syrian tongue means apostate; and 'Nas' is the word from which he is called by interpretation the serpent,  i-e:, according to the interpretation of the Hebrew term, from both of which there arises the single word Satanas.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:18
verses.text: For this devil, when Jesus went up from the river Jordan, at the time when the voice spake to Him, 'Thou art my Son: this day have I begotten Thee,' is recorded in the memoirs of the apostles to have come to Him and tempted Him, even so far as to say to Him, 'Worship me;' and Christ answered him, 'Get thee behind me, Satan: thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shalt thou serve.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:19
verses.text: ' For as he had deceived Adam, so he hoped that he might contrive some mischief against Christ also.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:20
verses.text: Moreover, the statement, 'All my bones are poured out and dispersed like water; my heart has become like wax, melting in the midst of my belly,' was a prediction of that which happened to Him on that night when men came out against Him to the Mount of Olives to seize Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:21
verses.text: For in the memoirs which I say were drawn up by His apostles and those who followed them, it is recorded that His sweat fell down like drops of blood while He was praying, and saying, 'If it be possible, let this cup pass:' His heart and also His bones trembling; His heart being like wax melting in His belly: in order that we may perceive that the Father wished His Son really to undergo such sufferings for our sakes, and may not say that He, being the Son of God, did not feel what was happening to Him and inflicted on Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 103:22
verses.text: Further, the expression, 'My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue has cleaved to my throat,' was a prediction, as I previously remarked, of that silence, when He who convicted all your teachers of being unwise returned no answer at all.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 104:1
verses.text: Chapter 104 — Circumstances of Christ's death are predicted in this Psalm.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 104:2
verses.text: "And the statement, 'Thou hast brought me into the dust of death; for many dogs have surrounded me: the assembly of the wicked have beset me round.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 104:3
verses.text: They pierced my hands and my feet.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 104:4
verses.text: They did tell all my bones.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 104:5
verses.text: They did look and stare upon me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 104:6
verses.text: They parted my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture,'—was a prediction, as I said before, of the death to which the synagogue of the wicked would condemn Him, whom He calls both dogs and hunters, declaring that those who hunted Him were both gathered together and assiduously striving to condemn Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 104:7
verses.text: And this is recorded to have happened in the memoirs of His apostles.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 104:8
verses.text: And I have shown that, after His crucifixion, they who crucified Him parted His garments among them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:1
verses.text: Chapter 105 — The Psalm also predicts the crucifixion and the subject of the last prayers of Christ on Earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:2
verses.text: "And what follows of the Psalm,—'But Thou, Lord, do not remove Thine assistance from me; give heed to help me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:3
verses.text: Deliver my soul from the sword, and my only-begotten from the hand of the dog; save me from the lion's mouth, and my humility from the horns of the unicorns,'—was also information and prediction of the events which should befall Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:4
verses.text: For I have already proved that He was the only-begotten of the Father of all things, being begotten in a peculiar manner Word and Power by Him, and having afterwards become man through the Virgin, as we have learned from the memoirs.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:5
verses.text: Moreover, it is similarly foretold that He would die by crucifixion.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:6
verses.text: For the passage, 'Deliver my soul from the sword, and my only-begotten from the hand of the dog; save me from the lion's mouth, and my humility from the horns of the unicorns,' is indicative of the suffering by which He should die,  i-e:, by crucifixion.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:7
verses.text: For the 'horns of the, unicorns,' I have already explained to you, are the figure of the cross only.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:8
verses.text: And the prayer that His soul should be saved from the sword, and lion's mouth, and hand of the dog, was a prayer that no one should take possession of His soul: so that, when we arrive at the end of life, we may ask the same petition from God, who is able to turn away every shameless evil angel from taking our souls.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:9
verses.text: And that the souls survive, I have shown to you from the fact that the soul of Samuel was called up by the witch, as Saul demanded.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:10
verses.text: And it appears also, that all the souls of similar righteous men and prophets fell under the dominion of such powers, as is indeed to be inferred from the very facts in the case of that witch.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:11
verses.text: Hence also God by His Son teaches us for whose sake these things seem to have been done, always to strive earnestly, and at death to pray that our souls may not fall into the hands of any such power.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:12
verses.text: For when Christ was giving up His spirit on the cross, He said, 'Father, into Thy hands I commend my spirit,' as I have learned also from the memoirs.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 105:13
verses.text: For He exhorted His disciples to surpass the pharisaic way of living, with the warning, that if they did not, they might be sure they could not be saved; and these words are recorded in the memoirs: 'Unless your righteousness exceed that of the Scribes and Pharisees, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 106:1
verses.text: Chapter 106 — Christ's resurrection is foretold in the conclusion of the Psalm.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 106:2
verses.text: "The remainder of the Psalm makes it manifest that He knew His Father would grant to Him all things which He asked, and would raise Him from the dead; and that He urged all who fear God to praise Him because He had compassion on all races of believing men, through the mystery of Him who was crucified; and that He stood in the midst of His brethren the apostles (who repented of their flight from Him when He was crucified, after He rose from the dead, and after they were persuaded by Himself that, before His passion He had mentioned to them that He must suffer these things, and that they were announced beforehand by the prophets), and when living with them sang praises to God, as is made evident in the memoirs of the apostles.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 106:3
verses.text: The words are the following: 'I will declare Thy name to my brethren; in the midst of the Church will I praise Thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 106:4
verses.text: Ye that fear the Lord, praise Him; all ye, the seed of Jacob, glorify Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 106:5
verses.text: Let all the seed of Israel fear Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 106:6
verses.text: ' And when it is said that He changed the name of one of the apostles to Peter; and when it is written in the memoirs of Him that this so happened, as well as that He changed the names of other two brothers, the sons of Zebedee, to Boanerges, which means sons of thunder; this was an announcement of the fact that it was He by whom Jacob was called Israel, and Oshea called Jesus (Joshua), under whose name the people who survived of those that came from Egypt were conducted into the land promised to the patriarchs.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 106:7
verses.text: And that He should arise like a star from the seed of Abraham, Moses showed before hand when he thus said, 'A star shall arise from Jacob, and a leader from Israel;' and another Scripture says, 'Behold a man; the East is His name.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 106:8
verses.text: ' Accordingly, when a star rose in heaven at the time of His birth, as is recorded in the memoirs of His apostles, the Magi from Arabia, recognising the sign by this, came and worshipped Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 107:1
verses.text: Chapter 107 — The same is taught from the history of Jonah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 107:2
verses.text: "And that He would rise again on the third day after the crucifixion, it is written in the memoirs that some of your nation, questioning Him, said, 'Show us a sign;' and He replied to them, 'An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and no sign shall be given them, save the sign of Jonah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 107:3
verses.text: ' And since He spoke this obscurely, it was to be understood by the audience that after His crucifixion He should rise again on the third day.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 107:4
verses.text: And He showed that your generation was more wicked and more adulterous than the city of Nineveh; for the latter, when Jonah preached to them, after he had been cast up on the third day from the belly of the great fish, that after three (in other versions, forty) days they should all perish, proclaimed a fast of all creatures, men and beasts, with sackcloth, and with earnest lamentation, with true repentance from the heart, and turning away from unrighteousness, in the belief that God is merciful and kind to all who turn from wickedness; so that the king of that city himself, with his nobles also, put on sackcloth and remained fasting and praying, and obtained their request that the city should not be overthrown.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 107:5
verses.text: But when Jonah was grieved that on the (fortieth) third day, as he proclaimed, the city was not overthrown, by the dispensation of a gourd springing up from the earth for him, under which he sat and was shaded from the heat (now the gourd had sprung up suddenly, and Jonah had neither planted nor watered it, but it had come up all at once to afford him shade), and by the other dispensation of its withering away, for which Jonah grieved, God convicted him of being unjustly displeased because the city of Nineveh had not been overthrown, and said, 'Thou hast had pity on the gourd, for the which thou hast not laboured, neither madest it grow; which came up in a night, and perished in a night.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 107:6
verses.text: And shall I not spare Nineveh, the great city, wherein dwell more than six score thousand persons that cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand; and also much cattle?'.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 108:1
verses.text: Chapter 108 — The resurrection of Christ did not convert the Jews.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 108:2
verses.text: But through the whole world they have sent men to accuse Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 108:3
verses.text: "And though all the men of your nation knew the incidents in the life of Jonah, and though Christ said amongst you that He would give the sign of Jonah, exhorting you to repent of your wicked deeds at least after He rose again from the dead, and to mourn before God as did the Ninevites, in order that your nation and city might not be taken and destroyed, as they have been destroyed; yet you not only have not repented, after you learned that He rose from the dead, but, as I said before you have sent chosen and ordained men throughout all the world to proclaim that a godless and lawless heresy had sprung from one Jesus, a Galilaean deceiver, whom we crucified, but his disciples stole him by night from the tomb, where he was laid when unfastened from the cross, and now deceive men by asserting that he has risen from the dead and ascended to heaven.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 108:4
verses.text: Moreover, you accuse Him of having taught those godless, lawless, and unholy doctrines which you mention to the condemnation of those who confess Him to be Christ, and a Teacher from and Son of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 108:5
verses.text: Besides this, even when your city is captured, and your land ravaged, you do not repent, but dare to utter imprecations on Him and all who believe in Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 108:6
verses.text: Yet we do not hate you or those who, by your means, have conceived such prejudices against us; but we pray that even now all of you may repent and obtain mercy from God, the compassionate and long-suffering Father of all.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 109:1
verses.text: Chapter 109 — The conversion of the Gentiles has been predicted by Micah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 109:2
verses.text: "But that the Gentiles would repent of the evil in which they led erring lives, when they heard the doctrine preached by His apostles from Jerusalem, and which they learned through them, suffer me to show you by quoting a short statement from the prophecy of Micah, one of the twelve minor prophets.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 109:3
verses.text: This is as follows: 'And in the last days the mountain of the Lord shall be manifest, established on the top of the mountains; it shall be exalted above the hills, and people shall flow unto it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 109:4
verses.text: And many nations shall go, and say, Come, let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, and to the house of the God of Jacob; and they shall enlighten us in His way, and we shall walk in His paths: for out of Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 109:5
verses.text: And He shall judge among many peoples, and shall rebuke strong nations afar off; and they shall beat their swords into ploughshares, and their spears into sickles: nation shall not lift up a sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 109:6
verses.text: And each man shall sit under his vine and under his fig tree; and there shall be none to terrify: for the mouth of the Lord of hosts hath spoken it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 109:7
verses.text: For all people will walk in the name of their gods; but we will walk in the name of the Lord our God for ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 109:8
verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will assemble her that is afflicted, and gather her that is driven out, and whom I had plagued; and I shall make her that is afflicted a remnant, and her that is oppressed a strong nation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 109:9
verses.text: And the Lord shall reign over them in Mount Zion from henceforth, and even for ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:1
verses.text: Chapter 110 — A portion of the prophecy already fulfilled in the Christians: the rest shall be fulfilled at the second advent.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:2
verses.text: And when I had finished these words, I continued: "Now I am aware that your teachers, sirs, admit the whole of the words of this passage to refer to Christ; and I am likewise aware that they maintain He has not yet come; or if they say that He has come, they assert that it is not known who He is; but when He shall become manifest and glorious, then it shall be known who He is.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:3
verses.text: And then, they say, the events mentioned in this passage shall happen, just as if there was no fruit as yet from the words of the prophecy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:4
verses.text: O unreasoning men! understanding not what has been proved by all these passages, that two advents of Christ have been announced: the one, in which He is set forth as suffering, inglorious, dishonoured, and crucified; but the other, in which He shall come from heaven with glory, when the man of apostasy, who speaks strange things against the Most High, shall venture to do unlawful deeds on the earth against us the Christians, who, having learned the true worship of God from the law, and the word which went forth from Jerusalem by means of the apostles of Jesus, have fled for safety to the God of Jacob and God of Israel; and we who were filled with war, and mutual slaughter, and every wickedness, have each through the whole earth changed our warlike weapons,— our swords into ploughshares, and our spears into implements of tillage, — and we cultivate piety, righteousness, philanthropy, faith, and hope, which we have from the Father Himself through Him who was crucified; and sitting each under his vine,  i-e:, each man possessing his own married wife.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:5
verses.text: For you are aware that the prophetic word says, 'And his wife shall be like a fruitful vine.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:6
verses.text: ' Now it is evident that no one can terrify or subdue us who have believed in Jesus over all the world.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:7
verses.text: For it is plain that, though beheaded, and crucified, and thrown to wild beasts, and chains, and fire, and all other kinds of torture, we do not give up our confession; but the more such things happen, the more do others and in larger numbers become faithful, and worshippers of God through the name of Jesus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:8
verses.text: For just as if one should cut away the fruit-bearing parts of a vine, it grows up again, and yields other branches flourishing and fruitful; even so the same thing happens with us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:9
verses.text: For the vine planted by God and Christ the Saviour is His people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:10
verses.text: But the rest of the prophecy shall be fulfilled at His second coming.
