verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:11
verses.text: For the expression, 'He that is afflicted and driven out,'  i-e:, from the world, implies that, so far as you and all other men have it in your power, each Christian has been driven out not only from his own property, but even from the whole world; for you permit no Christian to live.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:12
verses.text: But you say that the same fate has befallen your own nation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:13
verses.text: Now, if you have been cast out after defeat in battle, you have suffered such treatment justly indeed, as all the Scriptures bear witness; but we, though we have done no such evil acts after we knew the truth of God, are testified to by God, that, together with the most righteous, and only spotless and sinless Christ, we are taken away out of the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 110:14
verses.text: For Isaiah cries, 'Behold how the righteous perishes, and no man lays it to heart; and righteous men are taken away, and no man considers it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:1
verses.text: Chapter 111 — The two advents were signified by the two goats.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:2
verses.text: Other figures of the first advent, in which the Gentiles are freed by the blood of Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:3
verses.text: "And that it was declared by symbol, even in the time of Moses, that there would be two advents of this Christ, as I have mentioned previously, is manifest from the symbol of the goats presented for sacrifice during the fast.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:4
verses.text: And again, by what Moses and Joshua did, the same thing was symbolically announced and told beforehand.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:5
verses.text: For the one of them, stretching out his hands, remained till evening on the hill, his hands being supported; and this reveals a type of no other thing than of the cross: and the other, whose name was altered to Jesus (Joshua), led the fight, and Israel conquered.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:6
verses.text: Now this took place in the case of both those holy men and prophets of God, that you may perceive how one of them could not bear up both the mysteries: I mean, the type of the cross and the type of the name.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:7
verses.text: For this is, was, and shall be the strength of Him alone, whose name every power dreads, being very much tormented because they shall be destroyed by Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:8
verses.text: Therefore our suffering and crucified Christ was not cursed by the law, but made it manifest that He alone would save those who do not depart from His faith.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:9
verses.text: And the blood of the passover, sprinkled on each man's door-posts and lintel, delivered those who were saved in Egypt, when the first-born of the Egyptians were destroyed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:10
verses.text: For the passover was Christ, who was afterwards sacrificed, as also Isaiah said, 'He was led as a sheep to the slaughter.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:11
verses.text: ' And it is written, that on the day of the passover you seized Him, and that also during the passover you crucified Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:12
verses.text: And as the blood of the passover saved those who were in Egypt, so also the blood of Christ will deliver from death those who have believed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:13
verses.text: Would God, then, have been deceived if this sign had not been above the doors? I do not say that; but I affirm that He announced beforehand the future salvation for the human race through the blood of Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 111:14
verses.text: For the sign of the scarlet thread, which the spies, sent to Jericho by Joshua, son of Nave (Nun), gave to Rahab the harlot, telling her to bind it to the window through which she let them down to escape from their enemies, also manifested the symbol of the blood of Christ, by which those who were at one time harlots and unrighteous persons out of all nations are saved, receiving remission of sins, and continuing no longer in sin.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 112:1
verses.text: Chapter 112 — The Jews expound these signs jejunely and feebly, and take up their attention only with insignificant matters.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 112:2
verses.text: "But you, expounding these things in a low and earthly manner, impute much weakness to God, if you thus listen to them merely, and do not investigate the force of the words spoken.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 112:3
verses.text: Since even Moses would in this way be considered a transgressor: for he enjoined that no likeness of anything in heaven, or on earth, or in the sea, be made; and then he himself made a brazen serpent and set it on a standard, and bade those who were bitten look at it: and they were saved when they looked at it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 112:4
verses.text: Will the serpent, then, which (I have already said) God had in the beginning cursed and cut off by the great sword, as Isaiah says, be understood as having preserved at that time the people? and shall we receive these things in the foolish acceptation of your teachers, and regard them not as signs? And shall we not rather refer the standard to the resemblance of the crucified Jesus, since also Moses by his outstretched hands, together with him who was named Jesus (Joshua), achieved a victory for your people? For in this way we shall cease to be at a loss about the things which the lawgiver did, when he, without forsaking God, persuaded the people to hope in a beast through which transgression and disobedience had their origin.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 112:5
verses.text: And this was done and said by the blessed prophet with much intelligence and mystery; and there is nothing said or done by any one of the prophets, without exception, which one can justly reprehend, if he possess the knowledge which is in them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 112:6
verses.text: But if your teachers only expound to you why female camels are spoken of in this passage, and are not in that; or why so many measures of fine flour and so many measures of oil are used in the offerings; and do so in a low and sordid manner, while they never venture either to speak of or to expound the points which are great and worthy of investigation, or command you to give no audience to us while we expound them, and to come not into conversation with us; will they not deserve to hear what our Lord Jesus Christ said to them: 'Whited sepulchres, which appear beautiful outward, and within are full of dead men's bones; which pay tithe of mint, and swallow a camel: ye blind guides!' If, then, you will not despise the doctrines of those who exalt themselves and wish to be called Rabbi, Rabbi, and come with such earnestness and intelligence to the words of prophecy as to suffer the same inflictions from your own people which the prophets themselves did, you cannot receive any advantage whatsoever from the prophetic writings.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:1
verses.text: Chapter 113 — Joshua was a figure of Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:2
verses.text: "What I mean is this.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:3
verses.text: Jesus (Joshua), as I have now frequently remarked, who was called Oshea, when he was sent to spy out the land of Canaan, was named by Moses Jesus (Joshua).

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:4
verses.text: Why he did this you neither ask, nor are at a loss about it, nor make strict inquiries.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:5
verses.text: Therefore Christ has escaped your notice; and though you read, you understand not; and even now, though you hear that Jesus is our Christ, you consider not that the name was bestowed on Him not purposelessly nor by chance.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:6
verses.text: But you make a theological discussion as to why one 'α' was added to Abraham's first name; and as to why one 'ρ' was added to Sarah's name, you use similar high-sounding disputations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:7
verses.text: But why do you not similarly investigate the reason why the name of Oshea the son of Nave (Nun), which his father gave him, was changed to Jesus (Joshua)? But since not only was his name altered, but he was also appointed successor to Moses, being the only one of his contemporaries who came out from Egypt, he led the surviving people into the Holy Land; and as he, not Moses, led the people into the Holy Land, and as he distributed it by lot to those who entered along with him, so also Jesus the Christ will turn again the dispersion of the people, and will distribute the good land to each one, though not in the same manner.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:8
verses.text: For the former gave them a temporary inheritance, seeing he was neither Christ who is God, nor the Son of God; but the latter, after the holy resurrection, shall give us the eternal possession.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:9
verses.text: The former, after he had been named Jesus (Joshua), and after he had received strength from His Spirit, caused the sun to stand still.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:10
verses.text: For I have proved that it was Jesus who appeared to and conversed with Moses, and Abraham, and all the other patriarchs without exception, ministering to the will of the Father; who also, I say, came to be born man by the Virgin Mary, and I lives for ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:11
verses.text: For the latter is He after whom and by whom the Father will renew both the heaven and the earth; this is He who shall shine an eternal light in Jerusalem; this is he who is the king of Salem after the order of Melchizedek, and the eternal Priest of the Most High.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:12
verses.text: The former is said to have circumcised the people a second time with knives of stone (which was a sign of this circumcision with which Jesus Christ Himself has circumcised us from the idols made of stone and of other materials), and to have collected together those who were circumcised from the uncircumcision,  i-e:, from the error of the world, in every place by the knives of stone, to wit, the words of our Lord Jesus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:13
verses.text: For I have shown that Christ was proclaimed by the prophets in parables a Stone and a Rock.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 113:14
verses.text: Accordingly the knives of stone we shall take to mean His words, by means of which so many who were in error have been circumcised from uncircumcision with the circumcision of the heart, with which God by Jesus commanded those from that time to be circumcised who derived their circumcision from Abraham, saying that Jesus (Joshua) would circumcise a second time with knives of stone those who entered into that holy land.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:1
verses.text: Chapter 114 — Some rules for discerning what is said about Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:2
verses.text: The circumcision of the Jews is very different from that which Christians receive.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:3
verses.text: "For the Holy Spirit sometimes brought about that something, which was the type of the future, should be done clearly; sometimes He uttered words about what was to take place, as if it was then taking place, or had taken place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:4
verses.text: And unless those who read perceive this art, they will not be able to follow the words of the prophets as they ought.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:5
verses.text: For example's sake, I shall repeat some prophetic passages, that you may understand what I say.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:6
verses.text: When He speaks by Isaiah, 'He was led as a sheep to the slaughter, and like a lamb before the shearer,' He speaks as if the suffering had already taken place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:7
verses.text: And when He says again, 'I have stretched out my hands to a disobedient and gainsaying people;' and when He says, 'Lord, who hath believed our report?'—the words are spoken as if announcing events which had already come to pass.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:8
verses.text: For I have shown that Christ is oftentimes called a Stone in parable, and in figurative speech Jacob and Israel.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:9
verses.text: And again, when He says, 'I shall behold the heavens, the works of Thy fingers,' unless I understand His method of using words, I shall not understand intelligently, but just as your teachers suppose, fancying that the Father of all, the unbegotten God, has hands and feet, and fingers, and a soul, like a composite being; and they for this reason teach that it was the Father Himself who appeared to Abraham and to Jacob.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:10
verses.text: Blessed therefore are we who have been circumcised the second time with knives of stone.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:11
verses.text: For your first circumcision was and is performed by iron instruments, for you remain hard-hearted; but our circumcision, which is the second, having been instituted after yours, circumcises us from idolatry and from absolutely every kind of wickedness by sharp stones,  i-e:, by the words preached by the apostles of the corner-stone cut out without hands.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:12
verses.text: And our hearts are thus circumcised from evil, so that we are happy to die for the name of the good Rock, which causes living water to burst forth for the hearts of those who by Him have loved the Father of all, and which gives those who are willing to drink of the water of life.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:13
verses.text: But you do not comprehend me when I speak these things; for you have not understood what it has been prophesied that Christ would do, and you do not believe us who draw your attention to what has been written.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:14
verses.text: For Jeremiah thus cries: 'Woe unto you! because you have forsaken the living fountain, and have digged for yourselves broken cisterns that can hold no water.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 114:15
verses.text: Shall there be a wilderness where Mount Zion is, because I gave Jerusalem a bill of divorce in your sight?'.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:1
verses.text: Chapter 115 — Prediction about the Christians in Zechariah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:2
verses.text: The malignant way which the Jews have in disputations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:3
verses.text: "But you ought to believe Zechariah when he shows in parable the mystery of Christ, and announces it obscurely.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:4
verses.text: The following are his words: 'Rejoice, and be glad, O daughter of Zion: for, lo, I come, and I shall dwell in the midst of thee, saith the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:5
verses.text: And many nations shall be added to the Lord in that day.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:6
verses.text: And they shall be my people, and I will dwell in the midst of thee; and they shall know that the Lord of hosts hath sent me unto thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:7
verses.text: And the Lord shall inherit Judah his portion in the holy land, and He shall choose Jerusalem again.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:8
verses.text: Let all flesh fear before the Lord, for He is raised up out of His holy clouds.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:9
verses.text: And He showed me Jesus (Joshua) the high priest standing before the angel of the Lord; and the devil stood at his right hand to resist him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:10
verses.text: And the Lord said to the devil, The Lord who hath chosen Jerusalem rebuke thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:11
verses.text: Behold, is not this a brand plucked out of the fire?' "  As Trypho was about to reply and contradict me, I said, "Wait and hear what I say first: for I am not to give the explanation which you suppose, as if there had been no priest of the name of Joshua (Jesus) in the land of Babylon, where your nation were prisoners.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:12
verses.text: But even if I did, I have shown that if there was a priest named Joshua (Jesus) in your nation, yet the prophet had not seen him in his revelation, just as he had not seen either the devil or the angel of the Lord by eyesight, and in his waking condition, but in a trance, at the time when the revelation was made to him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:13
verses.text: But I now say, that as Scripture said that the Son of Nave (Nun) by the name Jesus (Joshua) wrought powerful works and exploits which proclaimed beforehand what would be performed by our Lord; so I proceed now to show that the revelation made among your people in Babylon in the days of Jesus (Joshua) the priest, was an announcement of the things to be accomplished by our Priest, who is God, and Christ the Son of God the Father of all.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:14
verses.text: "Indeed, I wondered," continued I, "why a little ago you kept silence while I was speaking, and why you did not interrupt me when I said that the son of Nave (Nun) was the only one of contemporaries who came out of Egypt that entered the Holy Land along with the men described as younger than that generation.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:15
verses.text: For you swarm and light on sores like flies.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:16
verses.text: For though one should speak ten thousand words well, if there happen to be one little word displeasing to you, because not sufficiently intelligible or accurate, you make no account of the many good words, but lay hold of the little word, and are very zealous in setting it up as something impious and guilty; in order that, when you are judged with the very same judgment by God, you may have a much heavier account to render for your great audacities, whether evil actions, or bad interpretations which you obtain by falsifying the truth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 115:17
verses.text: For with what judgment you judge, it is righteous that you be judged withal.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 116:1
verses.text: Chapter 116 — It is shown how this prophecy suits the Christians.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 116:2
verses.text: "But to give you the account of the revelation of the holy Jesus Christ, I take up again my discourse, and I assert that even that revelation was made for us who believe on Christ the High Priest, namely this crucified One; and though we lived in fornication and all kinds of filthy conversation, we have by the grace of our Jesus, according to His Father's will, stripped ourselves of all those filthy wickednesses with which we were imbued.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 116:3
verses.text: And though the devil is ever at hand to resist us, and anxious to seduce all to himself, yet the Angel of God,  i-e:, the Power of God sent to us through Jesus Christ, rebukes him, and he departs from us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 116:4
verses.text: And we are just as if drawn out from the fire, when purified from our former sins, and rescued from the affliction and the fiery trial by which the devil and all his coadjutors try us; out of which Jesus the Son of God has promised again to deliver us, and invest us with prepared garments, if we do His commandments; and has undertaken to provide an eternal kingdom for us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 116:5
verses.text: For just as that Jesus (Joshua), called by the prophet a priest, evidently had on filthy garments because he is said to have taken a harlot for a wife, and is called a brand plucked out of the fire, because he had received remission of sins when the devil that resisted him was rebuked; even so we, who through the name of Jesus have believed as one man in God the Maker of all, have been stripped, through the name of His first-begotten Son, of the filthy garments,  i-e:, of our sins; and being vehemently inflamed by the word of His calling, we are the true high priestly race of God, as even God Himself bears witness, saying that in every place among the Gentiles sacrifices are presented to Him well-pleasing and pure.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 116:6
verses.text: Now God receives sacrifices from no one, except through His priests.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:1
verses.text: Chapter 117 — Malachi's prophecy concerning the sacrifices of the Christians.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:2
verses.text: It cannot be taken as referring to the prayers of Jews of the dispersion.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:3
verses.text: "Accordingly, God, anticipating all the sacrifices which we offer through this name, and which Jesus the Christ enjoined us to offer,  i-e:, in the Eucharist of the bread and the cup, and which are presented by Christians in all places throughout the world, bears witness that they are well-pleasing to Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:4
verses.text: But He utterly rejects those presented by you and by those priests of yours, saying, 'And I will not accept your sacrifices at your hands; for from the rising of the sun to its setting my name is glorified among the Gentiles (He says); but ye profane it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:5
verses.text: ' Yet even now, in your love of contention, you assert that God does not accept the sacrifices of those who dwelt then in Jerusalem, and were called Israelites; but says that He is pleased with the prayers of the individuals of that nation then dispersed, and calls their prayers sacrifices.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:6
verses.text: Now, that prayers and giving of thanks, when offered by worthy men, are the only perfect and well-pleasing sacrifices to God, I also admit.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:7
verses.text: For such alone Christians have undertaken to offer, and in the remembrance effected by their solid and liquid food, whereby the suffering of the Son of God which He endured is brought to mind, whose name the high priests of your nation and your teachers have caused to be profaned and blasphemed over all the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:8
verses.text: But these filthy garments, which have been put by you on all who have become Christians by the name of Jesus, God shows shall be taken away from us, when He shall raise all men from the dead, and appoint some to be incorruptible, immortal, and free from sorrow in the everlasting and imperishable kingdom; but shall send others away to the everlasting punishment of fire.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:9
verses.text: But as to you and your teachers deceiving yourselves when you interpret what the Scripture says as referring to those of your nation then in dispersion, and maintain that their prayers and sacrifices offered in every place are pure and well-pleasing, learn that you are speaking falsely, and trying by all means to cheat yourselves: for, first of all, not even now does your nation extend from the rising to the setting of the sun, but there are nations among which none of your race ever dwelt.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:10
verses.text: For there is not one single race of men, whether barbarians, or Greeks, or whatever they may be called, nomads, or vagrants, or herdsmen living in tents, among whom prayers and giving of thanks are not offered through the name of the crucified Jesus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 117:11
verses.text: And then, as the Scriptures show, at the time when Malachi wrote this, your dispersion over all the earth, which now exists, had not taken place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 118:1
verses.text: Chapter 118 — He exhorts to repentance before Christ comes; in whom Christians, since they believe, are far more religious than Jews.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 118:2
verses.text: "So that you ought rather to desist from the love of strife, and repent before the great day of judgment come, wherein all those of your tribes who have pierced this Christ shall mourn as I have shown has been declared by the Scriptures.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 118:3
verses.text: And I have explained that the Lord swore, 'after the order of Melchizedek,' and what this prediction means; and the prophecy of Isaiah which says, 'His burial is taken away from the midst,' I have already said, referred to the future burying and rising again of Christ; and I have frequently remarked that this very Christ is the Judge of all the living and the dead.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 118:4
verses.text: And Nathan likewise, speaking to David about Him, thus continued: 'I will be His Father, and He shall be my Son; and my mercy shall I not take away from Him, as I did from them that went before Him; and I will establish Him in my house, and in His kingdom for ever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 118:5
verses.text: ' And Ezekiel says, 'There shall be no other prince in the house but He.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 118:6
verses.text: ' For He is the chosen Priest and eternal King, the Christ, inasmuch as He is the Son of God; and do not suppose that Isaiah or the other prophets speak of sacrifices of blood or libations being presented at the altar on His second advent, but of true and spiritual praises and giving of thanks.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 118:7
verses.text: And we have not in vain believed in Him, and have not been led astray by those who taught us such doctrines; but this has come to pass through the wonderful foreknowledge of God, in order that we, through the calling of the new and eternal covenant, that is, of Christ, might be found more intelligent and God-fearing than yourselves, who are considered to be lovers of God and men of understanding, but are not.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 118:8
verses.text: Isaiah, filled with admiration of this, said: 'And kings shall shut their mouths: for those to whom no announcement has been made in regard to Him shall see; and those who heard not shall understand.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 118:9
verses.text: Lord, who hath believed our report? and to whom is the arm of the Lord revealed?'  "And in repeating this, Trypho," I continued, "as far as is allowable, I endeavour to do so for the sake of those who came with you to-day, yet briefly and concisely".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 118:10
verses.text: Then he replied, "You do well; and though you repeat the same things at considerable length, be assured that I and my companions listen with pleasure".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:1
verses.text: Chapter 119 — Christians are the holy people promised to Abraham.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:2
verses.text: They have been called like Abraham.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:3
verses.text: Then I said again, "Would you suppose, sirs, that we could ever have understood these matters in the Scriptures, if we had not received grace to discern by the will of Him whose pleasure it was? in order that the saying of Moses might come to pass, 'They provoked me with strange gods, they provoked me to anger with their abominations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:4
verses.text: They sacrificed to demons whom they knew not; new gods that came newly up, whom their fathers knew not.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:5
verses.text: Thou hast forsaken God that begat thee, and forgotten God that brought thee up.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:6
verses.text: And the Lord saw, and was jealous, and was provoked to anger by reason of the rage of His sons and daughters: and He said, I will turn My face away from them, and I will show what shall come on them at the last; for it is a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:7
verses.text: They have moved Me to jealousy with that which is not God, they have provoked Me to anger with their idols; and I will move them to jealousy with that which is not a nation, I will provoke them to anger with a foolish people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:8
verses.text: For a fire is kindled from Mine anger, and it shall burn to Hades.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:9
verses.text: It shall consume the earth and her increase, and set on fire the foundations of the mountains; I will heap mischief on them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:10
verses.text: ' And after that Righteous One was put to death, we flourished as another people, and shot forth as new and prosperous corn; as the prophets said, 'And many nations shall betake themselves to the Lord in that day for a people: and they shall dwell in the midst of all the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:11
verses.text: ' But we are not only a people, but also a holy people, as we have shown already.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:12
verses.text: 'And they shall call them the holy people, redeemed by the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:13
verses.text: ' Therefore we are not a people to be despised, nor a barbarous race, nor such as the Carian and Phrygian nations; but God has even chosen us and He has become manifest to those who asked not after Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:14
verses.text: 'Behold, I am God,' He says, 'to the nation which called not on My name.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:15
verses.text: ' For this is that nation which God of old promised to Abraham, when He declared that He would make him a father of many nations; not meaning, however, the Arabians, or Egyptians, or Idumaeans, since Ishmael became the father of a mighty nation, and so did Esau; and there is now a great multitude of Ammonites.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:16
verses.text: Noah, moreover, was the father of Abraham, and in fact of all men; and others were the progenitors of others.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:17
verses.text: What larger measure of grace, then, did Christ bestow on Abraham? This, namely, that He called him with His voice by the like calling, telling him to quit the land wherein he dwelt.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:18
verses.text: And He has called all of us by that voice, and we have left already the way of living in which we used to spend our days, passing our time in evil after the fashions of the other inhabitants of the earth; and along with Abraham we shall inherit the holy land, when we shall receive the inheritance for an endless eternity, being children of Abraham through the like faith.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:19
verses.text: For as he believed the voice of God, and it was imputed to him for righteousness, in like manner we having believed God's voice spoken by the apostles of Christ, and promulgated to us by the prophets, have renounced even to death all the things of the world.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 119:20
verses.text: Accordingly, He promises to him a nation of similar faith, God-fearing, righteous, and delighting the Father; but it is not you, 'in whom is no faith.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:1
verses.text: Chapter 120 — Christians were promised to Isaac, Jacob, and Judah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:2
verses.text: "Observe, too, how the same promises are made to Isaac and to Jacob.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:3
verses.text: For thus He speaks to Isaac: 'And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:4
verses.text: ' And to Jacob: 'And in thee and in thy seed shall all families of the earth be blessed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:5
verses.text: ' He says that neither to Esau nor to Reuben, nor to any other; only to those of whom the Christ should arise, according to the dispensation, through the Virgin Mary.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:6
verses.text: But if you would consider the blessing of Judah, you would perceive what I say.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:7
verses.text: For the seed is divided from Jacob, and comes down through Judah, and Phares, and Jesse, and David.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:8
verses.text: And this was a symbol of the fact that some of your nation would be found children of Abraham, and found, too, in the lot of Christ; but that others, who are indeed children of Abraham, would be like the sand on the sea-shore, barren and fruitless, much in quantity, and without number indeed, but bearing no fruit whatever, and only drinking the water of the sea.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:9
verses.text: And a vast multitude in your nation are convicted of being of this kind, imbibing doctrines of bitterness and godlessness, but spurning the word of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:10
verses.text: He speaks therefore in the passage relating to Judah: 'A prince shall not fail from Judah, nor a ruler from his thighs, till that which is laid up for him come; and He shall be the expectation of the nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:11
verses.text: ' And it is plain that this was spoken not of Judah, but of Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:12
verses.text: For all we out of all nations do expect not Judah, but Jesus, who led your fathers out of Egypt.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:13
verses.text: For the prophecy referred even to the advent of Christ: 'Till He come for whom this is laid up, and He shall be the expectation of nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:14
verses.text: ' Jesus came, therefore, as we have shown at length, and is expected again to appear above the clouds; whose name you profane, and labour hard to get it profaned over all the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:15
verses.text: It were possible for me, sirs," I continued, "to contend against you about the reading which you so interpret, saying it is written, 'Till the things laid up for Him come;' though the Seventy have not so explained it, but thus, 'Till He comes for whom this is laid up.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:16
verses.text: ' But since what follows indicates that the reference is to Christ (for it is, 'and He shall be the expectation of nations'), I do not proceed to have a mere verbal controversy with you, as I have not attempted to establish proof about Christ from the passages of Scripture which are not admitted by you which I quoted from the words of Jeremiah the prophet, and Esdras, and David; but from those which are even now admitted by you, which had your teachers comprehended, be well assured they would have deleted them, as they did those about the death of Isaiah, whom you sawed asunder with a wooden saw.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:17
verses.text: And this was a mysterious type of Christ being about to cut your nation in two, and to raise those worthy of the honour to the everlasting kingdom along with the holy patriarchs and prophets; but He has said that He will send others to the condemnation of the unquenchable fire along with similar disobedient and impenitent men from all the nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:18
verses.text: 'For they shall come,' He said, 'from the west and from the east, and shall sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven; but the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:19
verses.text: ' And I have mentioned these things, taking nothing whatever into consideration, except the speaking of the truth, and refusing to be coerced by any one, even though I should be forthwith torn in pieces by you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 120:20
verses.text: For I gave no thought to any of my people, that is, the Samaritans, when I had a communication in writing with Caesar, but stated that they were wrong in trusting to the magician Simon of their own nation, who, they say, is God above all power, and authority, and might".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:1
verses.text: Chapter 121 — From the fact that the Gentiles believe in Jesus, it is evident that He is Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:2
verses.text: And as they kept silence, I went on: "The Scripture, speaking by David about this Christ, my friends, said no longer that 'in His seed' the nations should be blessed, but 'in Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:3
verses.text: ' So it is here: 'His name shall rise up for ever above the sun; and in Him shall all nations be blessed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:4
verses.text: ' But if all nations are blessed in Christ, and we of all nations believe in Him, then He is indeed the Christ, and we are those blessed by Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:5
verses.text: God formerly gave the sun as an object of worship, as it is written, but no one ever was seen to endure death on account of his faith in the sun; but for the name of Jesus you may see men of every nation who have endured and do endure all sufferings, rather than deny Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:6
verses.text: For the word of His truth and wisdom is more ardent and more light-giving than the rays of the sun, and sinks down into the depths of heart and mind.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:7
verses.text: Hence also the Scripture said, 'His name shall rise up above the sun.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:8
verses.text: ' And again, Zechariah says, 'His name is the East.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:9
verses.text: ' And speaking of the same, he says that 'each tribe shall mourn.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:10
verses.text: ' But if He so shone forth and was so mighty in His first advent (which was without honour and comeliness, and very contemptible), that in no nation He is unknown, and everywhere men have repented of the old wickedness in each nation's way of living, so that even demons were subject to His name, and all powers and kingdoms feared His name more than they feared all the dead, shall He not on His glorious advent destroy by all means all those who hated Him, and who unrighteously departed from Him, but give rest to His own, rewarding them with all they have looked for? To us, therefore, it has been granted to hear, and to understand, and to be saved by this Christ, and to recognise all the truths revealed by the Father.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:11
verses.text: Wherefore He said to Him: 'It is a great thing for Thee to be called my servant, to raise up the tribes of Jacob, and turn again the dispersed of Israel.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 121:12
verses.text: I have appointed Thee for a light to the Gentiles, that Thou mayest be their salvation unto the end of the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:1
verses.text: Chapter 122 — The Jews understand this of the proselytes without reason.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:2
verses.text: "You think that these words refer to the stranger and the proselytes, but in fact they refer to us who have been illumined by Jesus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:3
verses.text: For Christ would have borne witness even to them; but now you are become twofold more the children of hell, as He said Himself.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:4
verses.text: Therefore what was written by the prophets was spoken not of those persons, but of us, concerning whom the Scripture speaks: 'I will lead the blind by a way which they knew not; and they shall walk in paths which they have not known.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:5
verses.text: And I am witness, saith the Lord God, and my servant whom I have chosen.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:6
verses.text: ' To whom, then, does Christ bear witness? Manifestly to those who have believed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:7
verses.text: But the proselytes not only do not believe, but twofold more than yourselves blaspheme His name, and wish to torture and put to death us who believe in Him; for in all points they strive to be like you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:8
verses.text: And again in other words He cries: 'I the Lord have called Thee in righteousness, and will hold Thine hand, and will strengthen Thee, and will give Thee for a covenant of the people, for a light of the Gentiles, to open the eyes of the blind, to bring out the prisoners from their bonds.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:9
verses.text: ' These words, indeed, sirs, refer also to Christ, and concern the enlightened nations; or will you say again, He speaks to them of the law and the proselytes?"  Then some of those who had come on the second day cried out as if they had been in a theatre, "But what? does He not refer to the law, and to those illumined by it? Now these are proselytes".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:10
verses.text: "No," I said, looking towards Trypho, "since, if the law were able to enlighten the nations and those who possess it, what need is there of a new covenant? But since God announced beforehand that He would send a new covenant, and an everlasting law and commandment, we will not understand this of the old law and its proselytes, but of Christ and His proselytes, namely us Gentiles, whom He has illumined, as He says somewhere: 'Thus saith the Lord, In an acceptable time have I heard Thee, and in a day of salvation have I helped Thee, and I have given Thee for a covenant of the people, to establish the earth, and to inherit the deserted.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:11
verses.text: ' What, then, is Christ's inheritance? Is it not the nations? What is the covenant of God? Is it not Christ? As He says in another place: 'Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten Thee.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 122:12
verses.text: Ask of Me, and I shall give Thee the nations for Thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for Thy possession.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:1
verses.text: Chapter 123 — Ridiculous interpretations of the Jews.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:2
verses.text: Christians are the true Israel.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:3
verses.text: "As, therefore, all these latter prophecies refer to Christ and the nations, you should believe that the former refer to Him and them in like manner.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:4
verses.text: For the proselytes have no need of a covenant, if, since there is one and the same law imposed on all that are circumcised, the Scripture speaks about them thus: 'And the stranger shall also be joined with them, and shall be joined to the house of Jacob;' and because the proselyte, who is circumcised that he may have access to the people, becomes like one of themselves, while we who have been deemed worthy to be called a people are yet Gentiles, because we have not been circumcised.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:5
verses.text: Besides, it is ridiculous for you to imagine that the eyes of the proselytes are to be opened while your own are not, and that you be understood as blind and deaf while they are enlightened.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:6
verses.text: And it will be still more ridiculous for you, if you say that the law has been given to the nations, but you have not known it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:7
verses.text: For you would have stood in awe of God's wrath, and would not have been lawless, wandering sons; being much afraid of hearing God always say, 'Children in whom is no faith.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:8
verses.text: And who are blind, but my servants? and deaf, but they that rule over them? And the servants of God have been made blind.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:9
verses.text: You see often, but have not observed; your ears have been opened, and you have not heard.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:10
verses.text: ' Is God's commendation of you honourable? and is God's testimony seemly for His servants? You are not ashamed though you often hear these words.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:11
verses.text: You do not tremble at God's threats, for you are a people foolish and hard-hearted.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:12
verses.text: 'Therefore, behold, I will proceed to remove this people,' saith the Lord; 'and I will remove them, and destroy the wisdom of the wise, and hide the understanding of the prudent.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:13
verses.text: ' Deservedly too: for you are neither wise nor prudent, but crafty and unscrupulous; wise only to do evil, but utterly incompetent to know the hidden counsel of God, or the faithful covenant of the Lord, or to find out the everlasting paths.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:14
verses.text: 'Therefore, saith the Lord, I will raise up to Israel and to Judah the seed of men and the seed of beasts.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:15
verses.text: ' And by Isaiah He speaks thus concerning another Israel: 'In that day shall there be a third Israel among the Assyrians and the Egyptians, blessed in the land which the Lord of Sabaoth hath blessed, saying, blessed shall my people in Egypt and in Assyria be, and Israel mine inheritance.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:16
verses.text: ' Since then God blesses this people, and calls them Israel, and declares them to be His inheritance, how is it that you repent not of the deception you practise on yourselves, as if you alone were the Israel, and of execrating the people whom God has blessed? For when He speaks to Jerusalem and its environs, He thus added: 'And I will beget men upon you, even my people Israel; and they shall inherit you, and you shall be a possession for them; and you shall be no longer bereaved of them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:17
verses.text: ' "  "What, then?" says Trypho; "are you Israel? and speaks He such things of you?"  "If, indeed," I replied to him, "we had not entered into a lengthy discussion on these topics, I might have doubted whether you ask this question in ignorance; but since we have brought the matter to a conclusion by demonstration and with your assent, I do not believe that you are ignorant of what I have just said, or desire again mere contention, but that you are urging me to exhibit the same proof to these men".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:18
verses.text: And in compliance with the assent expressed in his eyes, I continued: "Again in Isaiah, if you have ears to hear it, God, speaking of Christ in parable, calls Him Jacob and Israel.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:19
verses.text: He speaks thus: 'Jacob is my servant, I will uphold Him; Israel is mine elect, I will put my Spirit upon Him, and He shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:20
verses.text: He shall not strive, nor cry, neither shall any one hear His voice in the street: a bruised reed He shall not break, and smoking flax He shall not quench; but He shall bring forth judgment to truth: He shall shine, and shall not be broken till He have set judgment on the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:21
verses.text: And in His name shall the Gentiles trust.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 123:22
verses.text: ' As therefore from the one man Jacob, who was surnamed Israel, all your nation has been called Jacob and Israel; so we from Christ, who begat us unto God, like Jacob, and Israel, and Judah, and Joseph, and David, are called and are the true sons of God, and keep the commandments of Christ".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:1
verses.text: Chapter 124 — Christians are the sons of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:2
verses.text: And when I saw that they were perturbed because I said that we are the sons of God, I anticipated their questioning, and said, "Listen, sirs, how the Holy Ghost speaks of this people, saying that they are all sons of the Highest; and how this very Christ will be present in their assembly, rendering judgment to all men.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:3
verses.text: The words are spoken by David, and are, according to your version of them, thus: 'God standeth in the congregation of gods; He judgeth among the gods.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:4
verses.text: How long do ye judge unjustly, and accept the persons of the wicked? Judge for the orphan and the poor, and do justice to the humble and needy.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:5
verses.text: Deliver the needy, and save the poor out of the hand of the wicked.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:6
verses.text: They know not, neither have they understood; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth shall be shaken.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:7
verses.text: I said, Ye are gods, and are all children of the Most High.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:8
verses.text: But ye die like men, and fall like one of the princes.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:9
verses.text: Arise, O God! judge the earth, for Thou shalt inherit all nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:10
verses.text: ' But in the version of the Seventy it is written, 'Behold, ye die like men, and fall like one of the princes,' in order to manifest the disobedience of men,—I mean of Adam and Eve,—and the fall of one of the princes,  i-e:, of him who was called the serpent, who fell with a great overthrow, because he deceived Eve.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:11
verses.text: But as my discourse is not intended to touch on this point, but to prove to you that the Holy Ghost reproaches men because they were made like God, free from suffering and death, provided that they kept His commandments, and were deemed deserving of the name of His sons, and yet they, becoming like Adam and Eve, work out death for themselves; let the interpretation of the Psalm be held just as you wish, yet thereby it is demonstrated that all men are deemed worthy of becoming "gods," and of having power to become sons of the Highest; and shall be each by himself judged and condemned like Adam and Eve.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 124:12
verses.text: Now I have proved at length that Christ is called God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:1
verses.text: Chapter 125 — He explains what force the word Israel has, and how it suits Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:2
verses.text: "I wish, sirs," I said, "to learn from you what is the force of the name Israel".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:3
verses.text: And as they were silent, I continued: "I shall tell you what I know: for I do not think it right, when I know, not to speak; or, suspecting that you do know, and yet from envy or from voluntary ignorance deceive yourselves, to be continually solicitous; but I speak all things simply and candidly, as my Lord said: 'A sower went forth to sow the seed; and some fell by the wayside; and some among thorns, and some on stony ground, and some on good ground.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:4
verses.text: ' I must speak, then, in the hope of finding good ground somewhere; since that Lord of mine, as One strong and powerful, comes to demand back His own from all, and will not condemn His steward if He recognises that he, by the knowledge that the Lord is powerful and has come to demand His own, has given it to every bank, and has not digged for any cause whatsoever.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:5
verses.text: Accordingly the name Israel signifies this, A man who overcomes power; for Isra is a man overcoming, and El is power.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:6
verses.text: And that Christ would act so when He became man was foretold by the mystery of Jacob's wrestling with Him who appeared to him, in that He ministered to the will of the Father, yet nevertheless is God, in that He is the first-begotten of all creatures.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:7
verses.text: For when He became man, as I previously remarked, the devil came to Him—i.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:8
verses.text: e.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:9
verses.text: , that power which is called the serpent and Satan—tempting Him, and striving to effect His downfall by asking Him to worship him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:10
verses.text: But He destroyed and overthrew the devil, having proved him to be wicked, in that he asked to be worshipped as God, contrary to the Scripture; who is an apostate from the will of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:11
verses.text: For He answers him, 'It is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shall thou serve.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:12
verses.text: ' Then, overcome and convicted, the devil departed at that time.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:13
verses.text: But since our Christ was to be numbed,  i-e:, by pain and experience of suffering, He made a previous intimation of this by touching Jacob's thigh, and causing it to shrink.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:14
verses.text: But Israel was His name from the beginning, to which He altered the name of the blessed Jacob when He blessed him with His own name, proclaiming thereby that all who through Him have fled for refuge to the Father, constitute the blessed Israel.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:15
verses.text: But you, having understood none of this, and not being prepared to understand, since you are the children of Jacob after the fleshly seed, expect that you shall be assuredly saved.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 125:16
verses.text: But that you deceive yourselves in such matters, I have proved by many words.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:1
verses.text: Chapter 126 — The various names of Christ according to both natures.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:2
verses.text: It is shown that He is God, and appeared to the patriarchs.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:3
verses.text: "But if you knew, Trypho," continued I, "who He is that is called at one time the Angel of great counsel, and a Man by Ezekiel, and like the Son of man by Daniel, and a Child by Isaiah, and Christ and God to be worshipped by David, and Christ and a Stone by many, and Wisdom by Solomon, and Joseph and Judah and a Star by Moses, and the East by Zechariah, and the Suffering One and Jacob and Israel by Isaiah again, and a Rod, and Flower, and Corner-Stone, and Son of God, you would not have blasphemed Him who has now come, and been born, and suffered, and ascended to heaven; who shall also come again, and then your twelve tribes shall mourn.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:4
verses.text: For if you had understood what has been written by the prophets, you would not have denied that He was God, Son of the only, unbegotten, unutterable God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:5
verses.text: For Moses says somewhere in Exodus the following: 'The Lord spoke to Moses, and said to him, I am the Lord, and I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, being their God; and my name I revealed not to them, and I established my covenant with them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:6
verses.text: ' And thus again he says, 'A man wrestled with Jacob,' and asserts it was God; narrating that Jacob said, 'I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:7
verses.text: ' And it is recorded that he called the place where He wrestled with him, appeared to and blessed him, the Face of God (Peniel).

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:8
verses.text: And Moses says that God appeared also to Abraham near the oak in Mamre, when he was sitting at the door of his tent at mid-day.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:9
verses.text: Then he goes on to say: 'And he lifted up his eyes and looked, and, behold, three men stood before him; and when he saw them, he ran to meet them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:10
verses.text: ' After a little, one of them promises a son to Abraham: 'Wherefore did Sarah laugh, saying, Shall I of a surety bear a child, and I am old? Is anything impossible with God? At the time appointed I will return, according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:11
verses.text: And they went away from Abraham.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:12
verses.text: ' Again he speaks of them thus: 'And the men rose up from thence, and looked toward Sodom.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:13
verses.text: ' Then to Abraham He who was and is again speaks: 'I will not hide from Abraham, my servant, what I intend to do.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:14
verses.text: ' " And what follows in the writings of Moses I quoted and explained; "from which I have demonstrated," I said, "that He who is described as God appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, and the other patriarchs, was appointed under the authority of the Father and Lord, and ministers to His will".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:15
verses.text: Then I went on to say what I had not said before: "And so, when the people desired to eat flesh, and Moses had lost faith in Him, who also there is called the Angel, and who promised that God would give them to satiety, He who is both God and the Angel, sent by the Father, is described as saying and doing these things.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:16
verses.text: For thus the Scripture says: 'And the Lord said to Moses, Will the Lord's hand not be sufficient? thou shall know now whether my word shall conceal thee or not.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 126:17
verses.text: ' And again, in other words, it thus says: 'But the Lord spoke unto me, Thou shalt not go over this Jordan: the Lord thy God, who goeth before thy face, He shall cut off the nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 127:1
verses.text: Chapter 127 — These passages of Scripture do not apply to the Father, but to the Word.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 127:2
verses.text: "These and other such sayings are recorded by the lawgiver and by the prophets; and I suppose that I have stated sufficiently, that wherever God says, 'God went up from Abraham,' or, 'The Lord spake to Moses,' and 'The Lord came down to behold the tower which the sons of men had built,' or when 'God shut Noah into the ark,' you must not imagine that the unbegotten God Himself came down or went up from any place.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 127:3
verses.text: For the ineffable Father and Lord of all neither has come to any place, nor walks, nor sleeps, nor rises up, but remains in His own place, wherever that is, quick to behold and quick to hear, having neither eyes nor ears, but being of indescribable might; and He sees all things, and knows all things, and none of us escapes His observation; and He is not moved or confined to a spot in the whole world, for He existed before the world was made.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 127:4
verses.text: How, then, could He talk with any one, or be seen by any one, or appear on the smallest portion of the earth, when the people at Sinai were not able to look even on the glory of Him who was sent from Him; and Moses himself could not enter into the tabernacle which he had erected, when it was filled with the glory of God; and the priest could not endure to stand before the temple when Solomon conveyed the ark into the house in Jerusalem which he had built for it? Therefore neither Abraham, nor Isaac, nor Jacob, nor any other man, saw the Father and ineffable Lord of all, and also of Christ, but saw Him who was according to His will His Son, being God, and the Angel because He ministered to His will; whom also it pleased Him to be born man by the Virgin; who also was fire when He conversed with Moses from the bush.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 127:5
verses.text: Since, unless we thus comprehend the Scriptures, it must follow that the Father and Lord of all had not been in heaven when what Moses wrote took place: 'And the Lord rained upon Sodom fire and brimstone from the Lord out of heaven;' and again, when it is thus said by David: 'Lift up your gates, ye rulers; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting gates; and the King of glory shall enter;' and again, when He says: 'The Lord says to my Lord, Sit at My right hand, till I make Thine enemies Thy footstool.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 128:1
verses.text: Chapter 128 — The Word is sent not as an inanimate power, but as a person begotten of the Father's substance.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 128:2
verses.text: "And that Christ being Lord, and God the Son of God, and appearing formerly in power as Man, and Angel, and in the glory of fire as at the bush, so also was manifested at the judgment executed on Sodom, has been demonstrated fully by what has been said".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 128:3
verses.text: Then I repeated once more all that I had previously quoted from Exodus, about the vision in the bush, and the naming of Joshua (Jesus), and continued: "And do not suppose, sirs, that I am speaking superfluously when I repeat these words frequently: but it is because I know that some wish to anticipate these remarks, and to say that the power sent from the Father of all which appeared to Moses, or to Abraham, or to Jacob, is called an Angel because He came to men (for by Him the commands of the Father have been proclaimed to men); is called Glory, because He appears in a vision sometimes that cannot be borne; is called a Man, and a human being, because He appears arrayed in such forms as the Father pleases; and they call Him the Word, because He carries tidings from the Father to men: but maintain that this power is indivisible and inseparable from the Father, just as they say that the light of the sun on earth is indivisible and inseparable from the sun in the heavens; as when it sinks, the light sinks along with it; so the Father, when He chooses, say they, causes His power to spring forth, and when He chooses, He makes it return to Himself.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 128:4
verses.text: In this way, they teach, He made the angels.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 128:5
verses.text: But it is proved that there are angels who always exist, and are never reduced to that form out of which they sprang.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 128:6
verses.text: And that this power which the prophetic word calls God, as has been also amply demonstrated, and Angel, is not numbered as different in name only like the light of the sun but is indeed something numerically distinct, I have discussed briefly in what has gone before; when I asserted that this power was begotten from the Father, by His power and will, but not by abscission, as if the essence of the Father were divided; as all other things partitioned and divided are not the same after as before they were divided: and, for the sake of example, I took the case of fires kindled from a fire, which we see to be distinct from it, and yet that from which many can be kindled is by no means made less, but remains the same.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 129:1
verses.text: Chapter 129 — That is confirmed from other passages of Scripture.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 129:2
verses.text: "And now I shall again recite the words which I have spoken in proof of this point.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 129:3
verses.text: When Scripture says, 'The Lord rained fire from the Lord out of heaven,' the prophetic word indicates that there were two in number: One upon the earth, who, it says, descended to behold the cry of Sodom; Another in heaven, who also is Lord of the Lord on earth, as He is Father and God; the cause of His power and of His being Lord and God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 129:4
verses.text: Again, when the Scripture records that God said in the beginning, 'Behold, Adam has become like one of Us,' this phrase, 'like one of Us,' is also indicative of number; and the words do not admit of a figurative meaning, as the sophists endeavour to affix on them, who are able neither to tell nor to understand the truth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 129:5
verses.text: And it is written in the book of Wisdom: 'If I should tell you daily events, I would be mindful to enumerate them from the beginning.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 129:6
verses.text: The Lord created me the beginning of His ways for His works.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 129:7
verses.text: From everlasting He established me in the beginning, before He formed the earth, and before He made the depths, and before the springs of waters came forth, before the mountains were settled; He begets me before all the hills.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 129:8
verses.text: ' " When I repeated these words, I added: "You perceive, my hearers, if you bestow attention, that the Scripture has declared that this Offspring was begotten by the Father before all things created; and that which is begotten is numerically distinct from that which begets, any one will admit".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 130:1
verses.text: Chapter 130 — He returns to the conversion of the Gentiles, and shows that it was foretold.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 130:2
verses.text: And when all had given assent, I said: "I would now adduce some passages which I had not recounted before.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 130:3
verses.text: They are recorded by the faithful servant Moses in parable, and are as follows: 'Rejoice, O ye heavens, with Him, and let all the angels of God worship Him;' " and I added what follows of the passage: " 'Rejoice, O ye nations, with His people, and let all the angels of God be strengthened in Him: for the blood of His sons He avenges, and will avenge, and will recompense His enemies with vengeance, and will recompense those that hate Him; and the Lord will purify the land of His people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 130:4
verses.text: ' And by these words He declares that we, the nations, rejoice with His people, — to wit, Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and the prophets, and, in short, all of that people who are well-pleasing to God, according to what has been already agreed on between us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 130:5
verses.text: But we will not receive it of all your nation; since we know from Isaiah that the members of those who have transgressed shall be consumed by the worm and unquenchable fire, remaining immortal; so that they become a spectacle to all flesh.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 130:6
verses.text: But in addition to these, I wish, sirs," said I, "to add some other passages from the very words of Moses, from which you may understand that God has from of old dispersed all men according to their kindreds and tongues; and out of all kindreds has taken to Himself your kindred, a useless, disobedient, and faithless generation; and has shown that those who were selected out of every nation have obeyed His will through Christ,—whom He calls also Jacob, and names Israel, — and these, then, as I mentioned fully previously, must be Jacob and Israel.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 130:7
verses.text: For when He says, 'Rejoice, O ye nations, with His people,' He allots the same inheritance to them, and does not call them by the same name; but when He says that they as Gentiles rejoice with His people, He calls them Gentiles to reproach you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 130:8
verses.text: For even as you provoked Him to anger by your idolatry, so also He has deemed those who were idolaters worthy of knowing His will, and of inheriting His inheritance.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 131:1
verses.text: Chapter 131 — How much more faithful to God the Gentiles are who are converted to Christ than the Jews.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 131:2
verses.text: "But I shall quote the passage by which it is made known that God divided all the nations.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 131:3
verses.text: It is as follows: 'Ask thy father, and he will show thee; thine elders, and they will tell thee; when the Most High divided the nations, as He dispersed the sons of Adam.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 131:4
verses.text: He set the bounds of the nations according to the numbers of the children of Israel; and the Lord's portion became His people Jacob, and Israel was the lot of His inheritance.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 131:5
verses.text: ' " And having said this, I added: "The Seventy have translated it, 'He set the bounds of the nations according to the number of the angels of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 131:6
verses.text: ' But because my argument is again in nowise weakened by this, I have adopted your exposition.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 131:7
verses.text: And you yourselves, if you will confess the truth, must acknowledge that we, who have been called by God through the despised and shameful mystery of the cross (for the confession of which, and obedience to which, and for our piety, punishments even to death have been inflicted on us by demons, and by the host of the devil, through the aid ministered to them by you), and endure all torments rather than deny Christ even by word, through whom we are called to the salvation prepared beforehand by the Father, are more faithful to God than you, who were redeemed from Egypt with a high hand and a visitation of great glory, when the sea was parted for you, and a passage left dry, in which God slew those who pursued you with a very great equipment, and splendid chariots, bringing back upon them the sea which had been made a way for your sakes; on whom also a pillar of light shone, in order that you, more than any other nation in the world, might possess a peculiar light, never-failing and never-setting; for whom He rained manna as nourishment, fit for the heavenly angels, in order that you might have no need to prepare your food; and the water at Marah was made sweet; and a sign of Him that was to be crucified was made, both in the matter of the serpents which bit you, as I already mentioned (God anticipating before the proper times these mysteries, in order to confer grace upon you, to whom you are always convicted of being thankless), as well as in the type of the extending of the hands of Moses, and of Oshea being named Jesus (Joshua); when you fought against Amalek: concerning which God enjoined that the incident be recorded, and the name of Jesus laid up in your understandings; saying that this is He who would blot out the memorial of Amalek from under heaven.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 131:8
verses.text: Now it is clear that the memorial of Amalek remained after the son of Nave (Nun): but He makes it manifest through Jesus, who was crucified, of whom also those symbols were fore-announcements of all that would happen to Him, the demons would be destroyed, and would dread His name, and that all principalities and kingdoms would fear Him; and that they who believe in Him out of all nations would be shown as God-fearing and peaceful men; and the facts already quoted by me, Trypho, indicate this.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 131:9
verses.text: Again, when you desired flesh, so vast a quantity of quails was given you, that they could not be told; for whom also water gushed from the rock; and a cloud followed you for a shade from heat, and covering from cold, declaring the manner and signification of another and new heaven; the latchets of your shoes did not break, and your shoes waxed not old, and your garments wore not away, but even those of the children grew along with them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 132:1
verses.text: Chapter 132 — How great the power was of the name of Jesus in the Old Testament.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 132:2
verses.text: "Yet after this you made a calf, and were very zealous in committing fornication with the daughters of strangers, and in serving idols.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 132:3
verses.text: And again, when the land was given up to you with so great a display of power, that you witnessed the sun stand still in the heavens by the order of that man whose name was Jesus (Joshua), and not go down for thirty-six hours, as well as all the other miracles which were wrought for you as time served; and of these it seems good to me now to speak of another, for it conduces to your hereby knowing Jesus, whom we also know to have been Christ the Son of God, who was crucified, and rose again, and ascended to heaven, and will come again to judge all men, even up to Adam himself.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 132:4
verses.text: You are aware, then," I continued, "that when the ark of the testimony was seized by the enemies of Ashdod, and a terrible and incurable malady had broken out among them, they resolved to place it on a cart to which they yoked cows that had recently calved, for the purpose of ascertaining by trial whether or not they had been plagued by God's power on account of the ark, and if God wished it to be taken back to the place from which it had been carried away.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 132:5
verses.text: And when they had done this, the cows, led by no man, went not to the place whence the ark had been taken, but to the fields of a certain man whose name was Oshea, the same as his whose name was altered to Jesus (Joshua), as has been previously mentioned, who also led the people into the land and meted it out to them: and when the cows had come into these fields they remained there, showing to you thereby that they were guided by the name of power; just as formerly the people who survived of those that came out of Egypt, were guided into the land by him who had received the name Jesus (Joshua), who before was called Oshea.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:1
verses.text: Chapter 133 — The hard-heartedness of the Jews, for whom the Christians pray.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:2
verses.text: "Now, although these and all other such unexpected and marvellous works were wrought amongst and seen by you at different times, yet you are convicted by the prophets of having gone to such a length as offering your own children to demons; and besides all this, of having dared to do such things against Christ; and you still dare to do them: for all which may it be granted to you to obtain mercy and salvation from God and His Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:3
verses.text: For God, knowing before that you would do such things, pronounced this curse upon you by the prophet Isaiah: 'Woe unto their soul! they have devised evil counsel against themselves, saying, Let us bind the righteous man, for he is distasteful to us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:4
verses.text: Therefore they shall eat the fruit of their own doings.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:5
verses.text: Woe to the wicked! evil, according to the works of his hands, shall befall him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:6
verses.text: O my people, your exactors glean you, and those who extort from you shall rule over you.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:7
verses.text: O my people, they who call you blessed cause you to err, and disorder the way of your paths.
