verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:8
verses.text: But now the Lord shall assist His people to judgment, and He shall enter into judgment with the elders of the people and the princes thereof.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:9
verses.text: But why have you burnt up my vineyard? and why is the spoil of the poor found in your houses? Why do you wrong my people, and put to shame the countenance of the humble?' Again, in other words, the same prophet spake to the same effect: 'Woe unto them that draw their iniquity as with a long cord, and their transgressions as with the harness of an heifer's yoke: who say, Let His speed come near, and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel come, that we may know it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:10
verses.text: Woe unto them that call evil good, and good evil! that put light for darkness, and darkness for light! that put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter! Woe unto them that are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own sight! Woe unto those that are mighty among you, who drink wine, who are men of strength, who mingle strong drink! who justify the wicked for a reward, and take away justice from the righteous! Therefore, as the stubble shall be burnt by the coal of fire, and utterly consumed by the burning flame, their root shall be as wool, and their flower shall go up like dust.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:11
verses.text: For they would not have the law of the Lord of Sabaoth, but despised the word of the Lord, the Holy One of Israel.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:12
verses.text: And the Lord of Sabaoth was very angry, and laid His hands upon them, and smote them; and He was provoked against the mountains, and their carcases were in the midst like dung on the road.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:13
verses.text: And for all this they have not repented, but their hand is still high.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 133:14
verses.text: ' For verily your hand is high to commit evil, because ye slew the Christ, and do not repent of it; but so far from that, ye hate and murder us who have believed through Him in the God and Father of all, as often as ye can; and ye curse Him without ceasing, as well as those who side with Him; while all of us pray for you, and for all men, as our Christ and Lord taught us to do, when He enjoined us to pray even for our enemies, and to love them that hate us, and to bless them that curse us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:1
verses.text: Chapter 134 — The marriages of Jacob are a figure of the Church.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:2
verses.text: "If, then, the teaching of the prophets and of Himself moves you, it is better for you to follow God than your imprudent and blind masters, who even till this time permit each man to have four or five wives; and if any one see a beautiful woman and desire to have her, they quote the doings of Jacob called Israel, and of the other patriarchs, and maintain that it is not wrong to do such things; for they are miserably ignorant in this matter.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:3
verses.text: For, as I before said, certain dispensations of weighty mysteries were accomplished in each act of this sort.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:4
verses.text: For in the marriages of Jacob I shall mention what dispensation and prophecy were accomplished, in order that you may thereby know that your teachers never looked at the divine motive which prompted each act, but only at the grovelling and corrupting passions.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:5
verses.text: Attend therefore to what I say.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:6
verses.text: The marriages of Jacob were types of that which Christ was about to accomplish.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:7
verses.text: For it was not lawful for Jacob to marry two sisters at once.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:8
verses.text: And he serves Laban for one of the daughters; and being deceived in the obtaining of the younger, he again served seven years.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:9
verses.text: Now Leah is your people and synagogue; but Rachel is our Church.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:10
verses.text: And for these, and for the servants in both, Christ even now serves.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:11
verses.text: For while Noah gave to the two sons the seed of the third as servants, now on the other hand Christ has come to restore both the free sons and the servants amongst them, conferring the same honour on all of them who keep His commandments; even as the children of the free women and the children of the bond women born to Jacob were all sons, and equal in dignity.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:12
verses.text: And it was foretold what each should be according to rank and according to fore-knowledge.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:13
verses.text: Jacob served Laban for speckled and many-spotted sheep; and Christ served, even to the slavery of the cross, for the various and many-formed races of mankind, acquiring them by the blood and mystery of the cross.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:14
verses.text: Leah was weak-eyed; for the eyes of your souls are excessively weak.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:15
verses.text: Rachel stole the gods of Laban, and has hid them to this day; and we have lost our paternal and material gods.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:16
verses.text: Jacob was hated for all time by his brother; and we now, and our Lord Himself, are hated by you and by all men, though we are brothers by nature.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 134:17
verses.text: Jacob was called Israel; and Israel has been demonstrated to be the Christ, who is, and is called, Jesus.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:1
verses.text: Chapter 135 — Christ is king of Israel, and Christians are the Israelitic race.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:2
verses.text: "And when Scripture says, 'I am the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel, who have made known Israel your King,' will you not understand that truly Christ is the everlasting King? For you are aware that Jacob the son of Isaac was never a king.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:3
verses.text: And therefore Scripture again, explaining to us, says what king is meant by Jacob and Israel: 'Jacob is my Servant, I will uphold Him; and Israel is mine Elect, my soul shall receive Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:4
verses.text: I have given Him my Spirit; and He shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:5
verses.text: He shall not cry, and His voice shall not be heard without.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:6
verses.text: The bruised reed He shall not break, and the smoking flax He shall not quench, until He shall bring forth judgment to victory.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:7
verses.text: He shall shine, and shall not be broken, until He set judgment on the earth.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:8
verses.text: And in His name shall the Gentiles trust.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:9
verses.text: ' Then is it Jacob the patriarch in whom the Gentiles and yourselves shall trust? or is it not Christ? As, therefore, Christ is the Israel and the Jacob, even so we, who have been quarried out from the bowels of Christ, are the true Israelitic race.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:10
verses.text: But let us attend rather to the very word: 'And I will bring forth,' He says, 'the seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah: and it shall inherit My holy mountain; and Mine Elect and My servants shall possess the inheritance, and shall dwell there; and there shall be folds of flocks in the thicket, and the valley of Achor shall be a resting-place of cattle for the people who have sought Me.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:11
verses.text: But as for you, who forsake Me, and forget My holy mountain, and prepare a table for demons, and fill out drink for the demon, I shall give you to the sword.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:12
verses.text: You shall all fall with a slaughter; for I called you, and you hearkened not, and did evil before me, and did choose that wherein I delighted not.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:13
verses.text: ' Such are the words of Scripture; understand, therefore, that the seed of Jacob now referred to is something else, and not, as may be supposed, spoken of your people.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 135:14
verses.text: For it is not possible for the seed of Jacob to leave an entrance for the descendants of Jacob, or for God to have accepted the very same persons whom He had reproached with unfitness for the inheritance, and promise it to them again; but as there the prophet says, 'And now, O house of Jacob, come and let us walk in the light of the Lord; for He has sent away His people, the house of Jacob, because their land was full, as at the first, of soothsayers and divinations;' even so it is necessary for us here to observe that there are two seeds of Judah, and two races, as there are two houses of Jacob: the one begotten by blood and flesh, the other by faith and the Spirit.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:1
verses.text: Chapter 136 — The Jews, in rejecting Christ, rejected God who sent him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:2
verses.text: "For you see how He now addresses the people, saying a little before: 'As the grape shall be found in the cluster, and they will say, Destroy it not, for a blessing is in it; so will I do for My servant's sake: for His sake I will not destroy them all.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:3
verses.text: ' And thereafter He adds: 'And I shall bring forth the seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:4
verses.text: ' It is plain then that if He thus be angry with them, and threaten to leave very few of them, He promises to bring forth certain others, who shall dwell in His mountain.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:5
verses.text: But these are the persons whom He said He would sow and beget.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:6
verses.text: For you neither suffer Him when He calls you, nor hear Him when He speaks to you, but have done evil in the presence of the Lord.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:7
verses.text: But the highest pitch of your wickedness lies in this, that you hate the Righteous One, and slew Him; and so treat those who have received from Him all that they are and have, and who are pious, righteous, and humane.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:8
verses.text: Therefore 'woe unto their soul,' says the Lord, 'for they have devised an evil counsel against themselves, saying, Let us take away the righteous, for he is distasteful to us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:9
verses.text: ' For indeed you are not in the habit of sacrificing to Baal, as were your fathers, or of placing cakes in groves and on high places for the host of heaven: but you have not accepted God's Christ.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:10
verses.text: For he who knows not Him, knows not the will of God; and he who insults and hates Him, insults and hates Him that sent Him.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 136:11
verses.text: And whoever believes not in Him, believes not the declarations of the prophets, who preached and proclaimed Him to all.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 137:1
verses.text: Chapter 137 — He exhorts the Jews to be converted.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 137:2
verses.text: "Say no evil thing, my brothers, against Him that was crucified, and treat not scornfully the stripes wherewith all may be healed, even as we are healed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 137:3
verses.text: For it will be well if, persuaded by the Scriptures, you are circumcised from hard-heartedness: not that circumcision which you have from the tenets that are put into you; for that was given for a sign, and not for a work of righteousness, as the Scriptures compel you to admit.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 137:4
verses.text: Assent, therefore, and pour no ridicule on the Son of God; obey not the Pharisaic teachers, and scoff not at the King of Israel, as the rulers of your synagogues teach you to do after your prayers: for if he that touches those who are not pleasing to God, is as one that touches the apple of God's eye, how much more so is he that touches His beloved! And that this is He, has been sufficiently demonstrated".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 137:5
verses.text: And as they kept silence, I continued: "My friends, I now refer to the Scriptures as the Seventy have interpreted them; for when I quoted them formerly as you possess them, I made proof of you to ascertain how you were disposed.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 137:6
verses.text: For, mentioning the Scripture which says, 'Woe unto them! for they have devised evil counsel against themselves, saying' (as the Seventy have translated, I continued): 'Let us take away the righteous, for he is distasteful to us;' whereas at the commencement of the discussion I added what your version has: 'Let us bind the righteous, for he is distasteful to us.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 137:7
verses.text: ' But you had been busy about some other matter, and seem to have listened to the words without attending to them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 137:8
verses.text: But now, since the day is drawing to a close, for the sun is about to set, I shall add one remark to what I have said, and conclude.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 137:9
verses.text: I have indeed made the very same remark already, but I think it would be right to bestow some consideration on it again.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 138:1
verses.text: Chapter 138 — Noah is a figure of Christ, who has regenerated us by water, and faith, and wood:  i-e:, the cross.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 138:2
verses.text: "You know, then, sirs," I said, "that God has said in Isaiah to Jerusalem: 'I saved thee in the deluge of Noah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 138:3
verses.text: ' By this which God said was meant that the mystery of saved men appeared in the deluge.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 138:4
verses.text: For righteous Noah, along with the other mortals at the deluge,  i-e:, with his own wife, his three sons and their wives, being eight in number, were a symbol of the eighth day, wherein Christ appeared when He rose from the dead, for ever the first in power.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 138:5
verses.text: For Christ, being the first-born of every creature, became again the chief of another race regenerated by Himself through water, and faith, and wood, containing the mystery of the cross; even as Noah was saved by wood when he rode over the waters with his household.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 138:6
verses.text: Accordingly, when the prophet says, 'I saved thee in the times of Noah,' as I have already remarked, he addresses the people who are equally faithful to God, and possess the same signs.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 138:7
verses.text: For when Moses had the rod in his hands, he led your nation through the sea.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 138:8
verses.text: And you believe that this was spoken to your nation only, or to the land.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 138:9
verses.text: But the whole earth, as the Scripture says, was inundated, and the water rose in height fifteen cubits above all the mountains: so that it is evident this was not spoken to the land, but to the people who obeyed Him: for whom also He had before prepared a resting-place in Jerusalem, as was previously demonstrated by all the symbols of the deluge; I mean, that by water, faith, and wood, those who are afore-prepared, and who repent of the sins which they have committed, shall escape from the impending judgment of God.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:1
verses.text: Chapter 139 — The blessings, and also the curse, pronounced by Noah were prophecies of the future.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:2
verses.text: "For another mystery was accomplished and predicted in the days of Noah, of which you are not aware.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:3
verses.text: It is this: in the blessings wherewith Noah blessed his two sons, and in the curse pronounced on his son's son.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:4
verses.text: For the Spirit of prophecy would not curse the son that had been by God blessed along with his brothers.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:5
verses.text: But since the punishment of the sin would cleave to the whole descent of the son that mocked at his father's nakedness, he made the curse originate with his son.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:6
verses.text: Now, in what he said, he foretold that the descendants of Shem would keep in retention the property and dwellings of Canaan: and again that the descendants of Japheth would take possession of the property of which Shem's descendants had dispossessed Canaan's descendants; and spoil the descendants of Shem, even as they plundered the sons of Canaan.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:7
verses.text: And listen to the way in which it has so come to pass.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:8
verses.text: For you, who have derived your lineage from Shem, invaded the territory of the sons of Canaan by the will of God; and you possessed it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:9
verses.text: And it is manifest that the sons of Japheth, having invaded you in turn by the judgment of God, have taken your land from you, and have possessed it.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:10
verses.text: Thus it is written: 'And Noah awoke from the wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him; and he said, Cursed be Canaan, the servant; a servant shall he be unto his brethren.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:11
verses.text: And he said, Blessed be the Lord God of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:12
verses.text: May the Lord enlarge Japheth, and let him dwell in the houses of Shem; and let Canaan be his servant.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:13
verses.text: ' Accordingly, as two peoples were blessed,—those from Shem, and those from Japheth,—and as the offspring of Shem were decreed first to possess the dwellings of Canaan, and the offspring of Japheth were predicted as in turn receiving the same possessions, and to the two peoples there was the one people of Canaan handed over for servants; so Christ has come according to the power given Him from the Almighty Father, and summoning men to friendship, and blessing, and repentance, and dwelling together, has promised, as has already been proved, that there shall be a future possession for all the saints in this same land.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 139:14
verses.text: And hence all men everywhere, whether bond or free, who believe in Christ, and recognise the truth in His own words and those of His prophets, know that they shall be with Him in that land, and inherit everlasting and incorruptible good.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:1
verses.text: Chapter 140 — In Christ all are free.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:2
verses.text: The Jews hope for salvation in vain because they are sons of Abraham.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:3
verses.text: "Hence also Jacob, as I remarked before, being himself a type of Christ, had married the two handmaids of his two free wives, and of them begat sons, for the purpose of indicating beforehand that Christ would receive even all those who amongst Japheth's race are descendants of Canaan, equally with the free, and would have the children fellow-heirs.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:4
verses.text: And we are such; but you cannot comprehend this, because you cannot drink of the living fountain of God, but of broken cisterns which can hold no water, as the Scripture says.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:5
verses.text: But they are cisterns broken, and holding no water, which your own teachers have digged, as the Scripture also expressly asserts, 'teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:6
verses.text: ' And besides, they beguile themselves and you, supposing that the everlasting kingdom will be assuredly given to those of the dispersion who are of Abraham after the flesh, although they be sinners, and faithless, and disobedient towards God, which the Scriptures have proved is not the case.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:7
verses.text: For if so, Isaiah would never have said this: 'And unless the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed, we would have been like Sodom and Gomorrah.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:8
verses.text: ' And Ezekiel: 'Even if Noah, and Jacob, and Daniel were to pray for sons or daughters, their request should not be granted.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:9
verses.text: ' 'But neither shall the father perish for the son, nor the son for the father; but every one for his own sin, and each shall be saved for his own righteousness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:10
verses.text: ' And again Isaiah says: 'They shall look on the carcases of them that have transgressed: their worm shall not cease, and their fire shall not be quenched; and they shall be a spectacle to all flesh.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:11
verses.text: ' And our Lord, according to the will of Him that sent Him, who is the Father and Lord of all, would not have said, 'They shall come from the east, and from the west, and shall sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:12
verses.text: But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 140:13
verses.text: ' Furthermore, I have proved in what has preceded, that those who were foreknown to be unrighteous, whether men or angels, are not made wicked by God's fault, but each man by his own fault is what he will appear to be.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 141:1
verses.text: Chapter 141 — Free-will in men and angels.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 141:2
verses.text: "But that you may not have a pretext for saying that Christ must have been crucified, and that those who transgressed must have been among your nation, and that the matter could not have been otherwise, I said briefly by anticipation, that God, wishing men and angels to follow His will, resolved to create them free to do righteousness; possessing reason, that they may know by whom they are created, and through whom they, not existing formerly, do now exist; and with a law that they should be judged by Him, if they do anything contrary to right reason: and of ourselves we, men and angels, shall be convicted of having acted sinfully, unless we repent beforehand.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 141:3
verses.text: But if the word of God foretells that some angels and men shall be certainly punished, it did so because it foreknew that they would be unchangeably wicked, but not because God had created them so.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 141:4
verses.text: So that if they repent, all who wish for it can obtain mercy from God: and the Scripture foretells that they shall be blessed, saying, 'Blessed is the man to whom the Lord imputeth not sin;' that is, having repented of his sins, that he may receive remission of them from God; and not as you deceive yourselves, and some others who resemble you in this, who say, that even though they be sinners, but know God, the Lord will not impute sin to them.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 141:5
verses.text: We have as proof of this the one fall of David, which happened through his boasting, which was forgiven then when he so mourned and wept, as it is written.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 141:6
verses.text: But if even to such a man no remission was granted before repentance, and only when this great king, and anointed one, and prophet, mourned and conducted himself so, how can the impure and utterly abandoned, if they weep not, and mourn not, and repent not, entertain the hope that the Lord will not impute to them sin? And this one fall of David, in the matter of Uriah's wife, proves, sirs," I said, "that the patriarchs had many wives, not to commit fornication, but that a certain dispensation and all mysteries might be accomplished by them; since, if it were allowable to take any wife, or as many wives as one chooses, and how he chooses, which the men of your nation do over all the earth, wherever they sojourn, or wherever they have been sent, taking women under the name of marriage, much more would David have been permitted to do this".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 141:7
verses.text: When I had said this, dearest Marcus Pompeius, I came to an end.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 142:1
verses.text: Chapter 142 — The Jews return thanks, and leave Justin.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 142:2
verses.text: Then Trypho, after a little delay, said, "You see that it was not intentionally that we came to discuss these points.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 142:3
verses.text: And I confess that I have been particularly pleased with the conference; and I think that these are of quite the same opinion as myself.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 142:4
verses.text: For we have found more than we expected, and more than it was possible to have expected.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 142:5
verses.text: And if we could do this more frequently, we should be much helped in the searching of the Scriptures themselves.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 142:6
verses.text: But since," he said, "you are on the eve of departure, and expect daily to set sail, do not hesitate to remember us as friends when you are gone".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 142:7
verses.text: "For my part," I replied, "if I had remained, I would have wished to do the same thing daily.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 142:8
verses.text: But now, since I expect, with God's will and aid, to set sail, I exhort you to give all diligence in this very great struggle for your own salvation, and to be earnest in setting a higher value on the Christ of the Almighty God than on your own teachers".

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 142:9
verses.text: After this they left me, wishing me safety in my voyage, and from every misfortune.

verses.name: Justin Martyr: Dialogue with Trypho 142:10
verses.text: And I, praying for them, said, "I can wish no better thing for you, sirs, than this, that, recognising in this way that intelligence is given to every man, you may be of the same opinion as ourselves, and believe that Jesus is the Christ of God".
